name: 12" Thin Pizza Dough Crust
directions: In a medium bowl combine half the flour, yeast, salt, oil and warm water (100 °F).
Mix until a smooth consistency is made then slowly add the remaining flour until it thickens.
Once dough is thick, remove from bowl to a lightly floured cutting board or similar. Knead for 2-3 minutes then place in another bowl and cover for 15 minutes.
Once it has risen, roll out to 12" diameter 1/8" or thinner thickness and place on a stone or cookie sheet.
Add your favorite toppings and bake.

name: 4 Ingredient Peanut Butter Fudge
directions: Melt butter in a microwave safe bowl for about 1 minute. Carefully remove from microwave.
Add peanut butter and mix together.
Once mixture is blended well, put back into microwave for another minute or until bubbles start forming (from boiling). Carefully remove from microwave and stir until smooth.
Add vanilla extract, mix together mixture.
Add powdered sugar and mix until well blended. If necessary, use your hands to knead like dough. Make sure powdered sugar isn't visible.
Roll mixture into 3/4-1" balls and let sit until cooled and firm.
Serve and enjoy.

name: 5-Ingredient Corn Salsa
directions: Cook corn according to package. Drain any excess water from corn.
In a medium bowl combine, corn, red onion, cilantro, jalapeños, lime juice, and salt.
Stir to combine all ingredients.

name: Acorn Squash Casserole
directions: Cut acorn squash in half and place in an oven safe dish upside down, with about an 1/2 inch of water. Bake on 350 °F (175 °C) for 45 minutes or till done (squash will be soft to the touch).
Add all the spices to the ground pork, mix well and brown in skillet till pink is gone. Set aside and let cool.
Dice apple and grate cheese.
When ground pork has cooled off somewhat add the freshly grated Parmesan cheese to it and mix.
Scrape the squash out of its skin using a spoon. Spread the puree like substance in an oven safe dish. Top with diced apple and the ground pork mixture.
Bake at 400 °F (205 °C) for about 30 minutes till cheese has melted and the top is medium brown.

name: Air-Fried Falafels
directions: Add chickpeas into a large bowl and cover with water. Drain the chickpeas and rinse under cold running water.

Add soaked chickpeas, chickpea flour, and seasonings into a food processor until well combined. Note: The texture of the chickpeas should be uneven and coarse with some slightly larger pieces still visible. The mixture should hold together when pressed it between fingers, but it shouldn't be completely puréed. If the mixture is too wet, add a little bit more chickpea flour. If it's too dry and crumbly, pulse it a little bit more.
Transfer the falafel mixture into a bowl, cover, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.

Scoop out 1-2 tablespoons of the mixture and roll it gently between hands into balls, approx. 1.5 inch in diameter. Avoid packing the balls too tightly or they will come out tough and dense. Repeat until all the falafel mixture is used up.
Preheat the air fryer to 370°F for 5 minutes.
Arrange the falafel balls in a single layer in the air fryer basket.
Cook for 13-15 minutes or until golden brown and crispy, then serve.

name: All Seed Crackers
directions: Mix together the 4 seeds in a bowl.
Mix together water, garlic, onion powder, salt and other herbs and spices to taste.
Pour water mixture into seed mixture. Stir until thick.
Spread mixture on a baking sheet with back of spoon to 1/4" thick.

Bake at 325 °F (165 °C) for 30 minutes. Remove and slice into crackers. Flip crackers with a spatula and bake for another 25-30 minutes. Watch carefully so they don't burn. Bottoms will be golden brown.
Allow to cool completely on baking sheet. Enjoy.

name: Almond and Coconut Bread
ingredients: 1/2 cup pure almond milk - unsweetened original
2 tsps baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Lightly grease a 9x13 inch pan.
Cream butter and sweetener until smooth while adding one egg at a time.
Add almond milk and vanilla.
In a separate bowl, combine the dry ingredients.
Stir the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients until creamy.
Spread the batter in the prepared pan and bake for 30 minutes.

name: Almond Coconut Cookies
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (165 °C).
Mix all ingredients.
Use 1 tablespoon measure to put rounded dough on covered with parchment paper cookie sheet.
Bake 18 minutes (makes 18 cookies).

name: Almond Cranberry Maple Quinoa Salad
directions: Combine white quinoa, red quinoa and 1 1/2 cups of water in a pot. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover pot and simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Remove pot from heat and allow quinoa to steam for another 10 minutes. Transfer quinoa to bowl, fluff and cool to room temperature.
Add cranberries, almonds and chopped scallions.
In a separate bowl, make the dressing: rice vinegar, olive oil, maple syrup and salt.
Add dressing to quinoa mixture and mix well.

name: Almond Shortbread Cookies
directions: Pre-heat oven at 350°F.
Mix all ingredients in a bowl. Scoop onto parchment lined sheet.
Bake for 8-10 minutes or until browned around the edges.

name: Almond-Tapioca Waffles
ingredients: 2 tsps baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
directions: Beat the egg with milk, olive oil, and sugar.
Add the remaining ingredients and mix well.
Pour the mixture in a lightly greased waffle iron and cook until golden.

name: Almost Sushi Salmon
directions: Marinate partially frozen salmon filet in yellow mustard, chopped capers, garlic, lemon juice, and lemon slices until defrosted or overnight in fridge. Bring salmon to room temperature and rinse off marinade and dry before cooking.
Start rice before salmon. Cook salmon on medium-high heat until desired doneness.
Serve salmon with cucumbers and rice.

name: Angel Blueberry Cupcakes
directions: Divide egg whites and let them come to room temperature, about 30 minutes.
In another bowl combine flour, corn starch and 1/2 cup of the sugar. Sift 3 times or whisk thoroughly to combine. You can also run the mixture through a food processor.

Add cream of tartar, vanilla and salt to egg whites. Beat on medium speed until soft peaks form. Gradually add the remaining sugar a tablespoon at a time, beating on high speed until stiff, glossy peaks form.
Gradually fold in the flour mixture about 1/4 cup at a time. Fold in blueberries and lemon peel.
Line muffin tin with paper cups and divide mixture evenly. Bake at 375 °F (190 °C) for 14-17 minutes or until they spring back when lightly touched.
Remove from pan immediately and cool on wire rack.

name: Angel Hair with Shrimp
directions: Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add onion, parsley, garlic, and carrots, stir well.
Add red pepper flakes, salt and pepper. Continue cooking about 5 minutes until onion is browned, stirring frequently.
Add marinara sauce and fresh basil. Cook 4 minutes stirring occasionally.
Meanwhile cook pasta according to package directions.
Place shrimp in skillet. Pour lemon juice and wine over shrimp. Cook 2 minutes
Drain pasta. Toss pasta with sauce and all the ingredients in skillet. Top with parmesan cheese and toasted almonds.

name: Apple Banana Muffins
directions: Mix the dry ingredients in a bowl.
Combine the wet ingredients and add to the dry mixture.
Put in lightly greased muffin tray.
Bake in preheated oven at 350°F for 15-20 minutes.

name: Apple Cinnamon Greek Yogurt
directions: Slice the apple into small bite-size pieces.
Add the Greek yogurt, apple slices, cinnamon, and then the raisins.
Mix and enjoy.

name: Apple Protein Muffins
ingredients: 2 scoops super advanced whey protein - vanilla
5 tsps baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
directions: Whisk together applesauce, eggs, yogurt, and honey.
Blend dry ingredients. Stir into wet ingredients
Wash and chop apple. Add to mixture.
Scoop 1/4 cup into each section of cupcake pan.
Bake at 400°F for 13-15 minutes. Perform toothpick test. Let it cool and serve.

name: Apple Pumpkin Muffins
directions: Sift then mix the dry ingredients in a bowl.
Beat the wet ingredients together.
Combine the two mixtures then add the grated apples.
Divide the batter evenly into 12 muffin cups.
Bake in an oven preheated to 350°F for 25-30 minutes.

name: Arugula Skirt Steak Salad
ingredients: 16 oz beef inside skirt steak (lean only, trimmed to 1/4" fat)
directions: Cook onion in balsamic and brown sugar set aside.
Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil and heat steak seasoned with pepper and salt.
Prepare arugula and tomatoes.
Mix red wine vinegar and olive oil for dressing.
Toss all of ingredients together.

name: Asian Burgers
directions: In a very large bowl combine hoisin sauce, onion, Chinese five spice, and crushed red pepper. Add beef, mix well. Shape into five 1/2" thick patties.
Preheat grill to medium. Place patties on grill and grill for 10-13 minutes turning once.
Serve.

name: Asian Red Cabbage Slaw
directions: Toss together cabbage, scallions and baby carrots.
To make the dressing, whisk together hot chili sesame oil, rice vinegar, soy sauce, white vinegar and sesame oil.
Pour dressing over vegetables and toss.
If time allows, let marinate a few hours or overnight.
Note: top with toasted sesame seeds if desired. For the dressing lime juice, minced garlic, grated fresh ginger and cilantro can also be added. A great accompaniment to sesame noodles.

name: Asian Slaw with Asian Dressing
directions: In a mason jar combine: rice vinegar, canola oil, sesame seed oil, soy sauce, salt, and pepper. Shake to fully combine.
In a medium bowl combine: cabbage, yellow bell pepper, grated carrots, and snow peas. Toss to combine.
Pour the dressing over the cabbage mixture and toss to coat. Serve.

name: Au Gratin Potatoes
directions: Thinly slice potatoes.
In a large, deep dish pan, heat cream and spices over medium heat. Add potatoes, and move frequently for 10-12 minutes, until potatoes begin to soften.
Add bacon.
Sauté leeks in separate pan.
Layer 1/2 potatoes, leeks, and cheese. Repeat, then top with seasoned bread crumbs.
Bake at 400 °F (205 °C) for 20 minutes. Let rest for 10 minutes.
Serve with steamed veggies.

name: Avocado, Berries & Spinach Smoothie
directions: Peel and chop the avocado.
Mix everything in the blender.
Put in tall glass and serve.

name: Avocado Chips
directions: Mix all ingredients.
Spoon into 6 large flat crackers. You can make smaller if you wish.
Bake at 325 °F (165 °C) for 20 minutes.

name: Avocado Egg Salad
directions: Boil and peel eggs. Mash in a bowl.
Scoop out avocado and add to eggs. Add remaining ingredients.
Mash, stir and mix all together.
Note: serve on bread, with your favorite salad, in a wrap or with ham.

name: Avocado Ice Cream
directions: Mash the avocados using blender.
Beat the cream until stiff.
Gently fold all the ingredients in a container.
Freeze for at least 2 hours before serving.

name: Baby Marrow & Mushroom Bake
directions: Thickly chop onion, cut zucchini in quarters, mushrooms in halves, broccoli in small flowerets and finely chop the garlic and chili.
Place in oven dish (with lid), pour over olive oil and season to taste.
Bake in oven at 355 °F (180 °C) for 30 minutes and serve.

name: Bacon and Cheese Stuffed Mushrooms
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).
Take the stems out of mushrooms, reserving 4 of the stems. Clean mushrooms, set aside.
Chop onion and reserved stems.
Fry bacon until crisp, reserving grease.
Cook onion and stems in grease until tender.
Crumble bacon into soft cream cheese.
Scoop some of mixture into each mushroom cap.
Bake for about 10-15 minutes on baking sheet, and then broil to brown the tops.

name: Bacon Breakfast Taquitos
directions: Preheat oven to 375 °F (190 °C).  Spray baking pan with nonstick spray.
Cook 1 strip of bacon according to package directions.
In a large microwave-safe mug sprayed with Pam, microwave 1/3 cup of egg substitute for 45 seconds.  Stir and microwave for another 45 seconds, or until set.
Mix in cheese.  Chop or crumble bacon and stir into mixture.
Place tortillas between 2 damp paper towels.  Microwave for 15 seconds, or until warm and pliable.
Evenly distribute egg mixture between two tortillas.  Tightly roll each tortilla and place seam side down in the baking pan. Lightly spray with Pam.  Bake until crispy, 10-12 minutes.
Serve with salsa.
Note: you can also make these in a toaster oven so that you don't have to heat up the big oven.

name: Bacon, Egg & Cheese Frittata
ingredients: 1/4 cup shredded fat free mozzarella cheese
directions: Pre-heat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).
Cook and crumble bacon and stir fry vegetables, no oil.
Whisk eggs and sour cream in a 9" pie plate sprayed with non-stick cooking spray.
Stir in crumbled bacon, vegetables and cheese.
Bake for 30 minutes or until top is golden brown.

name: Bacon Jalapeño Poppers
directions: Preheat oven to 375 °F (175 °C).
Cut jalapeños in half. Remove seeds.
Soften cream cheese, add cheddar cheese and salsa verde. Stir.
Microwave bacon for approximately 3 minutes or 30 seconds per slice. Cut in half.
Stuff cream cheese mixture into peppers.
Top with half slice of bacon.
Bake 15 minutes
Broil for 2-3 more minutes.

name: Bacon Swiss Risotto
directions: Sauté onions and butter over medium-high heat until edges become translucent.
Add rice and sauté until fully translucent.

Add chicken stock 1/3-3/4 cups at a time, while keeping remainder of broth hot. Stir frequently after each addition of broth until fully absorbed before adding more. Continue to add broth until rice is cooked al dente.
Add bacon and garlic, stir, and continue cooking with broth until rice is tender.
Remove from heat, stir in cheese, top with parsley if desired.

name: Bacon Wrapped Chicken
directions: Slice chicken in half so that you have 4 pieces.
Spread avocado evenly across the chicken.
Spread 1 tablespoon of salsa on each piece.
Wrap each with bacon.
Bake at 350 °F (175 °C) for about 30 minutes or until chicken reads 160 °F (70 °C).

name: Bacon Wrapped Jalapeno Pepper Poppers
directions: Cut stems off of peppers and cut them all in half longways.  Remove the seeds and membranes from peppers.
Mix cheddar cheese with cream cheese.  Fill each pepper with the cream cheese mixture.
Wrap 1/2 slice bacon around each pepper half.  Place on a foiled (cooking spray such as Pam) lined baking sheet.
Place in a 450° F (230° C). oven for 10-15 minutes or until bacon is fully cooked.
Remove and serve when cool enough to safely eat.

name: Bacon Wrapped Meatballs
directions: Preheat oven to 375 °F (190 °C). Line a baking sheet with non-stick foil.
Mix all ingredients except bacon together in bowl.
Roll mix into 12 balls.
Cut bacon slices in half and then wrap each ball in bacon and place on baking sheet.
Cook for 35 minutes.

name: Bagels with Cranberry
ingredients: 1 tsp baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
directions: Mix the dry ingredients then add yogurt and cranberries.
Form into equal-sized bagels and place on a baking sheet.
Bake in preheated oven at 350°F for 25 minutes.

name: Baked Cashew Chicken Strips
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (220 °C).
Prepare baking sheet by covering in aluminium and spraying with 0 calorie oil spray.
Put egg and a teaspoon of water in shallow bowl and beat well.
Finely chop cashews. In shallow bowl combine cashews, panko bread crumbs, salt, paprika, pepper and garlic salt.
Lightly salt and pepper each chicken tenderloin. Dip tenderloin in egg mixture to completely cover. Then dip tender in cashew panko mixture to completely cover.
Place all tenders on baking sheet and spray tops with 0 calorie oil spray.
Place baking sheet in oven for 25-35 minutes until light golden brown and chicken is completely cooked.

name: Baked Elbow Macaroni
directions: Cook pasta according to directions.
In a large skillet, brown onion and ground beef over medium heat. Add spaghetti sauce and simmer 15 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C). Spray 9"X13" baking pan with cooking spray.
Layer 1/2 of the elbows, provolone cheese, sour cream, 1/2 sauce mixture, remaining elbows, mozzarella cheese and remaining sauce mixture. Top with Parmesan cheese.
Bake for 30 minutes or until cheeses are melted.
Note: you can substitute for any pasta.

name: Baked Oatmeal Cupcakes
directions: Preheat oven to 375 °F (230 °C).  Prepare muffin tins with liners or non-stick spray.
Combine dry ingredients in one bowl and wet ingredients in a second bowl.
Add wet ingredients to dry ingredients and stir to combine.
Spoon batter into 32 muffin tins and cook for 25 minutes. Cool on wire rack.
Note: can be frozen.

name: Baked Sweet Potato Fries
directions: Preheat the oven to 425 °F (220 °C).

Cut the sweet potatoes into long French fries strips. First start by cutting off the edge of one side and place the potato with that side down, so that it doesn't roll around. Cut into 1/4 inch slices, and then turn the potato over and cut them again so that each fry is about the same size. Leave the skin on.
In a tiny cup, mix olive oil and honey really well with a fork. Pour mixture over the fries and coat them evenly. It helps to put them in a bowl and then toss them around.
Place into oven and bake for 30 minutes.
Note: goes great with sandwiches, soups, burgers, steaks. Basically a wonderful starch for any lunch or dinner meal.

name: Baked Sweet Potato Wedges
directions: Peel sweet potato and cut into wedges.
Toss sweet potato wedges in extra virgin olive oil and garlic pepper.
Spray cooking pan with non stick spray.
Place in pan and bake at 400 °F (200 °C) for about 40 to 45 minutes.
Check sweet potatoes at least once and flip to prevent burning.
Remove sweet potatoes and allow to cool and enjoy.

name: Baked Sweet Potato Wedges
directions: Preheat oven to 400 °F (200 °C).
Peel and cut sweet potatoes into wedges.
In bowl mix together wedges and rest of the other ingredients.
On a tin foil lined cooking tray, spread out wedges and bake for 25 minutes or until tender and golden.
Serve.

name: Baked Turkey Meatballs
directions: Preheat oven to 400 °F (205 °C). Lightly spray a baking sheet with Pam.
In a bowl, mix all ingredients together thoroughly with hands.
Roll into 20 meatballs and place on pan.
Bake until golden brown, about 20 minutes to until cooked through.

name: Balsamic & brown Sugar Pork Chops
directions: Place the pork chops in the bottom of a glass baking dish. Sprinkle some salt and pepper to taste on both sides of the pork chops. Then drizzle the balsamic vinegar over the top. Add 1 teaspoon of brown sugar on top of each pork chop and spread into the vinegar. Let marinate for at least 30 minutes in the fridge.
Prepare rice as directed on package.
Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C). Bake the pork chops 30-40 minutes, or until cooked through. Cooking time will depend on the thickness of the chop. Prepare a vegetable side.
Serve balsamic and brown sugar pork chops with a side of vegetables and rice.

name: Balsamic Chicken & Vegetables
directions: In a small bowl, stir together salad dressing, balsamic vinegar, honey, and crushed red peppers.  Set aside.

In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high. Add chicken; cook 5-6 minutes or until chicken is tender and no longer pink. Add half of the dressing mixture to skillet; stir to coat. Transfer chicken to a serving platter; cover and keep warm.
Add asparagus and carrot to skillet. Cook and stir for 3-4 minutes or until asparagus is crisp-tender; transfer to serving platter.
Stir remaining dressing mixture; add to skillet. Cook and stir 1 minute, scraping up browned bits from bottom of skillet. Drizzle the dressing mixture over chicken and vegetables.
If desired sprinkle with chopped tomato.

name: Balsamic Vinegar Kabobs
directions: Cut your chicken breasts into large chunks.
Mix the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, ginger, and basil.
Marinade the chicken in a resealable plastic bag or any container. Refrigerate for at least an hour.
Skewer the chicken and chopped nectarines.
Place the kabobs on the grill and cook until tender, flipping halfway through.

name: Banana Blast
directions: Place all ingredients in blender with a couple ice cubes. Blend until it's smooth.
Drink immediately or store in refrigerator. Drink within 48 hours or it will separate.

name: Banana Bread with Cream Cheese Filling
directions: Pre-heat oven at 350°F.
In a bowl mash bananas. Mix 1 egg, brown sugar, white sugar, butter, vanilla extract, and sour cream.
Add flour, salt, and baking soda.
To prepare the cream cheese filling, mix the remaining egg and cream cheese together.
Pour half of the banana batter into a greased 9" x 5" loaf pan, then pour the cream cheese over. Add the remaining of the batter on top.
Bake for 50 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Allow to cool for 15 minutes before serving.

name: Banana-Chocolate Breakfast Muffins
directions: Place flax seed in a small cup with 2 tbsp of water, let sit while you get everything else out. This'll be the egg replacement.
Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).
Grind oats in a food processor/blender to make a flour, should measure out to 1 cup of flour.
Whisk wet ingredients together.
Combine all dry ingredients and whisk into wet. Fold in chocolate chips.
Grease a muffin pan and dole the batter out. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out mostly clean.
Serve with nothing or any desired condiments, I used peanut butter.

name: Banana Chocolate Waffles
directions: Blend the eggs, dates, banana, and milk.
Add the cocoa powder and coconut flour. Stir well.
Cook in in waffle maker until set and firm.

name: Banana Cottage Cheese Bread with Chocolate Chips
directions: Mash the bananas and beat with cottage cheese.
Grind chia seeds to powder and add 6 tablespoons water to make a paste.
Mix the wet ingredients and dry ingredients in separate bowls.
Combine the two mixtures until smooth. Fold in the chips.
Pour in a lightly greased baking dish.
Bake in an oven preheated to 350°F for 50-60 minutes.
Let cool before slicing.

name: Banana Kiwi Super Smoothie
directions: Chop fruits.
Blend all ingredients for 1-2 minutes.
Serve.

name: Banana Muffins
ingredients: 1 tsp baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
directions: Mash the bananas and mix with beaten eggs and egg whites.
Add the remaining ingredients. Mix well.
Distribute mixture in muffin tins.
Bake in preheated oven at 355°F for 25-30 minutes.

name: Banana Muffins
directions: Preheat oven to 375 °F (190 °C). Lightly grease 5 muffin cups or line with muffin papers.
Mix flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, oatmeal and salt in a large bowl.
Beat bananas, sugar, egg, vanilla and melted butter in another bowl.
Stir banana mixture into flour mixture just until moistened.
Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups.
Bake in preheated oven until golden and tops spring back when lightly pressed, 18-20 minutes.

name: Banana Muffins with Chocolate and Peanut Butter Chips
ingredients: 3 tsps baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
directions: Mash the bananas and beat with wet ingredients.
Grind the oats to powder. Mix the dry ingredients.
Combine the two mixtures until smooth.
Fold in the chocolate and peanut butter chips.
Distribute evenly on lightly greased muffin tins.
Bake in preheated oven at 400°F for 20 minutes.
Let cool before removing from muffin tins.

name: Banana Oat Cookies
ingredients: 1 tbsp semi-sweet mini chocolate chip morsels
1 cup dry quick cooking rolled oats
directions: Smash banana to liquid like consistently.
Add oats until thick.
Add chocolate chips or other add-ins.
Bake at 350 on parchment paper for 15 minutes.

name: Banana Oat Cookies
directions: Mash the bananas in a bowl. Add oats and chocolate chips.
Form flat balls and place in a parchment-lined tray.
Bake at pre-heated oven at 350°F for 12-15 minutes.

name: Banana Oatmeal Choc Chip Cookies
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).
Mash ripened bananas and mix ingredients in a large bowl.
Place heaps of batter onto a non-stick cookie sheet.
Bake for 15 minutes or until cookie browns.

name: Banana Oatmeal Cookies
directions: Pre-heat oven at 350°F.
Mash banana in a bowl. Finely chop walnuts. Mix together.
Add oats, vanilla, cinnamon, and salt.
Line baking tray with parchment paper. Measure out batter by tablespoons and flatten each into a round.
Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven then reduce temperature to 300°F. Flip cookies and bake for another 10 minutes. Let it cool in rack.

name: Banana Oatmeal Muffins
ingredients: 3 cups sprouted apple cinnamon instant oatmeal
1 tsp baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
directions: Mash bananas then mix with dry ingredients.
Add wet ingredients and blend until smooth.
Distribute in muffin cups evenly.
Bake in preheated oven at 350°F for 30-35 minutes.

name: Banana Oatmeal Pancakes
ingredients: 1 tbsp plant butter with olive oil
2 tsps baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
directions: Mix all ingredients (except plant butter) in a blender.
Grease a skillet with plant butter then pour mixture to form circles.
Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side until golden brown.

name: Banana Oatmeal Pancakes
ingredients: 1/4 cup almond breeze unsweetened vanilla milk
1 tsp baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
directions: Blend all ingredients together (except oil, cherries, and honey) for 30 seconds or until incorporated.
Let sit for 2 minutes while pan is heating.
Add oil to the pan. Scoop 1/4 cup batter for each pancake. Cook for 2 mins on each side or until golden brown.
Top with cherries and honey.

name: Banana Oat Protein Cookies
directions: Mash the bananas in a bowl. Add other ingredients.
Form flat balls and place in a parchment-lined tray.
Bake at pre-heated oven at 350°F for 8-10 minutes.

name: Banana Peach Popsicle
directions: Put the peaches (peeled if you want) and the banana in a food processor and blend them.
Pour the peach/banana juice into popsicle moulds. If they're medium sized it should probably fill 6-10.
Freeze until completely solid and enjoy.

name: Banana Walnut Muffins
directions: Sift together flour, baking soda and salt. Set aside.
Using mixer, beat together sugar, coconut oil and vanilla extract. Beat for 5 minutes at moderate speed until light and fluffy.
With mixer running, add in eggs. Mash bananas with fork. Add bananas to mixer. Mix well.
Stir in flour mixture, alternating with buttermilk. Mix only enough to moisten well; do not over beat. Stir in walnuts.
Bake at 350 °F (175 °C) for 20-25 minutes.

name: Banana Wheat Waffles
directions: Mix all ingredients.
Cook in waffle maker.
Top with peanut butter and/or real maple syrup.

name: Banh Mi Meatballs
ingredients: 1/3 cup panko crispy plain bread crumbs
directions: Preheat oven to 375 °F (190 °C). Line a baking sheet with foil and spray with Pam.
In a large bowl, stir ingredients until well mixed.
Shape into 30 (1 inch) balls and place in pan.
Bake 25-30 minutes or until meatballs are no longer pink in center.

name: Barley & Mung Bean Salad
directions: Prepare a barley and mung beans according to package directions.
Drain and then mix with the other ingredients. Add salt and pepper to taste.

name: Bean & Sausage Soup
directions: Combine all ingredients in slow cooker.
Cook on high 3 hours, turn down to low.
Cook 6-8 hours or until beans are done.
Serve with a dash (or 3!) of hot sauce and enjoy.
Note: this keeps and freezes beautifully and is a great go-to lunch to take to work and/or perfect to cook in advance and pull out on nights when you don't feel like making dinner.

name: Bean Soup
directions: Add potatoes and rinsed rice to the water and start to boil. Meanwhile, grate the carrot and chop the onion.
Add olive oil to the heated skillet over medium heat, then add onions and carrots. Stir and cook for 3-5 minutes until soft.
Add butter beans, half of the onions and carrots from the skillet and little bit of liquid from boiling potatoes to the blender and blend until smooth.
Add the rest of the carrots and onions, blended ingredients, tomato paste, and bouillon base to the potatoes (make sure they already soft) and boil for another 5 minutes. Voila.

name: Beef Brisket Stew with Daikon Radish
ingredients: 48 oz boneless beef brisket (lean only eaten)
8 cups cooked japanese (daikon) radish (fat added in cooking)
directions: Boil beef with ginger, garlic, and salt for 1 1/2 hours or until tender.
Add chopped daikon and boil for about 10 minutes.
Add mustard greens and cook for 5 minutes. Turn off heat then serve in a bowl.

name: Beef Cutlets
directions: Dice onion and saute until golden in color on medium heat. Take off the heat and let it cool.
Take ground beef, add 2 eggs, salt, pepper, dried parsley and mix. Additional seasonings could be added to taste.
Mix in a cooled onion.
Put bread crumbs on a plate.
Wet hands and take 1 full tablespoon of the mix and form an oval cutlet. Roll in breadcrumbs. Set on the plate. Continue until mixture ends.

Take a large frying pan, add vegetable oil, heat on high until well heated. Put cutlets in and reduce heat to medium. Turn once or twice while cooking. Should be heated until 150 °F (65 °C) is reached inside the cutlet.
Note: serve as an appetizer or side dish, great with mashed potatoes and green salad or with steamed vegetables.

name: Beef Panang Curry
directions: Heat curry paste until oil is seeping. Add coconut milk unsweetened.
Add beef and cook until surface is brown.
Add the rest of coconut milk and some water to cover the meat. Cook until tender.
Add fish sauce, sugar, and bell pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Transfer to a bowl and garnish as desired.

name: Beef Salad
directions: Chop the celery stalks, chop the cherry tomatoes in half, dice the cheese.
Steam the vegetables (broccoli, mushrooms, and celery) for a couple of minutes. They should still be a bit hard, not totally cooked.
Mix the steamed vegetables in your serving bowl along with the cherry tomatoes, cheese and shredded beef.
Dress with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Add any pepper if desired.

name: Beef Stroganoff
directions: Cut the beef into bite size strips and using a meat mallet pound very thin.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add beef and cook stirring every 2 minutes or until no longer pink.
Stir in sauce mix and water.
Bring to boil, cover and reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat. Stir in sour cream. Sprinkle parsley flakes and serve.

name: Beefy Cornbread Casserole
ingredients: 2 tbsps light butter with canola oil
4 oz part skim shredded mozzarella cheese
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C). Spray a 13"x9" baking dish with cooking spray.
Meanwhile heat a large skillet to medium heat. Add onions and saute until the onions are soft. Add ground beef and cook until no longer pink.
Stir in soup, corn, chili powder, seasoning blend, and water. Pour into baking dish.
In a separate bowl, mix cornbread mix, egg, butter, and milk together. Spread the batter evenly over the top of the meat mixture.
Bake 20-25 minutes until cornbread is baked. Sprinkle cheese on top and broil 3-5 minutes until cheese is melted.

name: Beer Bread
directions: Preheat oven to 350° F (175° C).
Combine flour, sugar, and beer in a large bowl and mix thoroughly
Grease 9x5" loaf pan using cooking spray
Pour dough into loaf pan and bake for 50-60 minutes.

name: Beet and Hummus Salad
directions: Cook quinoa according to packaging.
Chop vegetables.
Arrange everything in a bowl or plate then serve.

name: Beet Feta Salad
directions: Boil beets until soft, then peel.
Slice peeled beets, Add olive oil and vinegar.
Mix in feta and mint.
Cool and serve.

name: Beet Pesto Salad
directions: Rinse and peel beets. Place on foil with garlic cloves. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
Wrap foil tightly about beets and garlic. Roast in a 400 °F (205 °C) oven for 1 hour.
Remove beets and allow to cool. Place garlic, basil, pine nuts, and 2 tablespoons olive oil in food processor and blend until smooth.
Chop beets into 1/2" cubes. Combine cubed beets, feta cheese, and pesto in a bowl and mix to coat.
Allow composed salad to cool in fridge for 4 hours to allow flavors to mingle. Enjoy.

name: Beetroot Salad with Walnuts & Prunes
directions: Boil, (or steam, bake or microwave) beetroots whole in their skin. Check readiness by inserting a knife blade into the thickest part of the vegetable. When cool enough to handle, peel. Then grate on medium grater.
Finely chop garlic, add to beetroot. Thinly dice prunes (previously soften, if too dry) and chop walnuts, add to beetroot mixture.
Add mayonnaise, mix well. Check for salt. Allow to stand for 15 minutes before serving.
Garnish with some walnuts, prunes (or parsley and grated hard cheese)
Note: will keep for several days in the fridge.

name: Belgian Waffles
directions: Put egg yolks in a mixing bowl, (egg whites in the other bowl), add sugar and soft butter to egg yolks and beat with a food mixer.
Add milk, keep mixing and then add sifted flour. Mix thoroughly.
In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites to a foam condition and then mix with other ingredients. Batter is ready to bake. Bake in a waffle maker.

name: Big Beef Pot Pie
ingredients: 10 1/2 oz 98% fat free condensed cream of mushroom soup
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).  Spray a 13"x9" baking pan with cook spray.
Spray a large skillet with cooking spray and heat to medium-high. Add beef and season with original seasoning blend and pepper. Cook and stir until cooked through.
Add the thawed vegetables, water, soup, and mix well. Evenly transfer to the baking pan. Bake until hot and bubbly, about 15 minutes.
Firmly pinch the edges of the crescent dough to make one seamless sheet. Place dough over the meat mixture and carefully stretch to cover.
Bake until dough is fully cooked and golden brown, about 18 minutes.

name: Biscuits
ingredients: 8 tsps baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
directions: Mix dry ingredients.
Gradually add wet ingredients. Knead until incorporated.
Roll out the dough and cut into rounds using biscuit cutter.
Arrange in baking sheet and cook in pre-heated oven at 450°F for 10-15 minutes.

name: Black Bean and Corn Salad
directions: In a bowl, combine beans, red pepper, corn, celery, onions and dry parsley.
To mix dressing: whisk together the vinegar, mustard, sweetener, salt and pepper.  Whisk in oil and water.
Pour over salad and mix well.
Cover and refrigerate.

name: Blackbean and Quinoa Salad
directions: Heat the oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
Stir in the onion and garlic, and saute until lightly browned.
Mix quinoa into the saucepan and cover with chicken/vegetable broth.
Season with cumin, paprika, cajun seasoning, salt, and pepper. Bring the mixture to a boil.
Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 20 minutes.
Stir frozen corn into the saucepan, and continue to simmer about 5 minutes until heated through.
Mix in the black beans and cilantro.

name: Blackberry Muffins with Cheesecake Stuffing
directions: Mix together cream cheese, vanilla and powdered sugar with mixer.
Shape into loaf, wrap with Saran wrap and put in freezer for an hour or until moderately hard.
Mix together flour, salt and baking powder in one bowl and set aside.
Mix together eggs, flaxseed, agave nectar and milk in another bowl and slowly add together. Finally add in frozen blackberries
Spray muffin tins with non-stick spray and put approximately 1 tablespoon batter in each.
Slice cream cheese loaf in 14 pieces and place one in each muffin tin then cover with remaining batter.
Cook 18-20 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean.

name: Blueberry Muffins
directions: Pre-heat oven at 350°F.
In a large bowl, mix wet ingredients.
Add dry ingredients while stirring.
Fold in blueberries.
Scoop into muffin tray.
Bake for 20-30 minutes or until toothpick inserted comes out clean.

name: Blueberry Muffins
directions: Pre-heat oven at 350°F.
Mix dry ingredients together.
Add wet ingredients and stir to incorporate.
Transfer batter to muffin tray. Bake for 20 minutes or perform toothpick test as needed.

name: Blueberry Pancakes
directions: Combine milk with vinegar in a medium bowl and set aside for 5 minutes to "sour".
Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large mixing bowl.
Whisk egg and butter into "soured" milk.
Pour the flour mixture into the wet ingredients and whisk until lumps are gone.
Gently fold in blueberries using rubber spatula.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat, and coat with cooking spray. Pour 1/4 cupfuls of batter onto the skillet, and cook until bubbles appear on the surface. Flip with a spatula, and cook until browned on the other side.

name: Blueberry Pancakes
ingredients: 80 ml pure almond milk - unsweetened original
directions: Combine the dry ingredients.
Add the wet ingredients.
Gently fold the blueberries in.
Cook the pancakes in a non-stick skillet until golden brown.

name: Blueberry Pancakes
directions: Beat the eggs with almond milk.
Add the pancake mix and blueberries. Stir carefully.
Heat a non-stick pan and ladle mixture to form circles.
Cook until both sides are golden.

name: Blueberry Protein Shake
ingredients: 1 rounded scoop french vanilla creme protein powder
directions: Put all the ingredients in the blender.
Add ice if you want to (around 5-10 cubes).
Blend for 10-15 seconds.

name: Blue & Green Smoothie
directions: Add a yogurt and frozen blueberries, blend.
Add unsweetened almond milk and spinach, blend.
Add vanilla protein powder and 1/3 cup ice, blend.

name: Boca Burger Taco
directions: Spray a pan lightly with extra virgin olive oil, and brown one Boca burger over medium heat, turning occasionally, for 6 minutes.
With your spatula, cut the Boca burger into two halves once it has cooked enough to separate easily.
Cut a slice of cheese into two halves.
With about one minute remaining, place a corn tortilla on the pan, just to soften and brown very slightly. Turn after 30 seconds, and place the cheese halves on the tortilla.
Use the spatula to place the tortilla flat on a plate. Add shredded lettuce and salsa.
Put the Boca burger on top, and fold the whole thing to eat it as a taco.

name: Bone Broth Veggie Egg Drop Soup
ingredients: 2 tbsps dehydrated diced red & green bell peppers
directions: Pour broth into pot. Add all vegetables. Bring to boil, turn heat down. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Scramble the eggs. Set aside. Melt the chicken fat. Pour into soup. Stir.
Slowly pour the scrambled eggs into pot, in a circular movement. Do not stir. Let eggs set. Season with salt & pepper to taste. Serve.

Note: add various seasonings or flavors to taste such as Italian seasoning. For an Asian flavor add ginger, aminos and sesame oil. For hot and sour additionally add vinegar and chili with garlic paste.

name: Bounty Balls
directions: Put everything in the blender except coconut oil and chocolate and blitz, divide into 26, using a heaped teaspoon.
Roll into balls and pop in the fridge for an hour until hard.
Melt chocolate and coconut oil together.
Roll the cold coconut balls in dark chocolate and pop back in the fridge for another hour.

name: Braised Beef Chuck Roast with Cabbage
ingredients: 48 oz beef chuck (arm pot roast, lean only, trimmed to 1/8" fat)
directions: Heat large cast iron pot on medium heat, add vegetable oil.

Cut onion into 1/4" pieces, add to pot. After 5 minutes add garlic and shredded carrots, mix well, cook for 10 more minutes and add all spices and 1 cup of water. Cook covered for 30-45 minutes, add water as needed, preventing vegetables from burning. At this time the mixture should be a consistency of mush.

Cube meat into 1" pieces, add to the pot, mix so that meat is covered in mush, add water to 1/2" over meat, cover and cook on medium for additional 80 minutes. Add water as necessary to prevent meat from sticking to the bottom of the pot.

Cut cabbage into 1" squares, add to the top of the meat, cover and cook for another 15-20 minutes  Mix meat and cabbage and cook uncovered to reduce most water, mixing regularly, about 20 minutes. Adjust spices if necessary and serve.

name: Braised Butternut Squash with Garlic
directions: Peel butternut squash and cut into 1" to 1/2" cubes.
In large skillet, saute garlic in olive oil over medium high until beginning to brown.
Add stock, squash, and pepper to taste (salt as well for people without sodium restrictions). Cover, turn heat to low, and cook until squash is tender (about 15-20 minutes), stirring once or twice.

Uncover squash and turn heat up to medium. Add freshly minced rosemary and cook until liquid is completely reduced and squash is getting nice and brown. Shake pan occasionally during this step (stir only if needed). If you would like further browning (caramelization) after liquid is reduced, turn heat down to low. Serve immediately.

name: Brazilian Cheese Bread
directions: Preheat oven to 400 °F (205 °C). Grease 2 mini-muffin tins with spray on oil.
Incorporate all ingredients into blender and pulse until smooth. You may need to use a spatula to scrape down the sides of the blender so that everything gets blended well.
Bake in the oven for 15-20 minutes, until all puffy and just lightly browned.
Remove from oven and let cool on a rack for a few minutes.
Eat while warm or save to reheat later.

name: "Breaded" Chicken Shake & Bake
directions: Remove skin and bone from chicken thigh. Beat the meat with a meat beater until about 1/3" thick. If piece gets too wide to handle, cut it in two and continue beating to the desired thickness.

Put the pork skins in a zip lock bag and close the bag carefully so there wouldn't be much air left in it. With a rolling pin, crush the pork skins until they resemble breadcrumbs. Add the garlic powder and salt to the pork rinds, close the bag and shake well.

Line a baking pan with aluminum foil and spray lightly with cooking spray. Take a piece of chicken, put it in the zip lock bag with the crushed pork skins, making sure it's not folded, close the bag, then holding on one corner shake so the meat will be covered in the pork skin crumbs. Place on baking pan. Repeat with the remaining pieces of chicken.

Bake at  400 °F (205 °C) for 20-30 minutes or until pork skin crumbs are dark golden (depending on the oven). Do not overcook. To verify if meat is done, poke with a fork - if the juice runs clear not pink, it's done.
Serve warm with a side dish of your choice. Can be kept in the fridge and nuked when needed.

Note: if you want to add an extra "zing", take the pan out of the oven, drop a spoonful of marinara sauce or just plain crushed tomatoes on each piece and spread it with the spoon to cover the whole piece leaving about 1/4" from the edges free of tomatoes; sprinkle a dash of crushed basil on each piece, and top with a spoonful of shredded cheese. Put back in the oven for an extra 5-7 minutes. Serve warm.

name: Breakfast Bars
directions: Thaw and purée berries.
Mix ingredients.
Bake at 350 °F (175 °C), allow cooling before cutting.

name: Breakfast Bowl with Eggs, Cheese, Bacon & Sausage
directions: Cook bacon in oven, pan or microwave until crispy. Place on plate covered with a paper towel to absorb grease.
Cook sausage in pan either crumbled or in patties until done. Place on plate covered with a paper towel to absorb grease.
Crack eggs into a large measuring cup or bowl. Add egg whites, heavy cream, salt and pepper, then whisk until well blended.
Spray large pan with olive oil cooking spray. Turn large stove eye on to medium-low or 2.8-3 on digital stove. Add water to pan.

Pour egg mixture into pan. Once starts to firm, start scraping the eggs to the center and allow raw egg mixture to fill in around them. Continue to do this until all egg mixture is firm. Cut the eggs into 6 squares and flip over to ensure done on both sides.
Place a square of eggs into a bowl and then top with crumbled sausage, bacon, cheddar and Parmesan cheese.

Note: switch out cheese for any kind you like. Switch out sausage and bacon for turkey sausage and bacon, or Canadian bacon or ham. Top with chopped tomato, onion, peppers, mushroom, salsa or pico de gallo.

name: Breakfast Casserole
directions: Spread the hash browns in a baking dish.
Add chopped vegetables, sausage, and half of cheese.
Beat the eggs with milk and season as desired, then pour over.
Sprinkle the remaining cheese and bake in preheated oven at 350°F for 45 minutes.

name: Breakfast Frittatas
directions: Chop kale, basil, and zucchini into small pieces. Cook kale, fresh basil, and diced zucchini in a pan until the kale begins to wilt.
Dice tomato and mozzarella. Place in greased oven dish and add contents from pan.
Crack one dozen eggs into a bowl and scramble. Add half and half and stir.
Pour egg mixture into oven dish and mix around until contents are spread evenly.
Place in over at 350 degrees and cook for 35 minutes.

name: Breakfast/Lunch Smoothie
directions: Blend all together.
Enjoy.

name: Breakfast Smoothie
directions: Put fruit in blender.
Add tea.
Blend.

name: Breakfast Smoothie
directions: Throw all the ingredients in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Add a little yogurt or half a banana if it needs a more creamy sweetness.
Enjoy.

name: Breakfast To Go Bars
directions: Brown sausage.
Mix all ingredients.
Bake at 375 °F (190 °C) till golden brown.

name: Broccoli Arugula Soup
directions: Bring water to a boil with pinch of salt.
Add broccoli and arugula and boil until broccoli is soft.
Allow to cool and then puree in blender until smooth.
Add spices and season to taste. Reheat when serving.
Note: sprinkle tiny bit of cheese or drizzle olive oil on top prior to eating.

name: Broccoli & Beef Plus
ingredients: 2 second spray canola oil cooking oil
directions: In a bowl, combine 2 tablespoons cornstarch, 1/4 cup water and garlic powder until smooth. Cut beef in short strips and stir beef into mixture
Over medium-high heat, stir-fry beef mixture in oil sprayed large pan until beef reaches desired temperature, remove from pan.
While beef is cooking cut up vegetables. With beef removed from pan add a few more sprays of oil and add vegetables. Stir-fry for about 4-5 minutes. Then add beef.
Combine soy sauce, brown sugar, and remaining cornstarch and water until smooth then add to the pan. Cook about 2-3 minutes.
You can serve this with rice or noodles or just as is.
Note: mushrooms and carrots can also be added. For the beef use thinly sliced chuck or top round steak.

name: Broccoli BreakFAST
directions: Cook broccolli
Add eggs, chicken and rice.
Enjoy.

name: Broccoli Cheesy Bread
directions: Preheat oven to 425 °F (205 °C) and line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. Microwave riced broccoli for 1 minute to steam. Carefully ring out extra moisture from the broccoli using paper towel or cheese cloth.
Transfer broccoli to a large bowl and add egg, 1 cup mozzarella, Parmesan, and garlic. Season with oregano, salt, and pepper. Transfer dough to baking sheet and shape into a thin, round crust.

Bake until golden and dried out, 20 minutes. Top with remaining 1/2 cup mozzarella and bake until cheese is melted and crust is crispy, 10 minutes more. Garnish with parsley and pepper flakes if using. Serve warm with marinara.

name: Broccoli Mushroom Tofu Stir Fry
directions: Chop the vegetables and tofu.
Sauté the garlic and onions until soft. Set aside.
Using the same pan, fry the tofu until light brown. Set aside.
Sauté the broccoli and mushrooms. Add garlic and onions.
Add the tofu and seasoning. Toss everything until vegetables are tender but not overcooked.

name: Brown Lentil Dal
directions: Put the lentils, 1/2 the tomatoes, jalapenos, ginger, garlic, coriander, and turmeric in a large pot.
Add enough water to cover by 1 1/2 inches. Cover, bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to medium and simmer until the lentils are almost tender, about 30 minutes.
Continue cooking lentils while you put the canola oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat.  Add cumin seeds, cinnamon stick and cloves and cook, shaking pan occasionally for 2-3 minutes.
Add the onions and cook until soft, about 10 minutes. Add the cayenne and 1 cup water, bring to a boil over medium-high heat, simmer 1 minute, turn off the heat.
When the lentils are fully tender, partially puree them with an immersion blender (or leave whole if you prefer).
Stir the onion mixture into the lentils along with the remaining tomatoes and coriander. Season liberally with salt and pepper.
Simmer for 5 minutes, then turn off the heat and stir in the lemon juice.

name: Brown Rice and Bell Pepper Salad
directions: Rinse black beans and drain. Set aside.

Prepare bell peppers by chopping off the tops and bottoms and removing the seeds. Finely dice the peppers and place in a large bowl (use caution when chopping the jalapeno, as the juices can be on hot).
Add onions, tomato, rice and beans.
In a small bowl combine mayonnaise, spicy brown mustard, chili powder and salt and pepper.
Pour dressing over the rice and pepper mixture. Combine well so all the vegetables and rice are evenly coated.
Add cilantro and stir mixture gently.
Refrigerate for a few hours or overnight for best flavor.
Note: Add a cherry bomb pepper for a spicier flavor.

name: Brown Rice and Mushroom Risotto
directions: Clean and cut mushrooms. Sauté in 1 tbsp olive oil then push to the rim of the pot.
Finely chop onion and garlic then add to the center of the pot. Add another tablespoon of olive oil. Stir until both are cooked.
Hollow out the middle of the pot and add brown rice with remaining olive oil to toast. After a few minutes, deglaze pot by gradually pouring broth and wine. Add seasonings.
Allow liquid to reduce while simmering. Keep stirring until rice is fully cooked. Turn off heat and serve.

name: Brown Rice & Cherry Tomato Cooked Salad
directions: In a pan, heat olive oil. Add finely chopped garlic and sliced onions to oil. Cook onion and garlic until golden.
Slice cherry tomatoes in half and add them, along with thyme and crushed red pepper flakes.
Add cooked brown rice and stir-fry for a few 1-2 minutes. Serve.

name: Brown Rice Risotto
directions: Chop onion and garlic. Sauté in pot with olive oil.
Add rice, tomato paste, and seasonings.
Add water and stir until tomato paste is dissolved. Bring to boil.
Reduce temperature and simmer while covered. Stir occasionally until liquid is absorbed.

name: Brown Sugar Banana Muffins
directions: Mash the bananas then beat with eggs and brown sugar.
Add the other wet ingredients.
Slowly add the dry ingredients and mix well.
Distribute into muffin tins.
Bake in preheated oven at 350°F for 25 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean.

name: Brussels Sprouts & Noodle Stir Fry
ingredients: 16 oz brussels sprouts, trimmed & thinly sliced
directions: Break spaghetti into 1" pieces. Cook spaghetti according to package directions; drain. Return spaghetti to hot pan; cover and keep warm.
Pour oil into a large skillet; heat skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic; cook and stir for 1 minute.
Add brussels sprouts, ginger, and crushed red pepper; cook and stir for 1 minute.
Add broth and soy sauce. Cook about 2 minutes more or until liquid is almost evaporated, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat.
Stir in cooked spaghetti and carrots.
Before serving, if desired, sprinkle with almonds and cilantro.
Note: for an easy main dish add 2 cups of chopped cooked chicken, or ham, or cooked shelled and deveined shrimp to the skillet when you add the broth.

name: Buffalo Pasta Salad with Sausage
ingredients: 36 g fat free shredded mozzarella cheese
directions: Cook pasta according to package.
Cook sausage in a non-stick pan for 8-10 minutes.
Chop vegetables.
Mix all ingredients in a bowl. Season to taste.

name: Burrito Bake
ingredients: 1/4 cup 40% less sodium taco seasoning mix
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C). Brown meat in a large nonstick skillet on medium-high heat. Drain.
Add seasoning mix and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low; simmer 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Place 2 tortillas on the bottom of a greased 9 inch pie plate. Cover with half each of the refried beans, meat mixture, and cheese. Repeat layers once. Top with remaining 2 tortillas.
Bake 30 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted. Cut into wedges to serve.

name: Burrito Bowl
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups shredded or chopped mixed salad greens
directions: Sauté the beef in a nonstick skillet until brown. Add taco seasoning. Stir for 5 minutes until incorporated.
Put the mixed salad greens in a bowl.
Add the beef, black beans, tomatoes, onions, and guacamole.

name: Buttermilk Biscuits
ingredients: 2 tsps baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
directions: Combine flour, baking powder, and lard by hand until it is roughly the texture of cornmeal.
Add buttermilk and combine.
Roll out on a floured surface. Cut into 5 biscuits and dip in bacon grease.
Bake at 450°F for 20 minutes. Let it cool and serve.

name: Butternut Carrot Sweet Potato soup
directions: Heat up the oil in a large pot over medium heat. Sauté the onion and the carrot for about 3-5 minutes.

Add the squash and sweet potato to the pot and pour in the vegetable broth. Add the spices and salt and bring to a boil. Once it has started to boil, reduce to a simmer and cover while allowing it to cook for about 20 minutes or until all of the veggies are very tender. Pour in the coconut milk.
Using an immersion blender or regular blender, puree the vegetables until a thick, smooth consistency is reached.
Serve warm and enjoy.

name: Cabbage Soup
directions: Chop vegetables.
In a 4 quart dutch oven, sweat onions, green peppers and celery (no fat added) over medium heat.
Add remaining ingredients and simmer over medium-low heat for 1 hour or until cabbage is cooked as desired.
Eat.

name: Cabbage Stir-Fry
directions: Slice onions into strips. Peel carrots and use peeler to peel carrots into thin strips. Slice fresh mushrooms into 1/4" slices. Slice turkey sausage into thin bite size pieces. Shred/slice cabbage.
Add 1 tablespoon butter to large skillet or wok. Add onions and red pepper flakes. Sauté 5 minutes. Add garlic. Sauté 2 more minutes. Remove from pan and place into a large bowl.
Add 1 tablespoon butter and carrots to pan. Cook 3 minutes, and add mushrooms. Sauté for 3 more minutes. Add to large bowl.
Add sausage to pan with a dash of broth. Sauté until edges start to brown. Remove from pan and add to large bowl.
Add broth, salt, and pepper to pan. Bring to simmer and add cabbage and cover with lid tilted. Cook until cabbage starts to soften. Turn off heat.
Add all prepared ingredients from large bowl to the cabbage. Mix well. Cover with lid tilted and let sit 5 minutes. Mix again before serving.

name: Cachapas
directions: Strip the corn ears from their husks, add to a boiling pot of water. Cook to fork tender.

Combine all ingredients and add to blender in batches. Texture should be a lumpy pancake batter, although smoother won't hurt in cooking. Add more water if it's too dry, and more harina if it's too wet/loose.
Pre-heat a large, flat pan or skillet on the stove. Add just enough oil to coat lightly.

Using a 1/4 cup measuring cup, scoop out the cachapas mix onto the hot, oiled pan. Cook 5 minutes per side on medium heat. Serve on its own, with cheese, meat, or vegetables folded inside, or with a sauce on top. Great for breakfast or as a side dish.

name: Calico Beans
directions: Cook bacon in microwave, drain or cook on paper towels, let sit to get crispy.
Fry beef and onion together and drain.
Mix sugar, mustard, garlic and vinegar in bowl.
Drain and rinse all beans, except the pork and beans, keep the sauce.
Combine the beans, meat, bacon and onions. Pour sauce over and combine well.
Bake at 350 °F (175 °C) for 1 hour, uncovered for 1st half hour, covered for last half hour.
Note: you can add about 1/2 teaspoon of 5 spice powder as you brown the beef and about the same into the sauce mixture.

name: Candied Almonds
directions: Combine water, sugar, and cinnamon in a saucepan over medium heat.
Bring to a boil then add almonds. Cook for 5 minutes or until syrupy.
Transfer to a baking sheet with parchment paper and separate using a fork. Allow to cool for 15 minutes.

name: Caprese Portobello
directions: Coat portobello mushroom caps with olive oil, back and front then broil caps for 15 minutes.
Mix together remaining ingredients.
While caps are broiling, spoon mixture onto the four caps evenly.
Return to broiler for 10-15 minutes until cheese is melted.

name: Caprese Salad
directions: Slice tomatoes in half.
Slice mozzarella in chunks.
Slice basil in thin slivers.
Mix in bowl and toss with balsamic vinegar.
Let marinate before serving.

name: Carne Molida con Papas (Ground Beef with Potatoes)
ingredients: 1 can diced tomatoes and green chilies
3 medium potatoes, peeled, cut into strips
directions: In a large skillet over medium-high heat brown the ground beef, drain.
To the meat in the skillet, sprinkle flour, add the potatoes and seasonings. Cook for 8-10 minutes.
Add the beef broth and tomatoes and green chilies. Bring to boil, and then lower heat, cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until the potatoes are cooked through.
Note: the onion powder and garlic powder are optional. You can leave them out because the tomatoes and green chilies have plenty of seasoning.

name: Carrot and Walnut Muffins
ingredients: 2 tsps baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
directions: Sift and mix the dry ingredients in a large bowl.
Whisk the wet ingredients together.
Make a well at the center of the flour mixture and add the wet ingredients.
Add grated carrots, chopped walnuts and dates. Batter should be thick and moist and drop in globs from spoon.
Distribute evenly in muffin tins. Tap to remove bubbles.
Bake in preheated oven at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.

name: Carrot Muffins
directions: Soak the dates and apricots for 15 minutes. Drain.
Combine the dates, apricots, mashed banana, grated carrots, yogurt, and egg.
Add the remaining ingredients and mix.
Put the mixture in muffin mold. Distribute evenly.
Bake in preheated oven at 180°C for 35-40 minutes.

name: Carrot Slaw
directions: Mix all ingredients together in a bowl.
Note: refrigerates very well.

name: Cashew Sriracha Kale Chips
directions: Wash and strip kale, tear into chip size and spin dry.
In a blender or food processor, grind cashews until fine.
Add remaining ingredients and blend until a smooth paste forms. You want the consistency of something like Alfredo sauce. Thin with 1/4 cup water if needed.
Toss torn kale leaves with sauce to coat well.
Place in food dehydrator, single layer, avoid chips touching if possible. Dry on low setting for 14 hours.
Store in airtight container.

name: Cauliflower and Bean Aglio-Olio
ingredients: 16 oz dry organic 100% whole wheat fusilli
directions: Coarsely chop garlic and sauté in 2 tbsps olive oil.
Add cauliflower, beans, seasonings, and half cup water. Stir and cover. Allow to simmer on low heat.
Cook pasta according to packaging.
Drain pasta and combine with cauliflower-bean mixture. Add the rest of olive oil and mix.
Transfer to plate then serve.

name: Cauliflower Bake
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).
Cook cauliflower in boiling water for 10 minutes. Cook potatoes in a separate pan of boiling water for 10 minutes.

To make sauce melt butter in a pan, add leek and garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add flour and cook for another minute. Remove the pan from heat and gradually add the almond milk and 1/2 cup of the cheese. Add paprika.
Put the cauliflower in a casserole dish, followed by the grape tomatoes and potatoes.  Pour the sauce over the potatoes.  Sprinkle the rest of the cheese on top of the casserole.
Bake for 40 minutes until the vegetables are cooked through and the cheese is brown and bubbling.

name: Cauliflower Ceviche
directions: Cook florets from one whole fresh cauliflower for 2-3 minutes. Drain and let it cool down.
Add chopped red bell pepper, red onion and tomatoes.
Add olive oil, lemon juice, salt, oregano and cilantro.
Mix.
Finally, add avocado chunks.
Leave it to cool down in refrigerator.

name: Cauliflower Cheese Sticks
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).
Wash and then rice the cauliflower. All ricing means is to grate so just grate it with a cheese grater.
Place riced cauliflower in a microwave bowl, and microwave for 5 minutes until it is soft.

While the cauliflower is in the microwave, heat oil in a small skillet over medium-low heat and add garlic. Saute until soft. In the cauliflower bowl add and mix with the warmed cauliflower the egg white, garlic, Italian seasoning, and 1/4 cup mozzarella cheese.
Spread mixture onto a baking pan with parchment paper on it. Then form it into a little rectangle or the form of the pan it is on.
Bake 30 minutes, or until golden brown. Remove from oven, flip over, and sprinkle remaining cheese on top. Bake for an additional 10 minutes, or until cheese is golden brown.
Allow to cool, cut into 8 equal pieces and serve.

name: Cauliflower Fried Rice
directions: Remove the core and let the cauliflower dry completely. Coarsely chop into florets, then place half of the cauliflower in a food processor and pulse until the cauliflower is small and has the texture of rice or couscous (don't over process or it will get mushy). Set aside and repeat with the remaining cauliflower.
Combine egg and egg whites in a small bowl and beat with a fork. Season with salt.
Heat a large saute pan or wok over medium heat and spray with oil. Add the eggs and cook, turning a few times until set. Set aside.
Mince garlic and dice onion fine. Dice scallion, green and whites, separated.
Add the sesame oil and saute onions, scallion whites, peas and carrots and garlic about 3-4 minutes, or until soft.

Raise the heat to medium-high. Add the cauliflower "rice" to the saute pan along with soy sauce. Mix, cover and cook approximately 5-6 minutes, stirring frequently, until the cauliflower is slightly crispy on the outside but tender on the inside.
Add the egg. Remove from heat and mix in scallion greens.

name: Cauliflower Fried Rice
directions: Thinly slice carrot. Use a food processor or a cheese grater to grate the raw cauliflower, this should make about 3 cups of grated cauliflower.
In a large sprayed pan, on medium-high heat saute the onions and garlic until the onions start to change color, about 3-5 minutes.
Add peas, carrots, and water chestnuts. Cook for 3-5 minutes, carrots should start to soften.
Add cauliflower, soy sauce, and egg whites. Cook for 5-7 minutes.

name: Cauliflower  Gratin
ingredients: 1 cup fat free half and half
directions: Heat the broiler on low.  Put the whole head of cauliflower in the microwave on "fresh vegetable" or appropriate setting.  Let cool ten minutes.
Melt butter in a sauce pan, add panko bread crumbs and set aside.
Add 1 teaspoon butter to pan.  Add flour and stir for one minute.  Slowly add heavy cream.  Stir until thickened.
Add in cream cheese and stir constantly until cream cheese melted and sauce is smooth.
Add salt, pepper and garlic powder to taste.
Chop cauliflower into bite sized pieces - put in an oven proof dish and sprinkle bread crumbs over the top.
Broil until the top is nice and bubbly.

name: Cauliflower, Lettuce & Bacon Salad
directions: Put bacon in a skillet and brown until crisp while preparing the rest of the ingredients. When crisp, let drain and cool on paper towels and crumble.
In a small bowl combine the mayo and sweetener (like Splenda). Let sit while continuing with the other ingredients.
Tear lettuce leaves into small pieces and add to a very large bowl for 1st layer. Don't use the very center of the head as that part is very bitter.
Add chopped cauliflower flowerettes for 2nd layer. Add rings of onions for 3rd layer.
Using a rubber spatula, spread the mayo and Splenda mixture on top of the layers, as if you were icing a cake. This is layer 4.
Sprinkle the shredded Parmesan cheese and crumbled bacon over the top of the 'icing' for layer 5.
Cover and chill for at least 4 hours. Letting it set overnight is even better.
Toss the salad immediately before serving. Yields 8 healthy portions.

name: Cauliflower Rice
directions: Chop cauliflower into large chunks, omitting the leaves and stem.
Sauté diced onion and diced red pepper with 1/2 tsp olive oil until soft, about 10 minutes over medium heat.
Grate cauliflower until it resembles a rough chop, like a grainy rice-like texture.
Add cauliflower to pan with onions and peppers, increasing heat to medium high. Cook for 5-6 minutes or until cauliflower is soft and has a rice like consistency. Add curry powder, salt and pepper.

name: Cauliflower Rice
directions: Rice cauliflower in food processor.
Heat oil, add vegetables and seasonings.
When a bit translucent, push to side and crack and scramble egg on clear side.
Drag vegetables through.
Season with soy or ginger dressing, curry powder, or other spices (adding salsa makes a quick Spanish rice).

name: Cauliflower with Dijon Sauce
directions: Place cauliflower florets in a large glass bowl or casserole dish, and cover with plastic wrap. Poke a few holes in the plastic with a knife. Cook in the microwave for 5-7 minutes, or until tender.

In a cup or small bowl stir together the mayonnaise and Dijon mustard. Spread over the top of the cauliflower. Sprinkle shredded cheese over the top. Return to the microwave, and cook just until the cheese has melted, about 2 minutes.

name: Celery & Pork Spicy Stir-Fry
directions: Slice pork, celery, and garlic.
Heat oil on highest heat setting. Add garlic and peppers and toss. Add pork. Cook until pink is mostly gone. Add celery and salt.
Toss maximum 2 minutes until celery turns bright green and starts to soften.
Remove from heat and serve. Eat with rice if desired.
Note: you can use any pepper you like for this, or leave it out if you don't like spicy.

name: Celery with PB & Raisins
directions: Wash celery.
Spread peanut butter.
Add raisins.

name: Chai Breakfast Shake
directions: Mix all the ingredients together in a blender.
Add some crushed ice.
Blend everything together until smooth and a foam has formed.
Enjoy.
Note: you can replace the agave syrup with any sweetener you prefer.

name: Chamomile Cookies
directions: Rinse and drain chickpeas. Puree chickpeas in food processor.
Melt butter. Add all other ingredients and pulse with chickpeas until smooth.
Spoon mixture onto parchment lined cookie sheet.
Bake on 400 °F (205 °C) for 15 minutes.

name: Cheddar Cauliflower Soup
ingredients: 4 cups fat free low sodium chicken broth
directions: Chop the onion, carrots, and celery and crush two cloves of garlic. Cut florets off the head of cauliflower.
Start the onion, carrots and celery in the pot with a little bit of water to prevent burning. Add the salt, pepper, cayenne, turmeric, and garlic.
Once the onions, carrots, and celery are starting to get soft add the chicken broth and the rest of the water then add the cauliflower.

Cook the cauliflower until soft (about 20 minutes) then use an immersion blender to puree. If you don't have an immersion blender you can use a slotted spoon to put the veggies in a blender and puree that way.
After you puree the mixture add shredded cheese and the milk. Let simmer for about 10 minutes then add salt and pepper to taste.

name: Cheddar Drop Biscuits
directions: Mix all dry ingredients.
Cut in butter until coarse.
Add milk and mix until moist.
Gently fold in cheese.
Drop biscuits on a greased pan.
Bake at 450 °F (230 °C) in a preheated oven for 10-12 minutes.
Brush with melted butter and pepper (optional).

name: Cheese Bread
directions: Put butter, water, milk, and salt into a large saucepan, then place over high heat.
When the mixture comes to a boil, remove from heat immediately and stir in tapioca flour and garlic until smooth. Set aside to rest for 10-15 minutes.
Add cheese and eggs. Mix until well combined.
Scoop 1/4 cup-sized balls of the mixture on a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Bake in preheated oven at 375°F for 20-25 minutes or until the tops are lightly browned.

name: Cheeseburger Casserole
ingredients: 1 3/4 cups reduced fat shredded cheddar cheese
directions: Preheat oven to 400 °F (205 °C). Spray a 9"x13" baking dish with cooking spray.
Brown beef in a large frying pan. Drain. Stir in garlic salt, pepper, seasoning blend and Worcestershire sauce into beef.
Spread mixture into prepared pan and sprinkle cheese over top.
In bowl, mix together baking mix, milk and eggs. Pour batter over top.
Bake 25-30 minutes, or until lightly golden brown and set in center.

name: Cheeseburger Casserole
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C). Brown ground beef then add garlic and onions and cook for about 5 minutes. Drain fat.
Over very low heat, add cream cheese, ketchup, mustard and seasoned salt. Stir together. Put in 8x8 pan and top with bacon.
In a separate bowl, mix eggs, heavy cream, hot sauce, pepper and pour over mixture in pan.
Top with cheese and cook for 30 minutes.
Sprinkle dill over the top before serving.

name: Cheese Muffins
directions: Preheat over at 355 °F (180 °C).
Combine semolina, salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper and baking powder in a bowl.
Add butter, shredded cheese, thyme and water to the dry ingredients.
Mix together with fork until well blended.
Pour mixture into muffin molds (preferably silicone). Sprinkle sesame seeds on each muffins
Bake for 20 minutes or until toothpick inserted comes out clean.

name: Cheese Spread
ingredients: 2 cups finely shredded sharp cheddar cheese
directions: Mix all of the ingredients together.
Serve with crackers or with celery.

name: Cheese Sticks
directions: Grate the cheese and mix everything.
Form sticks.
Bake in an air fryer preheated to 350°F for 12 minutes or until golden.

name: Cheese Stuffed Turkey Meatloaf
directions: Preheat oven to 375 °F (190 °C). In a large bowl, combine turkey, spinach, onion, bread crumbs, parsley, oregano, egg whites, Worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper. Mix well.

Press half of mixture into an 8" loaf pan. Top bottom half with grated mozzarella and parmesan cheese. Press remaining turkey mixture over top and flatten to make an even layer. Whisk together ketchup and mustard and spread mixture over prepared meatloaf.
Bake 1 hour, until top is golden and loaf has pulled slightly away from sides of pan. Let stand 10 minutes, then slice into 6 equal pieces and serve.

name: Cheesy Breakfast Bake
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C). Spray an 8x8 dish with cooking spray.
Cook sausage, crumble. Drain. Remove from heat.
Dice up peppers and chop spinach. Add to hamburger. Put mixture into prepared dish.
Grate cheese, put over top of hamburger mixture.
Scramble eggs, pour over hamburger and cheese mixture.
Bake on middle oven rack for 40 minutes, check for doneness. Let sit 5 minutes before serving.

name: Cheesy Enchiladas
directions: Enchiladas: mix cauliflower, eggs and mozzarella cheese. On 2 greased cookie sheets, drop dough by scant 1/3 cup, to form 12 6” rounds. Bake one pan at a time for 12-14 minutes or until edges have browned slightly and crust has slightly golden hue. Let cool on pan. Once shells have cooled, carefully loosen them from the pan and let set.
Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).

Enchilada sauce: cook and stir onion, garlic and chili powder in oil in a pan on the stove over medium heat, until onion is tender, about 5 minutes. Add oregano, cumin, salt, pepper and tomato sauce. Stir until sauce is heated. Mix cheeses in separate bowl.

Take each shell and dip into heated enchilada sauce and then place golden-side up into an ungreased 9X13” casserole pan. Add 1/4 cup cheese in each shell. Roll and place seam-side down in pan until all shells have been used. Top with remaining enchilada sauce and cheese. Bake for 20 minutes, or until cheese is bubbly and golden.
Pour remaining tomato mixture over enchiladas, and top with the rest of the cheese. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes, or until cheese is melted.
Optional: top with shredded lettuce, olives and chopped, fresh tomato.

name: Cheesy Meatloaf
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C). Grease an 8"x4" loaf pan.
Combine eggs, milk, ketchup, bread crumbs, onion powder, mustard, salt and pepper. Add beef and cheese and mix well.
Press mixture into prepared loaf pan. Bake 45 minutes. Take the meatloaf out of the oven and carefully drain off fat.
Return to oven and continue to bake for 30 minutes. Take the meatloaf out of the oven and carefully drain off the fat.
Return to the oven and cook for 10-15 minutes. Remove from oven and carefully drain off fat.
Let sit for 15 minutes. Cut into 8 pieces and serve.

name: Chewy Raisin Oatmeal Cookies
directions: Preheat toaster oven to 350 °F (175 °C). Line 2 toaster oven sized baking sheets with parchment paper (can also be made in a regular oven on 1 large cookie sheet).

Measure out the applesauce in a 1 cup or larger measuring cup. Mash the banana with a fork until creamy. Add 1/3 cup mashed bananas to the applesauce in the measuring cup. Add vanilla and cinnamon. Mix well.
In a bowl big enough to hold all ingredients, add the oats. Add the raisins. Mix well.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry and and stir until everything is mixed evenly. Let stand for 10 minutes to allow the oats to absorb the liquid and the batter to thicken.
Drop the dough by spoonful's onto the baking sheet, 6 cookies per sheet, then flatten into rounds (this makes small cookies, if you want bigger ones make fewer cookies out of the batter)
Bake for 30-35 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. Remove from the oven and move to a wire rack to cool.
Store in an airtight container at room temperature. They freeze well.

name: Chicken and Mushroom Pasta
ingredients: 1 cup cooked, diced skinless chicken breast
directions: Cook pasta according to packaging directions.
In a non-stick pan, cook chicken until golden.
Chop onion, garlic, and mushrooms. Add to pan and cook until translucent. Season with salt and black pepper.
Add coconut milk, remaining spices, and half of parmesan cheese. Simmer until the sauce thickens.
Transfer pasta into the pan of sauce and mix.
Transfer to a plate. Sprinkle remaining parmesan cheese on top then serve.

name: Chicken Bites
directions: Heat non-stick skillet to medium high heat. Add olive oil.
Cube chicken into bite size pieces. Toss into hot skillet.
Season. Drain as needed during cooking. Cook till sides are browned and chicken is cooked through, about 10-15 minutes.

name: Chicken & Broccoli Stir Fry
ingredients: 6 oz cooked boneless skinless chicken breast
directions: Heat olive oil in a large pan. Add onions and garlic. Cook until softened.
Add chicken and ginger. Cook until chicken is no longer pink.
Add soy sauce, sesame oil and vinegar.
Add broccoli and enough water to keep food from sticking (2-3 tablespoons). Cover pan and steam about 1-2 minutes.
Serve over rice.

name: Chicken & Brown Rice Dinner
ingredients: 10 1/2 oz low fat cream of chicken soup
directions: Spray a large skillet with cooking spray and heat on medium-high heat.
Add chicken and cover. Cook 4-5 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Remove chicken from skillet, and cover to keep warm.

Add water and soup to skillet. Stir in rice. Bring to boil reduce heat, cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir, cover. Let stand 5 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Fluff with fork.
Top with chicken and serve.

name: Chicken & Cabbage Soup
ingredients: 1 oz hispanic chicken flavored granulated bouillon
directions: Thinly slice onion and cabbage.
Put everything into pot to boil until chicken is cooked through, about 10 minutes.
Cube or shred chicken into bite sized pieces. Return to pot.
Serve with a sprinkle of paprika.
Note: this can be eaten plain or over brown rice.

name: Chicken Caesar Burgers
directions: In a small bowl, combine onion, cheese, lemon juice, parsley, garlic, Worcestershire sauce, seasoning blend, and pepper.
Crumble chicken over mixture and mix well. Shape into 4 patties.
Grill burgers, covered, over medium heat for 5-7 minutes on each side or until meat thermometer reads 165 °F (75 °C) and juices run clear.
Let rest 5 minutes.

name: Chicken Carbonara with Shirataki Noodles
directions: Chop vegetables, chicken, and bacon.
Prepare noodles according to packaging directions.
In a non-stick pan, cook chicken and bacon. Add vegetables, seasonings and tomato paste.
Add milk and cheese. Stir to combine until cheese is melted. Turn off heat.
Add noodles and mix. Transfer to a plate then serve.

name: Chicken Chardon
directions: Preheat oven to 375 °F (190 °C). Melt butter, stir in lemon juice. Pour 1/4 butter mixture into an 8x8 baking dish. Add mushrooms to dish.
In bowl, scramble the egg. Finely crush pork rinds in a gallon ziplock bag using a rolling pin, add garlic and pepper when done.
Dredge chicken breast through egg mixture and then place in gallon ziplock, shake till breast is coated. Put it on top of mushrooms, repeat with other 3 breasts.
Drizzle remaining butter mixture over top of chicken. Sprinkle with parsley. Bake for 45 minutes or until juices run clear.

name: Chicken Cordon Bleu Casserole
ingredients: 4 oz ham steak (boneless, extra lean, cured)
directions: Spray or lightly grease a 5X7" baking dish. Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).
Chop ham and place on bottom. Grate cheese and use as next layer. Cut up chicken into bite sized pieces and place on top of cheese.
Smooth the soup over the chicken and cheese. Place in oven.
Bake for 60 minutes or until hot and bubbly. You might need to bake it for a bit more time.
Serve over noodles, rice or have plain.

name: Chicken Cordon Blue
directions: Pound chicken breasts if they are too thick. Place a cheese and ham slice on each breast within 1/2" of the edges. Fold the edges of the chicken over the filling, and secure with toothpicks. Mix the flour and paprika in a small bowl, and coat the chicken pieces.

Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat, and cook the chicken until browned on all sides. Add the wine and bouillon. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes, until chicken is no longer pink and juices run clear.

Remove the toothpicks, and transfer the breasts to a warm platter. Blend the corn starch with the cream in a small bowl, and whisk slowly into the skillet. Cook, stirring until thickened, and pour over the chicken. Serve warm.

name: Chicken & Cornbread Stuffing Casserole
ingredients: 10 1/2 oz light cream of chicken soup
16 oz cooked boneless, skinless chicken breast
directions: Preheat oven to 400 °F (205 °C).  Spray a 9"x13" baking pan with cooking spray.
Bring soup and milk to a boil in a saucepan over high heat, stirring frequently.
Stir in mixed veggies, and poultry seasoning. Heat to boiling, stirring frequently; remove from heat.
Stir in chicken and stuffing mix.
Spoon into baking dish. Sprinkle with pepper. Bake uncovered 15 minutes on until hot in center.

name: Chicken & Dressing
ingredients: 1 box stove top chicken flavor stuffing mix
1 can reduced sodium cream of chicken or turkey soup
directions: Sprinkle both sides of the chicken with spices to taste.
Spray a 4 1/2 to 6 quart slow cooker with pam and place the chicken in the slow cooker.
In a separate bowl, combine soup and milk, then pour over chicken.
Combine stuffing mix with water. Spoon over chicken and soup mixture.
Cover and cook on low heat 6-8 hours.
Serve with a side salad.
Note: try to trim all the fat off the chicken before cooking them. Shred the chicken before it is served.

name: Chicken & Dumplings
ingredients: 2 1/2 cups light cream of celery soup
