directions: Cube chicken into bite-sized pieces. Rough cut onion and celery into medium-sized pieces.
Lay out pizza dough and, using a pizza cutter wheel, cut into 1/2" x 1/2" pieces.
In a large (8-qt or larger) pot, combine: broth, soup, water, bay leaf, salt, and pepper, onions, chicken, and celery - everything except for the dough.
Bring the broth to a gentle boil. Simmer until chicken is cooked through and veggies are soft.
Carefully add the pizza dough cubes quickly, separating them as you drop them into the broth. Do not add by handfuls or they will clump up.
Gently boil, covered, until dough is cooked through. Stir occasionally, replacing cover. Let stand 10 minutes off heat, stir again, then enjoy.

name: Chicken Enchilada Quinoa Bake
directions: Using 1 1/4 cup of water, cook quinoa according to package directions. Rinse and drain the black beans.
Heat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).  Spray an 8" baking dish with Pam.
Heat a skillet over medium heat. Add oil and onion, cook 5 minutes or until onion is soft.
Reduce to low. Add quinoa, chicken, black beans, green chiles, chili powder and enchilada sauce, stir to combine. Remove from heat.
Stir in 1/2 cup of cheese. Transfer quinoa mixture to baking dish. Top evenly with remaining cheese.
Bake 10-15 minutes.
Turn oven to broil. Placing baking dish about 5 inches from broiler, broil 1-2 minutes or until cheese is golden and bubbly.
Remove from broiler and serve.

name: Chicken Fajitas
ingredients: 3 medium bell peppers (1 yellow, 1 red, 1 orange)
directions: Cut the chicken into 1/2" strips. Cut the onion and bell peppers into thin strips. Set aside.
Mix water, oil and seasoning mix in a large resealable plastic bag. Add chicken, toss to coat. Refrigerate 15 minutes.

Pour chicken into large skillet. Cook over medium-high heat for 5 minutes. Add onion and bell peppers and cook for another 5 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender, stirring frequently.
Serve.

name: Chicken Masala
directions: Coarsely chop the red onion. Mince the garlic and ginger. Cut up chicken breasts into 1" cubes.
In a heavy skillet over medium heat, melt the ghee. Brown the cumin and mustard for about a minute, stirring to keep from burning.
Add the red onion to the skillet with 1 olive oil. Saute for 2 minutes.
Add the ginger and garlic to the skillet and reduce the heat to medium-low. Continue to saute until the onions turn dark purple, 5-10 minutes.
Add the tomatoes. Simmer until the liquid is reduced by about a quarter 15-20 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste.
Turn the heat back up to medium and add the raw chicken. Continue cooking until chicken is about half cooked 5-10 minutes, then reduce the heat back to medium-low.
Add the garam masala, chili power and turmeric. Simmer until the oil separates and the sauce is the consistency you desire.
Serve with rice or boiled potatoes and warm naan.

name: Chicken Mozzarella Pasta with Kale & Spinach
directions: Cook pasta according to package directions. Cut the chicken into bite size pieces.

Heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add kale and chicken pieces in a single layer and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Allow to cook without stirring for 2 minutes, or until golden. Stir chicken around to brown on all sides. Remove to a plate.
In the same skillet over medium-high heat, add the onions and garlic and stir immediately to start cooking. Cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the onions are deep golden.

Reduce the heat to low and pour in the spaghetti sauce and the water. Stir until the onions and garlic are mixed in, then add the chicken and kale back into the pan. Add the parsley, spinach and stir to combine, then allow to simmer, stirring occasionally, for about 7-8 minutes.
Make sure the sauce is bubbly and very hot, then add the mozzarella. Let it sit, undisturbed, for 2 to 3 minutes, until you can see that the mozzarella is melted.
Drain the pasta. Pour on the sauce, sprinkle with parmesan and the chiffonade of basil, and serve immediately.
Note: any kind of pasta can be used.

name: Chicken Noodle Soup
ingredients: 5 cups fat free low sodium chicken broth
directions: Put the chicken broth in a big soup pot and add the carrots.
While the broth is warming up and the carrots are cooking, saute cut up chicken breasts. Once cooked, add to the broth.
Add chopped onion to the broth and bring to a boil.
Add package of frozen egg noodles and cook until tender.
Serve.

name: Chicken Patties
directions: Chop vegetables and mince chicken using a food processor.
Mix all ingredients in a bowl.
Form slightly flat patties and place on a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Put in preheated oven and cook for 20 minutes at 370°F or until golden brown.

name: Chicken Pilaf
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups dry instant whole grain brown rice
12 oz 99% fat free boneless skinless chicken breasts
directions: Saute chicken in oil until lightly browned.
Add mushrooms, onion, peas and carrots, and rice and saute, stirring until rice is lightly browned.
Add broth and bring to a full boil.
Cover, remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes.

name: Chicken & Potato Dinner
ingredients: 1/2 cup fat free zesty Italian dressing
directions: Preheat oven to 400 °F (200 °C). Spray a 9"x13" baking dish with cooking spray. Place chicken and potatoes in prepared pan.
Pour dressing over chicken and potatoes. Sprinkle with seasoning and cheese. Cover with foil.
Bake for 45 minutes, remove foil and continue baking 10-15 minutes or until chicken and potatoes are cooked through.

name: Chicken Pot Pie in a Biscuit
ingredients: 10 3/4 oz low fat cream of chicken soup
directions: Preheat oven to 400 °F (205 °C).
Separate biscuits and place each biscuit in the cup of a muffin pan, lightly sprayed with cooking spray. Press dough up the sides to the edge of the muffin cup.
In a medium bowl, combine chicken, chicken soup, vegetables, cheddar cheese, parsley flakes, minced onion, pepper, thyme, basil, and salt. Mix well to combine.
Evenly spoon chicken mixture into prepared biscuit cups.
Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.
Remove from oven.  Place muffin pan on a wire rack and let set 2-3 minutes. Serve.

name: Chicken Pot Pie
ingredients: 10 1/2 oz low fat cream of chicken soup
directions: Preheat oven to 400 °F (205 °C). Spray a 9"x13" baking dish with cooking spray.
In a large bowl combine all ingredients except crescent rolls. Pour into prepared pan and bake 15 minutes.
Remove from oven and place crescent rolls, in a single sheet over the contents and carefully stretching to cover.
Bake until dough is fully cooked and golden brown, about 18 minutes.

name: Chicken Pot Pie
directions: Preheat broiler to 425 °F (220 °C).

Peel and cube potatoes. Cut carrots into bite-size chunks. In a large bowl, toss potatoes and carrots with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. Season lightly with salt and black pepper. Spread onto a baking sheet in a single layer. Broil until veggies are lightly roasted and just becoming tender, about 20 minutes. Stir once about about half-way through baking time. Remove from oven and set aside. Turn broiler off and set oven on at 400° F (200° C).

Dice onion. Coarsely chop celery and mushrooms. Preheat a large, heavy skillet with remaining olive oil. Saute onion in oil until translucent. Add in celery and mushrooms. Continue sauteing until celery is tender and onions have just started to brown on the edges.

Cut up chicken into bite-sized cubes. Add chicken to the skillet a few pieces at a time to avoid cooling the skillet too much. Brown chicken in the onion mixture until fully cooked. Flash the skillet with white wine. Remove from heat and set aside.

In a small, heavy saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. When butter begins to foam, whisk in flour. Whisk constantly until mixture becomes smooth and starts to bubble. Slowly add chicken stock and milk, whisking as you add. Add celery seed. Bring mixture to a boil, whisking constantly, and cook until sauce thickens. Remove from heat. Season to taste with salt and black pepper.

In a large bowl, combine roasted vegetables, chicken mixture, and sauce. In a pie pan or casserole, place one pie crust in the bottom. Fill the crust with the chicken filling. Place second pie crust on top. Pinch the edges of the pie crusts together all the way around. Cut 4 1" slits in the top crust for steam. Bake until top crust is golden brown, about 1 hour.
Note: for a crispier crust, brush egg beaters over top of crust before baking. Lightly salt the top crust.

name: Chicken Salad
ingredients: 3 tsps ranch seasoning & salad dressing mix
directions: Season the chicken as desired then boil in water until color turns white.
Shred the chicken and chop the vegetables.
Mix everything in a bowl. Refrigerate before serving.

name: Chicken Sausage Thai Style
directions: Cut chicken into 1" cubes.
Mix remaining ingredients except egg whites and bread together well in shallow dish or zip top bag.
Add chicken to marinade and place in freezer for 30 minutes.
Using food (meat) grinder and fine disk grind the chicken and spices into mixing bowl. Try to get all the chunks of garlic, cilantro, and ginger into the grinder. Grind the slice of bread last.
Using the flat beater or by hand mix in the egg whites. Stir about 3 minutes on "stir" or low or until the egg white is evenly distributed.
Form into 3 oz patties for grilling or pan frying in a bit of oil or drop it by half-teaspoonfuls into hot broth (boiling or simmering) for Asian style meatballs.

name: Chicken Scampi
directions: Season chicken breasts with sea salt and black pepper on both sides. In a large sauté pan, over medium heat, pan sear the chicken breasts in 4 tablespoons of butter. Sear on both sides until golden brown. About 3 -4 minutes each side. Remove chicken from the pan and set aside (chicken will not be fully cooked at this stage).
Using the same pan, reduce the heat to medium and add remaining butter and the minced garlic. Brown the garlic and butter for about 2 minutes.
Keeping a medium heat add the red onions and sauté the onions until transparent. About 3-4 minutes.

De-glaze the pan with the 1 cup of chicken stock. Using a rubber spatula, scrape off and mix any stuck on pieces of chicken and garlic. Add Italian seasoning and red pepper flakes. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce to low to simmer. Let simmer 2-3 minutes.
Add heavy whipping cream and allow to simmer for 10 minutes to allow sauce to thicken. Mix in parmesan cheese, sea salt and black pepper to taste.
Add chicken back into the pan. Finish cooking the chicken in the sauce on low. Let simmer for 20 minutes.
Serve as is or over low carb noodles and enjoy.

name: Chicken Soup
ingredients: 1/4 tsp seasoning with coriander and achiote
2 chicken breast, bone and skin removed
directions: Slice the chicken into strips and chop the vegetables.
Boil the chicken for 10 minutes together with seasoning and enough water to cover.
Add the onions and potatoes. Cook until tender.
Put the cilantro and boil for 5 more minutes.

name: Chicken Spaghetti
ingredients: 23 fl oz cream of chicken soup
directions: Boil spaghetti according to directions.
Meanwhile, cut chicken into 1" bite size pieces and Velveeta into 1" pieces.
In a large pan, heat oil over medium-high heat cook chicken until no longer pink.
Add soup, broccoli, chicken broth, spices, and Velveeta. Lower heat to simmer and heat through. If the sauce is too thick for your liking, then add 1/4 cup water.
Once the pasta is done, pour chicken mixture over and stir to combine. Serve.

name: Chicken Stir Fry
ingredients: 1 cup cooked, diced skinless chicken breast
directions: Chop veggies into small bite sized pieces and heat oil in a pan.
Cook onion and garlic in a pan on medium heat until onion is translucent.
Put chicken in the pan and stir fry until browned and cooked thoroughly.

Place the other veggies in the pan and cook until soft, add aji-mirin to keep them from burning if your pan is too hot. Add all of the rest of the sauces at once and stir fry until sauce has thickened.

name: Chicken Stir-Fry
directions: Chop the chicken thighs into bite size pieces.
Cut the baby carrots into strips and chop up the broccoli.
Melt the butter in a pan then add the garlic and brown sugar over low heat.
Toss chicken into pan and cook until lightly browned. Add the carrots and broccoli.
Cover and let cook until carrots and broccoli are tender.
Note: chicken breasts may be used instead of thighs.

name: Chicken Tamale Casserole
ingredients: 3 cup cooked skinless chicken breast, diced
directions: Preheat oven to 400 °F (205 °C). Lightly spray a 13"X9" baking dish with cooking spray. Set aside.
In a large bowl combine the corn muffin mix, cream style corn, eggs, milk, chili powder, cumin, and 1/2 cup cheese. Stir till combined then pour into baking dish. Bake 20 minutes.

Remove from oven and use a knife to pierce the cornbread mixture several times all over. Pour the enchilada sauce all over the top. Then top with the chicken and remaining cheese. Bake for an additional 20 minutes.

Let cool for 10 minutes before slicing into pieces and serving with optional toppings: diced tomato, sour cream, shredded lettuce, sliced black olives, chopped green onions, finely chopped cilantro, and/or salsa.

name: Chicken Teriyaki & Soba Noodles
directions: Boil the soba noodles per the box instructions.
While the water boils, put a tablespoon of coconut oil in a fry pan and wait for it to heat up. Once heated add the chicken and let it fry until done.
Strain the noodles and put both the chicken and noodles into a large pot, mix the teriyaki sauce in.

name: Chicken Tortellini Soup
directions: Wash and chop vegetables.
Heat oil in a pan then add onions. Cook until translucent.
Add garlic. Stir and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add chicken and broth. Bring to a boil then simmer until the chicken is done.
Add vegetables, tortellini, and seasonings. Cook until tender.
Remove from heat then add half and half.
Transfer to a bowl then serve.

name: Chicken with Cherry Tomatoes
directions: Sprinkle chicken with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon of pepper.

In a large nonstick skillet heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add chicken; cook for 10-12 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink turning once. Transfer chicken to a serving platter; cover and keep warm.
Drain fat from skillet. Add tomato, water, parsley, vinegar, remaining salt and pepper to skillet.
Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer uncovered for 3-4 minutes or until tomatoes begin to soften, stirring occasionally.
Serve tomato mixture over chicken.

name: Chile Verde con Papas Soup
ingredients: 1 lb pork tenderloin, cut into 1/2" cubes
1 1/2 lbs russet potatoes, peeled, cut into 1" pieces
directions: Spray a non stick skillet with Pam and cook pork over medium heat for 1-2 minutes, until browned.
Add about a 1/4 cup of chicken broth to the pan to loosen the browned bits in the bottom of the pan.
Place pork along with the chicken broth in a slow cooker.
Add remaining ingredients, except the corn meal and water. Stir well.
Cover and cook on low for 4-6 hours. The last 30 minutes of cook time mix together the corn meal and water. Add to slow cooker and stir.
Sprinkle cilantro over each serving, if desired. Serve.

name: Chili Bowl Bake
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).
Brown ground beef and prepare as taco meat according to the seasoning package (using water).  Add chili beans and stir to combine.
Meanwhile, in a saucepan combine soup and milk and heat through until smooth.
Pour taco meat mixture into a 9x9" pan. Top meat with cheese sauce. Top with shredded cheese.
Bake for 10-15 minutes until bubbly.
Optional: Top each serving with Fritos, lettuce and other desired taco toppings. Ground turkey can be used instead of ground beef.

name: Chili & Rice
directions: Mix all ingredients together in a microwave safe dish.
Cover and microwave on high for 8-10 minutes.
Let sit 5 minutes. Uncover and enjoy.

name: Chinese Rice Noodles
directions: Boil water and add noodles. Let set for 10 minutes.
Scramble eggs in oil or make egg sheets cut to thin strips.
Thaw spinach leaves and cut in strips.
Drain noodles and mix all remaining ingredients in fry pan.
Add hoisin sauce, and ginger, garlic, soy, red pepper flakes to taste.

name: Chocolate Almond Fat Bomb
directions: Melt the coconut oil and almond butter in a bowl or measuring cup carefully.
Add cocoa powder, flour and monk fruit extract.
Mix well and put in fridge for about 40 minutes.

Using a tablespoon divide into 9 pieces, then quickly form balls and insert an almond and reform into the shape you would like. These melt very quickly so put it back in the fridge if they are getting too soft. Set them on parchment paper.
Set up a small bowl with the coconut flakes, pull the balls back out of the fridge and quickly roll each in the flakes and set into a storage container. Put back in fridge.
Note: another sweetener besides monk fruit extract can be used.

name: Chocolate Almond Smoothie Bowl
ingredients: 1 tbsp almond butter no sugar or salt added
directions: Pulse bananas in a blender.
Add almond butter, cocoa powder, and maple syrup.
Slowly add almond milk.
Blend thoroughly until smooth.
Pour into bowl and top with coconut flakes, almonds, and cacao nibs.

name: Chocolate Banana Protein Muffins
ingredients: 32 g semi-sweet style baking chocolate chips
2 scoops zero carb whey protein isolate - cookies & cream
1 tsp baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
directions: Beat the bananas and yogurt in a blender.
Transfer to a bowl. Fold in the eggs, whey protein, baking soda, and baking powder.
Divide into muffin tins. Sprinkle each muffin with chocolate chips.
Bake in an oven preheated to 350°F for 15 minutes.

name: Chocolate Chewy Crunch
directions: Melt the chocolate in microwave for 1 minute.
Crush the pretzels.
Mix the pretzels and peanuts into melted chocolate.
Stir in the marshmallows.
Spread on a parchment paper, allow to harden, then break into pieces.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 224 g semi-sweet mini chocolate chip morsels
directions: In a small bowl, mix together flour, salt, and baking soda.
In a larger bowl, mix melted butter, vegetable shortening, vanilla extract, brown sugar, and granulated sugar.
Combine the two mixtures and stir until smooth.
Add chocolate chips.
Form into small balls and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake in preheated oven at 350°F for 10-15 minutes or until golden.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
directions: First mix together eggs, butter, oil, brown sugar, white sugar, and vanilla.
Add the flour, salt, and baking soda on top of the mixture and stir up until creamy.
Add in the chocolate chips and mix.
Use a small scooping to place as many small cookies as can fit with room to expand on the stone or a cookie sheet.
Bake for 10 minutes at 350 °F (175 °C).

name: Chocolate Chip Pumpkin Bread
ingredients: 1/2 tsp baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
directions: Beat the eggs with sugar and mashed pumpkin.
Add the oil and mix well.
Gradually add the dry ingredients and stir.
Transfer to a lightly greased loaf mold.
Bake in an oven preheated to 350°F for 50-60 minutes or until the toothpick comes out clean.
Let cool before slicing.

name: Chocolate Coconut Chia Seed Pudding
directions: Mix chia seeds, coconut milk, protein powder and honey together in a small bowl or glass mason jar. Let it set in refrigerator overnight.
Remove it from the fridge, and make sure your pudding looks thick and the chia seeds have gelled. Top with fresh fruit and nuts, and enjoy immediately.

name: Chocolate Cookies
directions: In a mixing bowl, mix all dry ingredients.
Add warm water and the rest of the wet ingredients. Mix well using a fork.
Heat oven to 400 °F (205 °C). Use cooking spray on a cookie sheet and with a spoon, drop dollops of dough on the cookie sheet.
Bake for 15-20 minutes or until toothpick inserted comes out clean.

name: Chocolate Peanut Butter Protein Balls
ingredients: 2 rounded scoops plant based chocolate protein powder
directions: Mix all ingredients.
Start mixing with hands.
Roll into balls.
Store in fridge or freezer.

name: Chopped Greek Salad
directions: Wash then pat dry a small head of leaf lettuce. Place a handful of lettuce on a cutting board and chop with a large knife, into bite size pieces then place in a salad bowl.
Peel cucumber; slice in half then in half again from one end to the other. Remove the seeds.
Cut tomato into bite size pieces. Peel the skin from the red onion and slice into thin rings or use a mandolin for uniformed slices.
Place the cucumber, tomato on the chopped lettuce. Salt and pepper to taste then top with olives, crumbled cheese and red onion.
Drizzle the Greek dressing over the salad and enjoy.

name: Cilantro Burgers
directions: Combine all ingredients in a bowl, mix just until combined.
Divide into 4 equal portions, gently shape each into a 1/2" thick patty (about 3" in diameter).
Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Add patties to pan and grill 4 minutes. Carefully turn patties and grill 4 minutes or until desired degree of cooking.
Remove patties from pan and let rest for 1 minute. Serve on buns,
Note: try using cilantro sprigs in the place of lettuce.

name: CinnaCut Muffins
directions: Preheat oven to 375 °F (190 °C).
Combine dry ingredients in a small mixing bowl.
Add water and mix until you have a consistency like cake batter.
Add in vanilla extract.
Spoon mixture into small muffin pan.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until fully cooked and lightly brown.

name: Cinnamon Apple Breakfast Quinoa
directions: Peel and core both apples. Chop them into bite-sized pieces.
Add quinoa, water and apples to a saucepan.  Bring to a boil, cover and reduce to simmer for 25-30 minutes. The apples will be soft and the quinoa will have absorbed the water.
Stir in cinnamon and honey.
Sprinkle each individual serving with additional cinnamon (if desired).

name: Cinnamon Cookies
directions: Beat wet ingredients with sweetener until incorporated.
Add the remaining ingredients and mix well.
Form cookies and place on a baking sheet.
Cook in preheated oven for 12-15 minutes at 375°F.

name: Cinnamon Waffles
ingredients: 5.3 oz icelandic style skyr vanilla & cinnamon
2 cups unbleached white whole wheat flour
1 1/2 tsps baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
directions: Mix the wet ingredients until creamy.
Add the dry ingredients. Stir until there are no more lumps.
Cook in lightly greased waffle maker until golden brown.

name: Coconut Bread
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).
Blend eggs, oil, honey, and salt together. Set aside.
In a separate bowl, combine coconut flour with baking powder. Whisk this into the egg batter thoroughly, until there are no lumps.
Pour into greased 9x5x3" or smaller loaf pan and bake for 40 minutes.
Remove from pan and cool on rack.

name: Coconut Flour Wrap
directions: Mix all ingredients together.
Cook in a well greased skillet.

name: Coffee & Beet Juice Pre-Workout
directions: Add all ingredients into a shaker bottle.
Shake vigorously.
Drink.
Note: add other powdered supplements as needed.

name: Coleslaw
directions: Chop cabbage into slender long strips and grate carrot. Mix.
Add all other ingredients.
Chill before serving.

name: Coleslaw with Broccoli and Bacon
directions: Place thinly sliced onions in a bath of ice cold water to reduce some of the bite. Drain after 5 minutes and pat dry.
Mix all ingredients in a bowl, adding the dressings last.
Cover and chill for at least one hour before serving.

name: Colorful Vegetable Medley
directions: De-seed pepper and chop into 1 inch size pieces. Cut ends off summer squashes, cut in half lengthwise then slice giving half moon shapes. Peel and cut onion into 1 inch x 1/2 inch size pieces. Peel and chop garlic cloves.
Melt butter in large skillet on a low to low-medium heat.
Add garlic and cook for about 2 minutes.
Add onions and cook for about 5 minutes until light brown.
Add all other ingredients and continue to cook (sauté) for about 10 minutes, getting vegetables a little browned.
Serve immediately.
Note: add other vegetables of your choice.

name: Conch Fritters
directions: Cut up raw conch, and add to a food processor. Pulse to chop finely, but not to a paste.
Combine all dry ingredients in a large bowl.
In a separate bowl, whisk wet (minus conch and cheese) ingredients until smooth. Then add to the dry ingredients, and mix well.
Heat oil or lard in a skillet to 450 °F (175 °C). Drop batter by spoonfuls into the oil. Cook for 5-7 minutes, or until browned. Turn each fritter, and cook another 5-7 minutes.
Remove to a plate covered with paper towel to drain.

name: Cool Cucumber and Yogurt Salad
directions: Place the yogurt in a cheese cloth or dish towel.
Gather all sides and squeeze some of the water out of the yogurt into the sink. (Cucumber releases water into the yogurt).
Place yogurt in a bowl.  Add cucumber, onion (optional), dill, mint and salt to taste.
Stir and serve.
Note: great with kabobs or by itself.  Better if refrigerated for at least 30 minutes.  If you opt for fresh herbs then it's fine served right away.

name: Cool Cucumber Yogurt Soup
directions: Peel, seed and grate the cucumbers.
Mix all ingredients together. Blend in blender until smooth.
Chill until ready to serve.
Makes about 3 cups.

name: Cottage Cheese Pancakes
directions: Mix everything in a blender until smooth.
Heat a non-stick skillet and pour mixture in circles.
Cook until set and golden brown.

name: Couscous with Corn & Black Beans
directions: Drain and rinse black beans. Drain corn and combine in a medium-large bowl.
Add olive oil and lime juice.
Chop onions and cilantro and combine with beans and corn. Cook couscous while chopping.
Add salt, black pepper, red pepper and cumin.
Stir in cooked couscous a small amount at a time.

name: Crab Cakes
directions: Mix the crab meat, egg, and egg yolk in a bowl.
Grease the pan with butter. Scoop the crab meat mixture and press to flatten.
Flip the cake to cook both sides until golden brown. Let it cool and serve.

name: Crab Dip
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).
Blend softened cream cheese, mayonnaise, crab, and 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese. Add old bay/Cajun seasoning/smoked paprika to taste.
Place in greased baking dish.
Bake for 10 minutes.
Top with remaining Parmesan cheese.
Return to oven until cheese is melted (approximately 5 minutes).

name: Crab Salad
directions: Flake apart crab.
Mix mayonnaise, sour cream and all spices together.
In a large bowl add crab and all other ingredients. Mix well.
Get your favorite low carb crackers and enjoy.
Note: may also have as a sandwich or on a salad.

name: Crab Salad
directions: Mix crab with mayonnaise.
Add seasoning.
Serve on a bed of lettuce.

name: Crab Salad
ingredients: 5 1/3 tbsps mayonnaise dressing with extra virgin olive oil
directions: Rinse and drain crab sticks.
Chop crab and celery sticks into small pieces.
Mix all ingredients in a medium bowl.
Chill at least 2 hours.
Serve with Guerrero tostadas or crackers.

name: Crab Stew
directions: Combine all liquid ingredients and minced garlic in a pot and simmer until fragrant.
Dice tomatoes and add to boiling water. Stir continually until tomatoes soften.
Add crab meat and spices and simmer for 8 minutes stirring occasionally and serve.

name: Cranberry, Almond, Fruit & Nut Bar
directions: Combine all ingredients in a food processor.
Pulse ingredients until chopped and well blended (a "dough" ball will start to form).
Empty the contents of the food processor onto a sheet of wax or parchment paper.
Using your hands, press together the "dough" and shape it into a ball.
Roll the ball into a log and cut into 4 equal pieces.
Form each piece into a bar or whatever other shape you like.

Note: if you want the bars to have more almond and cranberry chunks, reserve 1/4 cup of the almonds and all of the craisins when blending the ingredients. Once all the other ingredients are well combined, add these to the food processor. Pulse until your desired consistency is reached.

name: Cream Cheese Biscuit
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).
Soften cream cheese in microwave for 20 seconds. Add yeast, cream, vinegar and 2 tablespoons warm water and mix.
Add eggs one at a time and mix well.
Add the dry ingredients and mix well.
Add the cheese and mix. Scoop into muffin pan.
Bake for 15 minutes.

name: Creamed Brussels Sprouts
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).
Heat ghee in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and sauté for 3 minutes. Add Brussels sprouts and continue to sauté until fork tender, about 5 minutes.
Transfer sprouts, garlic and melted butter to 9x9" baking dish. Add cream, Parmesan cheese, salt and pepper. Sprinkle pork rinds evenly over the top.
Cover and bake for 30 minutes. Serve hot.

name: Creamed Eggs on Toast
directions: Peel and slice hard-boiled eggs.
Toast whole wheat bread.
Heat a pan and make the white sauce by melting butter, adding flour, and stirring in milk.
On the bread, add egg and white sauce. Top with cheese then serve.

name: Creamy Blue Cuke Salad
directions: Chop cucumber and onion, and combine with other ingredients.
Salt and pepper to taste.
Let sit in fridge until ready to serve.

name: Creamy Corn and Zucchini Salad
directions: Chop the onions and zucchinis.
Heat the butter in a pan and sauté the onions.
Add the zucchinis and stir for 5 minutes.
Add the remaining ingredients and simmer for 10 minutes. Season as desired.

name: Creamy Green Chicken Enchiladas
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 °F (175 °C).

In a small bowl combine the enchilada sauce and the cream of chicken soup. In a large saucepan, over medium-low heat warm up the enchilada sauce mixture. In a 9"x13" baking pan pour a little bit of the enchilada sauce, just enough to coat the bottom.
Layer 6 tortillas on the bottom of the baking pan, in a single layer.  Add 1/2 of the cooked shredded chicken and sprinkle with 1/3 of the cheese. Pour 1/3 of the enchilada sauce over the top.
For the second layer: layer 6 more tortillas in a single layer.  Sprinkle the remaining chicken and then sprinkle on a 1/3 of the cheese. Pour 1/3 of the enchilada sauce on top.
Layer the last 6 tortillas on the top, pour remaining enchilada sauce on top and then top with remaining cheese.
Cover with foil and bake for 20 minutes. Then uncover and bake for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted.

name: Creamy Slow Cooker Salsa Verde
directions: Add chicken to slow cooker, then top with seasonings and salsa.
Cover and cook on low for 5-6 hours.
Shred the chicken with two forks. Add cubed cream cheese. Use a whisk to mix the sauce that is in the slow cooker.
Add the shredded chicken back to the slow cooker. Turn the slow cooker to low and cook another 30 minutes for the chicken to absorb the creamy salsa verde sauce.

name: Creamy Tortellini & Sausage Soup
directions: Cook Italian sausage in a large stock pot over medium-high heat until browned, crumbling as it cooks. Using a slotted spoon transfer the cook sausage to a separate plate and set aside. Reserve 2 tablespoons of grease in the pan discarding the rest.

Stir in onions and carrots and sauté for 4-5 minutes or until the onions are soft and translucent, stirring occasionally. Add in the garlic and sauté for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant, stirring occasionally. Stir in the flour until it’s evenly coating the veggies, and cook for an additional 1  minute, stirring occasionally.
Gradually add in the chicken stock and stir to combine. Continue cooking until the mixture reaches a simmer. Then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 5 minutes.
Stir in the cooked sausage, tortellini, spinach, and milk, and continue simmering for 5 minutes, or until the tortellini is al dente.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

name: Crepes
directions: Mix all the ingredients.
Heat a nonstick pan and put mixture in thin circles.
Cook until both sides are golden brown.

name: Crepes
directions: Mix everything in a bowl.
Heat a non-stick pan and ladle the mixture into thin circles.
Cook until set on both sides .

name: Crock Pot Chicken Thighs with Vegetables
directions: Rinse chicken and remove skin, leaving the bone in.
Place a layer of thighs in the bottom of the crock pot. Sprinkle with seasonings. Repeat until all thighs are in the pot.
Pour a cup of chicken broth down the side of the pot, being careful not to disturb the seasonings.
Cook on high setting of crock pot for 4 hours.
Add mixed vegetables, recover and cook for 1 hour or until vegetables are heated through.

name: Crockpot Mediterranean Chicken
directions: Put everything but the cooked quinoa in the crockpot.
Cook low for 8 hours. Then add cooked quinoa.

name: Crêpes
ingredients: 1 1/4 cups pure almond milk - unsweetened original
directions: Blend all ingredients together.
Pour batter into lightly greased pan, forming a thin layer.
Cook for 30 seconds on each side until light brown.

name: Crunchy Chickpea Fire
directions: Preheat oven to 425 °F (220 °C). Open canned beans and put in colander and rinse well.
Let all water drain from beans and put in large bowl.
Add all seasonings and olive oil. Experiment with the seasonings to your taste. Place in cookie sheet in one layer as much as possible. Place on middle rack.
Bake for 10 minutes. Take out, stir and turn the chickpeas. Put back in oven for 10 more minutes.
Take out chickpeas, stir and turn again. Put oven on broil now on low and put the sheet on top rack for 10 minutes.
Repeat step 5.
Take out chickpeas. Taste one. They should have a distinctive supple "pop" for the crunchiness. If not, then repeat step 5.
Place chickpeas in a bowl and enjoy.

name: Crunchy Flax Cereal Bar
directions: Mix honey and almond butter. Heat over medium heat until all well mixed.
Add other ingredients and mix.
Press flat in a baking pan and refrigerate for 30 minutes and cut into pieces.

name: Crustless Quiche Muffins
ingredients: 2/3 cup shredded colby & monterey jack cheese
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C). Spray and line the muffin cups with the sliced meat.
Mix together the remaining ingredients in a medium bowl.
Slowly pour/scoop the mixture into each lined muffin cup (kinda tricky so spraying the cups keeps the spilled egg from sticking).
Bake for 12-15 minutes or until egg mixture doesn't move when shaken. Pop out and enjoy with extra Tabasco on the side.

name: Crustless Spinach & Feta Pie
directions: Saute onions and garlic in olive oil, let cool.
Mix together all ingredients.
Spray 10" pie pan with cooking spray.
Add mixture to pie pan.
Bake in 350 °F (175 °C) oven for 45 minutes.
Note: herbs and other vegetables such as mushrooms can be added if available.

name: Crustless Spinach Feta Quiche
directions: Cook the frozen spinach and drain it.
Beat the egg and add in all other ingredients.
Grease a small ramekin (4.5" to 5.5" wide) and pour ingredients in to it.
Cook at 375 °F (190 °C) for 35 minutes.

name: Crustless Spinach Pie
directions: Mix all ingredients together.
Spray a pie pan with cooking spray.
Pour mixture into pie pan.
Bake at 350 °F (175 °C) for 45-50 minutes.

name: Cucumber Avocado Salad
directions: Cut vegetables into small chunks.
Add vinegar, lemon juice and black pepper to taste and toss gently.

name: Cucumber Pepper Salad
directions: Slice peppers, cucumbers and onion. Add to bowl.
When ready to serve add extra virgin olive oil. Squeeze half lemon/half lime.
Sprinkle dried, crushed mint to taste.
Toss salad. Serve.
Note: you can omit onion. You can sub dill for mint. Add salt if preferred.

name: Dark Rye Apple Crumble
directions: Core, peel and slice the apple.
Stew the apple in half a cup of water and sweetener in the microwave for 4 minutes.
Remove the apple "stew" from the microwave. Sprinkle with cinnamon and add the crushed dark rye crackers and raisins.
Serve hot or warm.

name: Deluxe Cheeseburger Melt
ingredients: 1 1/2 cup shredded fat free cheddar cheese
10 1/2 oz reduced sodium cream of mushroom condensed soup
directions: Preheat oven to 400 °F (200 °C). Spray a 9"x13" baking dish with cooking spray.
In a medium bowl mix together Bisquick, water, eggs, and 1 cup of cheese. Spread in pan.
Brown beef, drain. Stir in soup and vegetables, heat through. Spread over batter in pan.
Bake 20-25 minutes or until edges are light golden brown. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake 1-3 minutes more or until cheese melts. Serve.

name: Double Corn Cake Muffins
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C). Grease 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray.
Stir together whole wheat flour, all purpose flour, sugar, cornmeal, baking powder, and salt together in a large mixing bowl.
Add cream style corn, eggs, applesauce, and milk to the flour mixture and stir until just blended.
Fill muffin tins full of batter (to the top, but not overflowing).
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, 25-30 minutes.
Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack or serve warm.

Note: try turbinado or brown sugar in place of granulated sugar for more molasses flavor. These muffins go well with any vegetarian chili or meat stew. Be creative...split a muffin, top with shredded BBQ and serve with a green salad for a complete meal.

name: Double Orange Pork Chops
directions: In the small bowl, mix the marmalade and the orange juice.

Heat the butter and olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Season the pork chops with salt and pepper. Cook, turning once, until just cooked through, 6-8 minutes total. Transfer the chops to a platter and cover loosely with aluminum foil.

Pour off all but 3 tablespoons of drippings from the skillet and add the orange juice mixture. Raise the heat to medium-high and stir, scraping up the brown bits on the bottom of the pan, until the sauce is reduced and slightly syrupy 6-8 minutes. Return the pork chops to the pan, reduce the heat to medium, and cook, turning the pork chops a few times in the sauce.
Drizzle the pork chops with some of the sauce and pass the remaining sauce in a bowl.

name: Dubu Muchim
directions: Press tofu under weighted plate to drain for 30 minutes.
Mix together gochujang, hon dashi, soy sauce, sesame oil, minced garlic and minced ginger.
Slice tofu into bite sized pieces and pour sauce over the top.
Finish by sprinkling sesame seeds and scallions.

name: Easy Chicken Noodle Soup
directions: In a Dutch oven, bring water, broth, chicken, pepper and carrots to a boil.
Once boiling, reduce heat to medium and continue cooking carrots until carrots are al dente.
Add dry noodles, stir occasionally and cook for 10 more minutes or until desired tenderness.
Enjoy.

name: Egg Casserole
ingredients: 1 3/4 cups fat free shredded cheddar cheese
3/4 cup fat free evaporated skimmed milk
directions: Saute veggies in pan over medium heat using spray olive oil or canola oil and season to taste. Set aside.
In a greased 3-quart rectangle pan, place shredded hash browns on bottom, spreading evenly. Sprinkle evenly with cheese, ham, and veggies. Season to taste.
In a separate bowl combine eggs and milk until well mixed.  Pour over remaining ingredients in pan.
Bake in oven for 45-55 minutes until brown and no longer moist from milk. Enjoy.

name: Egg Drop Noodle Soup
ingredients: 1/2 medium green bell pepper, sliced thinly
1 block plain ramen noodles, broken up
directions: Add the bell pepper, lettuce and chicken broth to a large pot. Bring to a boil.
Add the soy sauce and ramen noodles. Boil for 3 minutes.
Turn off the heat and add the egg, stirring constantly.
When egg has cooked add the cilantro and sesame oil. Serve immediately.

name: Egg Muffins
directions: Sauté onion and zucchini in olive oil for about 3 minutes. Add in spinach and cook until just wilted.
Beat eggs with a couple tablespoons of water.
Spray a muffin tin with non-stick cooking spray. Divide veggie mixture among 6 cups. Evenly pour eggs into 6 cups.
Bake at 350 °F (175 °C) for 25 minutes or until set.

name: Egg Muffins with Turkey Sausage
directions: Crack eggs into large bowl and beat. Set aside.
Cook sausage until done.
Shred sweet potato into "hash browns" and saute with spinach.
Add cooked sausage, sweet potato, spinach, salt and pepper to bowl with beaten eggs and mix well.
Scoop mixture into greased muffin pan filling cups 3/4 full. Cook until eggs are completely done, approximately 20 minutes.

name: Eggplant Caponata
directions: Cube eggplant and red peppers and dice onion. Put in a pot large enough to hold the vegetables. They will cook down so you can load it up to the top.
Add diced tomatoes to pot.
Add seasonings and olive oil.
Cook on medium heat until mixture steams then reduce heat and simmer until vegetables are broken down to your desired consistency stirring occasionally.

name: Eggplant Parmesan
ingredients: 1 cup pizza blend cheese, finely shredded
directions: Place eggplant in colander and sprinkle with kosher salt making sure it is on all pieces. Let sit for 30 minutes.

In a medium saucepan combine tomato sauce, tomatoes, garlic salt, minced garlic, Italian seasoning and basil. Bring to a boil then reduce heat and simmer. By the time the eggplant has finished sweating the sauce will be ready.
Preheat oven to 400 °F (205 °C) and spray a baking sheet with non-stick spray. Rinse eggplant well with cold water and pat dry with paper towels.

In a wide, shallow dish, whisk together egg and water. Dip eggplant in egg mixture, letting excess drip off, then dredge in breadcrumbs and place on baking sheet. Bake until golden brown then turn pieces over, about 15 minutes on each side.
Remove eggplant from oven then increase oven temperature to 425 °F (220 °C).

Lightly spray 8x8 casserole dish with non-stick spray then layer just enough sauce to cover the bottom of dish, add a layer of eggplant then a layer of sauce, sprinkle 1/3 of parmesan and romano cheese, 1/3 of shredded pizza cheese and repeat for 3 layers.
Place dish into oven and bake for 15 minutes or until sauce is bubbly and cheese has melted. Let sit for 5 minutes before serving.
Note: a jar of spaghetti sauce can be used instead of tomato sauce for a different flavor.

name: Egg Salad
directions: Shred cooked eggs, radishes, and carrots.
Mix all ingredients in a bowl.
Season to taste.

name: Egg Salad
directions: Peel the eggs and slice.
Chop the vegetables into small cubes.
Mix everything and season.

name: Egg Sausage Bake
directions: Pre-heat oven to 350 °F (175 °C). Oil a 9"x13" casserole pan.
Blend the eggs, yogurt, hot sauce, onion, salt, and milk. Pour into the casserole pan.
Sprinkle over the egg mix, 1/2 cup of shredded pepper cheese, 10 chopped pork sausages, and the chopped bell pepper.
Sprinkle the sharp cheddar cheese over the top.
Bake in the oven for about 1 hour, until the center is firm.

name: Egg White Frittata
directions: Whisk liquid egg whites and almond milk together.
Wash vegetables. Slice mushrooms and bell pepper.
Spray a pan with cooking spray. Mix all ingredients and pour in the pan.
Bake at pre-heated oven at 400°F for 30 minutes.

name: Energy Balls
directions: Combine all ingredients in a bowl.
Let sit in the fridge for 15-30 minutes.
Roll into balls then serve.

name: Energy Bar
directions: Place items in food processor until mixture becomes grainy and begins to stick together.
Flatten mixture into 1/2" rectangle.
Refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Cut into desired pieces and freeze to store.

name: Energy Bites
directions: Grind oats in a food processor.
Mix the oats and almond meal.
Add the peanut butter, melted chocolate, vanilla, and maple syrup.
Roll into 1-2 inch balls.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.

name: Energy Bites
directions: Mix all ingredients together.
Chill approximately 2 hours in the refrigerator.
Shape into 1" balls and store in refrigerator.

name: Fall Bread
directions: Mix the dry ingredients in a bowl.
Slowly add the wet ingredients.
Fold in the nuts, cranberries, and apple slices.
Put in a lightly greased bread mold. Bake at 325°F for 1 hour 15 min.

name: Family Favorite Casserole
ingredients: 10 1/2 oz 98% fat free condensed cream of mushroom soup
directions: Combine all ingredients except milk, macaroni, and cheese in a greased 3 1/2 to 5 quart slow cooker.  Stir to combine.
Cover and cook on low 6-10 hours or on high 3-4 hours.
Stir in milk and cooked macaroni during the last 30 minutes off cooking on low or the last 15 minutes if on high.
Sprinkle shredded cheese over top.

name: Fathead Pepperoni Alfredo Pizza
directions: Place half the mozzarella and cream cheese into a microwave safe bowl and heat for 1 minute on high.
Remove bowl from microwave and stir well. Return bowl to the microwave and heat 30 more seconds.
Remove bowl from microwave and put in almond flour, egg, and garlic and stir until all ingredients are combine.
Line a pizza pan with foil and give it a light coating of cooking spray.
Press dough into the pan distributing the crust evenly and bake at 425 °F (220 °C) for 6 minutes on the center of the oven rack.
Remove crust from oven and fork wholes into any part of the crust that may have bubbled. Top the crust with the remaining ingredients.
Turn oven on to broil and put the pizza back in the oven on the top shelf of the oven and broil the topping approximately 2 minutes or until it reaches your desired brownness.

name: Faux Twice Baked Potatoes
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).
Cut out stem and core from cauliflower, and cut into small pieces.
Cook in large pot of boiling salted water until cauliflower is tender, but not overly soft.
Drain well and mash with potato masher, leaving some chunks.
Mix in cream cheese, sour cream, onion, Parmesan, 1/2 cheddar cheese, and 3/4 of the crumbled bacon.
Spread evenly in a medium-sized glass casserole dish. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and reserved bacon. Bake 30-35 minutes, or until hot and bubbly.

name: Fettuccine Alfredo with Veggies
ingredients: 3/4 tsp garlic and herb seasoning blend
1/4 cup roasted garlic parmesan alfredo sauce
directions: Cook pasta according to package.
Heat oil in a pan. Add onion and pepper blend, and sprinkle with garlic and herb seasoning blend.
Add alfredo sauce and tomatoes. Simmer for a minute.
Add spinach and put lid on for 30 seconds. Stir.
Add cooked pasta and sprinkle with parmesan, then serve.

name: Fiesta Chicken Tacos
ingredients: 1 1/4 cups diced tomatoes and green chilies
directions: Place chicken in a 4 1/2 to 6 quart slow cooker.
Sprinkle taco seasoning over chicken.
Pour diced tomatoes and green chilies over chicken.
Rinse and drain beans, then add them to the slow cooker.
Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours or on high for 3-4 hours.
Shred chicken and stir everything together.
Can be served in corn tortillas with favorite taco toppings.

name: Fish Stew Brodetto
directions: Sauté chopped vegetables in oil on medium-high heat. Cook until soft, 5-10 minutes.
Add wine, broth and tomatoes. Bring to a boil then add the cubed raw fish. Cook over medium heat for 4-5 minutes or until fish looks opaque.
Take off heat and add parsley. Serve with a sprinkle of Parmesan cheese and a hearty piece of bread for a nice meal.

name: Flatbread
directions: Sift the dry ingredients first and mix them together.
Then add the sesame oil and yogurt, mix well.
Gradually add water until you form a blob of dough. If you touch it and the dough sticks to your finger then add more flour until it is more pliable and not sticky.

Lightly flour the surface you are going to work with and plop the dough on there. Knead the dough for 3 minutes then shape the dough into a log and divide into 15 segments (depends on how big or small you want your flatbread). Flatten segments of dough into thin discs they don't have to have a perfect round shape.

Heat a non-stick skillet in over medium-high and place the flatbread. When the surface starts to bubble flip it over. It will inflate a little. Then flip over again. You know when it's done when you see small golden speckles on the bubbles.

name: Flourless Pumpkin Donuts
directions: Preheat the oven to 325 °F (165 °C) and prep a donut pan by greasing with coconut oil.
Mix together the dry ingredients.
In a separate bowl, mix together the wet ingredients.
Combine the wet and dry ingredients and mix until the batter is smooth and lump free.
Divide the batter evenly to make donuts.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.

name: Four Pepper Salad
ingredients: 1 tbsp greek feta & oregano salad dressing
directions: Place peppers into a large bowl.
Add onion, basil, salt and pepper.
Add greek feta and oregano salad dressing. Stir and mix well.
Cover and refrigerate 1 hour before serving.
To serve, toss salad again and sprinkle with asiago cheese.
Note: crumbled feta can be used in place on asiago cheese.

name: French Ratatouille
directions: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.
Slice onions thinly and add to skillet. Cook about 4 minutes, or until onions start to become soft. Seed and dice bell peppers, about 1/4 inch or to your liking. Add to onions and cook 4 minutes.
Dice zucchini and summer squash the same size as the bell pepper, add to the skillet and cook about 5 minutes.
Dice eggplant and add-- you can peel or leave the skins on. Cook about 7 minutes. Dice garlic and add to the mix.
Add diced tomatoes and tomato paste and mix well. Add salt and pepper to taste.
Simmer on low about 40 minutes or until vegetables are soft and the mixture is slightly thickened. Slice basil into thin strips.
Turn off the heat and mix basil into vegetable mixture. Enjoy.
Note: this recipe is very versatile and does not need to be followed to a T. You may add most any vegetable you like that take well to the stewing method.

name: Fried Cabbage with Bacon
directions: Fry bacon add the onion and chopped cabbage to bacon drippings.
Add Worcestershire sauce and black pepper.
Cook until cabbage is tender.
Sprinkle crumbled bacon and serve.

name: Fried Rice
directions: Heat the olive oil in a pan and add the cooked rice.
Scramble the egg whites and whole egg together in a bowl and add to rice. Mix well.
Add your favorite mixed vegetables.
Cook until heated all the way through.
Note: if making as a main dinner dish, cut up and add chicken. If too dry, add a little soy sauce or some chicken broth.

name: Fried Russet Potatoes
directions: Peel and cut potatoes and onions into small squares and put into a small non-stick skillet with a tablespoon of extra virgin olive oil.
Sprinkle salt and pepper over contents and stir to coat.
Cook over medium-high until skillet contents start to sizzle.
Turn down to medium-low and cover.
Cook covered over med-low heat for about 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender, stirring occasionally.
Remove lid, turn up the heat to high and lightly brown them for about half a minute.

name: Frittata Casserole
directions: Brown sausage and drain. Put in casserole dish.
Top with tomato, cheese, cilantro.
Separate bowl beat eggs, cream, mustard.
Pour over casserole. Bake 30 min at 350°F.

name: Frittata Muffins
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).
Cook bacon. While bacon is cooking dice potato and place on a cookie sheet in oven. Bake until soft or desire texture.
Dice bacon and mix with potato in bowl. Whip eggs and milk together then add to bacon and potato.
Pour mixture into muffin tins lined with paper baking cups for easy clean up.
Bake for 30 minutes or until eggs are fully cooked.

name: Frosted Cauliflower
directions: Break cauliflower into large pieces. In a shallow microwave safe dish, place cauliflower in a single layer.
Add 2 tablespoons of water. Cover with plastic wrap and cook on high in microwave for 4 minutes.
While cauliflower is cooking, mix no carb mayonnaise, mustard, chopped red onion, and cheese in a small bowl.
Uncover bowl carefully and drain water. Sprinkle cauliflower with vinegar.
Smooth cheese mixture on top of cauliflower and cook uncovered for an additional 3 minutes or until tender.

name: Fruit Salad
ingredients: 1/4 cup, seedless grapes (red or green, european type varieties such as thompson seedless)
directions: Slice the strawberries.
Slice the banana.
Mix everything.

name: Garlic Hummus
directions: In food processor or blender, puree all the ingredients.
Serve with fresh vegetables.

name: Garlic Parmesan Cauliflower Rice
ingredients: 3 1/2 oz Parmesan cheese blend, finely shredded
directions: In a small saucepan over a stove top, add butter and minced garlic. Bring to a simmer and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring often, until garlic flavors are infused into the oil (melted butter). Careful to not let the garlic burn.

In a large skillet, wok or frying pan, add cauliflower rice and bring to medium-high heat on the stove top. Pour in butter mixture. Sprinkle cheese on top. Stir to mix and cook until cauliflower is tender. Add salt and pepper to taste and stir a few more times until everything is thoroughly mixed.
Serve while warm. Garnish with fresh chopped parsley if desired.

Notes: a large head of cauliflower is needed. To make the cauliflower rice, cut the cauliflower into florets and then briefly pulse in the food processor until they are the size of grains of rice. Frozen cauliflower rice can also be used.

name: Garlic Ranch Mashed Potatoes
directions: Cut peeled potatoes into large chunks. Add potatoes and garlic to a large pot filled with water. Boil 18-20 minutes or until tender. Drain.
Place the potatoes and garlic back into the empty pot. Add milk, butter, cheese, salt, pepper, dry ranch mix and seasoning to the pot. Mash until desired consistency. Serve.
Note: if you want your potatoes to be creamier then add a few more tablespoons of milk until desired creaminess is achieved.

name: Gazpacho
ingredients: 1.5 oz fire roasted bell peppers & onions
directions: Blend all ingredients except croutons in a blender.
Top with croutons.

name: Gazpacho
directions: Prepare vegetables and combine all ingredients. Mix thoroughly.
Place in the fridge to chill and enjoy!

name: German Sausage
directions: Combine the apples and sauerkraut in a deep skillet over medium heat.
Bring to a simmer then cook for about 10 minutes, until apples are starting to soften.
Stir in the brown sugar and kielbasa.
Cook for another 5 minutes, or until heated through.

name: Ginger Spiced Sweet Potatoes
directions: Wash and quarter each sweet potato (leave skins on) and place in a medium-large pot.
Add water into pot until sweet potatoes are just covered with water. Add 1 teaspoon sea salt to water.
Heat potatoes over medium-high heat to a boil. Once potatoes come to a boil bring down to a simmer for 20-25 minutes until potatoes are fork tender.

While potatoes boil, chop up 1/2 a large shallot, 1/3 small ginger root and 4 cloves of garlic. Add to sauce pan with 2 tablespoons canola oil with 1 teaspoon sea salt, 1 tablespoon crushed red pepper, and 1 tablespoon black pepper. Sauté until veggies are tender.
Lightly toast slivered almonds in small cooking pan over medium heat. Stir frequently. Set aside.
Once potatoes become fork tender, remove from heat and drain. Skins should separate easily from the potatoes. Remove the skins.
Add 1/2 cup unsweetened almond milk and with a potato masher mash together to desired consistency.
Add ginger/garlic sauté to potatoes with potato masher. Mix in almonds and serve!

name: Gluten Free Blueberry Muffins
ingredients: 1 cup gluten free all purpose baking flour
directions: Combine ingredients excluding lemon juice and natural sugar.
Bake at 350 °F (175 °C) for 20-25 minutes.
Top with lemon juice and sugar mixture.

name: Gnocchi Sheet Pan with Broccoli and Squash
directions: Pre-heat oven at 400°F. Chop all ingredients and transfer to bowl.
Add olive oil and toss to combine.
Line in baking sheet and cook for 30-40 minutes until squash is tender.

name: Grain Free Banana Bread
directions: Mash bananas.
Pulse bananas, eggs, vanilla and oil in food processor.
Pulse in almond flour, salt and soda (make sure it has a thick but moist consistency, not runny or dry).
Scoop batter into greased loaf pan.
Bake at 350 °F (175 °C) for 50-60 minutes.
Remove from oven and cool.
Serve with butter.

name: Granola Cereal
directions: Preheat oven to 300 °F (150 °C). Line a large baking sheet pan with parchment paper.
In a large bowl mix oats, salt, nuts, raisins, cinnamon and maple syrup.
Spread the mixture on the baking sheet and bake until golden brown for 30 minutes.
Transfer the sheet to a cooling rack and cool completely.
Store in the refrigerator in an airtight container.

name: Granola Energy Bites
directions: Stir all ingredients together.
Cover and chill at least 1 hour.
Roll into balls (about the size of a golf ball).
Note: can freeze or keep in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

name: Granola
ingredients: 4 cups whole grain extra thick rolled oats
directions: Mix the coconut oil, honey, vanilla, and maple syrup.
Add the oats, nuts, and seeds.
Place on a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Bake in an oven preheated to 350°F for 25 minutes. Add the dried cranberries when mixing half way through.

name: Grape Crunchies
directions: Slightly crush corn flakes as you mix them in a medium bowl with the raisins, peanut butter, and jelly.
Roll mixture into 1" balls.
Finely chop the peanuts and place in separate bowl.
Roll the balls in the finely chopped peanuts and set aside.

name: Greek Pizza
directions: Heat naan to your liking.
Spread hummus as a base, add spinach, feta, tomato, and top with dressing. Season with fresh ground black pepper.
Note: flatbread may also be used.

name: Greek Salad
directions: Wash and chop vegetables. Place in a bowl.
Add feta cheese.
Toss together.

name: Greek Salad with Tuna
ingredients: 56.5 g albacore tuna in water (no salt added)
directions: Cut cucumbers into quarters and slice olives in halves.
On a plate, layer cucumbers, tomatoes, olives, tuna, and feta cheese.
Squeeze lemon and drizzle olive oil.

name: Greek Yogurt Pie
directions: Mix yogurt with cornstarch.
Add in eggs one at a time.
Add vanilla extract and mix well.
Pour mixture into pan with parchment paper.
Bake in preheated oven for 50 minutes at 355°F.

name: Green Bean Casserole
directions: Slice the mushroom caps and sauté them in butter until softened, put them in a food processor or dice them finely.
Soften the cream cheese and mix with the heavy cream, mushrooms, 1 cup of the cheddar cheese, onion and spices.
Mix with green beans and cover with the remaining cheddar cheese.
Bake at 350 °F (175 °C) for 30-40 minutes.
Serving size is 1/2 cup to a cup.

name: Green Beans and Carrots Souffle
directions: Boil green beans and carrots until tender. Drain and slice into small pieces. Set aside.
In the microwave heat milk for 2 minutes on high. Melt margarine in a large saucepan over medium heat, add onion and cook for 3 minutes.
Add flour whisking a little at the time until it forms a consistent ball. Continue whisking and add milk (1/2 cup at a time), cook until it thickens.
Add cooked vegetables, egg yolks and parmesan cheese to the mixture.
Beat egg whites and add to the mixture. Add baking powder.
Coat a 8x8 baking dish with cooking spray and pour in mixture, sprinkling a parmesan cheese on top.
Bake for 20 minutes at 350° F (175° C) or until golden on top and toothpick comes out clean from the center.

name: Green Beans with Mushrooms and Balsamic Vinegar
directions: Cook green beans in a saucepan of salted boiling water until crisp-tender, about 4 mins. Drain.
Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms and cook until browned, about 5 minutes.
Add green beans and vinegar, season to taste with salt and pepper.
Toss to combine and serve warm.

name: Green Chicken Enchilada Chalupas
directions: Preheat oven to 375 °F (190 °C). Lightly coat a twelve 2 1/2" muffin tin with Pam.
Microwave the tortillas a few at a time for about 30 seconds until warm and pliable, then press carefully into prepared muffin tin.
Lightly coat the inside of the tortillas with Pam and bake about 10 minutes until crisp. Cool.
Meanwhile, in a medium bowl combine the chicken and the enchilada sauce. Divide the chicken mixture among the crisp tortilla cups. Sprinkle with cheese.
Bake 15-18 minutes or until the filling is hot and bubbly.
Cool in muffin tin on a wire rack for 5 minutes. Remove chalupas from muffin tin. Top with pico de gallo and sour cream if desired. Serve.

name: Green Chili Chicken Enchiladas
ingredients: 2 1/2 cups light cream of chicken soup
24 oz cooked boneless skinless chicken breast
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).  Spray a 9"x13" baking dish with cooking spray.
Combine cooked chicken, soups, chilies, salt, and pepper.
In baking pan layer tortillas, chicken mixture, and cheese; ending with cheese on top.
Bake for 30 minutes or until bubbling.

name: Green Juice
directions: Put the pineapple and the cucumber into the blender.
Add the other ingredients and blend together.
Note: add a bit of crushed ice into the blender if you want it to be fresher.

name: Green Smoothie
directions: Wash and chop fruits and vegetables. Store in the freezer for at least 1 hour.
Place everything (except bee pollen) in a blender and mix until smooth.
Transfer to a glass and top with bee pollen. Serve.

name: Grilled Cheese Sandwich
ingredients: 2 slices whole grains and seeds bread
directions: Spread butter on bread slices.
Slice cheese and place in between bread.
Heat non-stick pan and add sandwich. Toast both sides and melt cheese.

name: Guacamole
directions: In a medium bowl, mash the avocados and juice the lime. Stir to combine.
Finely mince garlic. Seed and chop the jalapenos, chop the onion, and tomatoes. Add to the mashed avocados.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

name: Hamburger Rice Skillet
ingredients: 1 envelope onion recipe soup & dip mix
directions: In a large skillet, cook beef over medium heat until no longer pink; drain.
Stir in water, carrots, celery, and soup mix. Bring to boil.
Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 8 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
Return to boil; add rice, reduce heat, cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir. Cover; let stand 5 minutes or until rice is tender.

name: Ham & Cheddar Egg Muffins
ingredients: 1/2 cup finely shredded triple cheddar cheese
directions: In a bowl add eggs, milk and salt and pepper to taste, Whisk until mixture is well blended and smooth.
Place six large silicone cupcake cups on a sheet pan. Pour equal parts of egg mixture into the six cups.
Add equal parts of ham, cheese and onions to each cup making sure that the egg mixture covers the contents. Sprinkle paprika on top of each cup.

Heat oven to 350 °F (175 °C) and place pan with the egg muffins into the middle rack of the oven. Cooking could vary between 20-30 minutes. You want all the liquid to harden with a little bit of browning.
The cooked muffin should effortlessly separate from the silicone cup once cooled.

name: Hash Brown and Sausage Burrito
directions: Heat oil in a pan and fry the hash browns.
Add sausage and egg. Cook until done.
Arrange on tortilla then add shredded cheese.
Roll and wrap. Serve.

name: Healthy Granola Bars
ingredients: 3/4 cup dry roasted & salted sunflower seeds
directions: Mix all dry ingredients together.
In a saucepan melt coconut oil, add almond butter, and honey. Stir together and pour over dry ingredients. Mix well.
Grease an approximately 8x10" pan and press your mixture into the pan. Keep refrigerated.

name: Healthy Shamrock Shake
directions: Place avocado, spinach, protein powder and milk in a blender and blend until smooth.
Add the liquid stevia peppermint drops, extract, and ice, and blend until thick.
Taste and adjust stevia, as needed.

name: Hearty Chicken Noodle Soup
directions: In a 5 quart slow cooker, combine all ingredients except the linguine. Cover and cook on low 5-6 hours or until meat is tender.
Remove chicken, cool slightly.
Stir linguine into soup, cover and cook on high for 30 minutes or until pasta is tender.
Cut chicken into bite size pieces and return to soup. Heat through.

name: Hellman's Juicy Chicken Breast
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (165 °C).
Combine mayonnaise with cheese in a medium bowl. Arrange chicken on baking sheet. Evenly top with mayonnaise mixture, then sprinkle with bread crumbs.
Bake until chicken is thoroughly cooked, about 20 minutes.

name: Herbed Orange Chicken
directions: In a small bowl combine orange peel, orange juice, minced garlic, and oil.
Place chicken breast in a large zip lock bag.  Pour orange juice mixture over chicken in bag; seal bag.
Marinate chicken in fridge for 10 minutes. Meanwhile in small bowl combine; sage, rosemary, salt, and pepper.
Remove chicken from marinade; discard marinade. Place chicken on a plate or tray.  Sprinkle spice mixture onto both sides of chicken breast halves.
Heat a large nonstick skillet to medium-high heat, spray with cooking spray. Add chicken; cook for 10-12 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink, turning once. Serve.

name: Homemade Egg Salad
directions: Chop eggs, green onions, and sweet onions.
Combine with mayonnaise, and add salt and pepper to taste.
Serve with toast, if desired.

name: Homemade FullBars
directions: Melt a half cup peanut butter, half cup brown rice syrup and 2 tablespoons protein powder in a small pot over low heat. (The protein powder is optional. Vanilla, chocolate or strawberry protein powder goes well with the peanut butter).

Pour the melted sauce over 6 cups of puffed rice in a large bowl and mix thoroughly. (It's best to work quickly here. As soon as you take the sauce off the burner and it starts to cool, the harder it gets to stir. Also be mindfull that you're working with a hot, VERY sticky substance).
Put the finished product into a greased pan (just like if you were making rice crispy treats) and cool in the refrigerator for half an hour.
Remove from pan and slice into 10 pieces. (You can wrap the pieces individually. They shouldn't need refrigerated. But they are fine to store in the fridge if you're worried).
And of course, feel free to play with the ratios of ingredients to your taste. You can't really mess these up.

name: Honey-Apple Pancakes
directions: In a medium bowl, stir together flour, baking powder, salt, apple pie spice, and baking soda. Make a well in the center. Set aside.
In another bowl, stir together egg, apple juice, honey, and oil. Add egg mixture all at once to flour mixture. Stir until just combined.
Lightly coat a heavy nonstick skillet with Pam. Heat over medium heat. For each pancake, pour 1/4 cup of batter onto hot skillet spreading to 4" diameter.
Cook for 2-3 minutes or until pancakes have bubbly surfaces and edges are slightly dry. Turn. Cook for another 2 -3 minutes more or until golden brown.
If desired serve with syrup.

name: Honey Cashew Chicken
ingredients: l lb boneless skinless chicken breast, cut into bite sized pieces
directions: Combine chicken, cornstarch, seasoning blend, and pepper in a bowl; toss to coat.
Heat a wok or large skillet to medium-high heat. Add canola oil and sesame oil. Add chicken mixture, and saute 4 minutes or until lightly browned.
Increase heat to high, and add broccoli, carrots, garlic, onion, and red bell pepper. Cook 5 minutes or until vegetables are crisp tender and chicken is done, stirring frequently. Stir in cashews.
Combine vinegar, honey, soy sauce, and sriracha in a small bowl; stir with a whisk.  Add vinegar mixture to chicken mixture. Toss to coat. Serve with brown rice if desired.

name: Honey Dijon Crusted Salmon
directions: Preheat oven to 400 °F (205 °C).
In a small bowl, stir together butter, mustard, and honey. Set aside. In another bowl, mix together bread crumbs, and parsley.
Brush each salmon fillet lightly with honey mustard mixture, and sprinkle the tops of the fillets with the bread crumb mixture
Bake salmon 12-15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until it flakes easily with a fork.
Season with salt and pepper, and garnish with a wedge of lemon.

name: Honey Garlic Chicken
directions: Mix all ingredients together except chicken.
Place chicken in crock-pot.
Pour mixture over chicken.
Cook for 4-5 hours on low or 3 hours on high.

name: Honey Roasted Pumpkin
ingredients: 3 cups pumpkin, cut in large pieces
directions: Preheat oven to 375° F (190° C).
In a bowl, pour oil and honey over pumpkin. Toss well.
Place in an ovenproof dish and season with salt and pepper.
Cover loosely with a piece of foil and roast for 40 minutes.
Remove foil and bake for a further 20 minutes, or until pumpkin is golden.

name: Hot & Sweet Chicken Salad
directions: Cook and chop chicken breasts.
Wash and halve grapes (amount should roughly equal to chicken), wash and chop celery, and chop pecans.
Mix prepared chicken, grapes, celery, pecans, sweet pickle relish, mayonnaise, cayenne pepper and salt together.
Serve in lettuce leaves.

name: Individual Cheesecakes
directions: Preheat oven to 325 °F (160 °C) and add cupcake liners to a 12 cup muffin pan.
With a mixer, beat the cream cheese until smooth. Slowly incorporate the sweetener, blending well.
Stop using the mixer and switch to a wooden spoon. Add vanilla, lemon juice and sour cream. Blend just enough to mix the ingredients. Add the eggs one at a time, gently mixing after each.
Divide batter into the 12 cups.
Bake for 15 minutes. Let sit and cool for 30 minutes then transfer to fridge and cool for at least 2 hours before eating.

name: Italian Cabbage
directions: Squeeze sausage out of casing into a large pot and saute over medium heat breaking down into ground sausage. You may need to add a bit of olive oil so it doesn't stick to the pan.
Chop green cabbage into large shredded pieces and place over the cooked sausage.
Crush stewed tomatoes over top of the cabbage.
Add your garlic powder and red pepper flakes. Place a lid on the pot and simmer over medium-low heat for approximately 20-30 minutes until the cabbage has softened.
Stir to mix ingredients. Serve immediately as a side or a full-keto meal. This actually tastes better the next day as all of the flavors meld together.
Bon appetit.

name: Jalapeno Poppers
directions: Cut jalapeños in half. Scoop out seeds and extra membrane. Soak peppers in a bowl of water for 30-60 minutes. This helps reduce some of the oil from the peppers which is what gives them their heat.
Mix the cheddar cheese with the cream cheese. Using a knife, fill each pepper with cheese.
Cut the the bacon in half or in thirds so you have enough for each pepper. Take bacon strip and wrap as many times around bacon as you can. Place wrapped peppers on a baking tray.
Preheat the broiler in your oven. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until the bacon turns nice and crispy. Take out of oven. No matter what, no matter how tempting, let them sit long enough to cool.

Note: use latex gloves when handling raw jalapeños, especially the seeds. Otherwise, the oil will get all over your hands and if you wipe your eyes or itch your nose, you are in for a world of pain. If you don't have latex gloves, just use plastic bags. Throw away gloves or bags as soon as you are done using. Wash your hands with soap just to be sure.

name: Japanese Soup with Tofu & Mushrooms
directions: Slice mushrooms into thin slices, chop onion and cube tofu.
In a medium saucepan, bring broth to boil; reduce heat to low, add mushrooms and cook for 3 minutes.
In a small bowl, mix miso paste and liquid amino together.
Stir mixture into broth along with tofu.
Simmer 5 minutes, and serve topped with green onion.

name: Jello Peach Yogurt
ingredients: 1 package sugar free peach gelatin dessert
directions: Make jello per package directions.
Add yogurt to jello.
Pour into 3 containers.

name: Kale & Brussels Sprout Salad
directions: Shred or thinly slice 1 bunch of raw kale and 1 lb of raw brussels sprouts in a salad bowl.
Toast chopped pecans in a skillet over high heat for 60-90 seconds and add to salad bowl. Add raisins to salad bowl. Toss all ingredients in salad bowl to distribute evenly.
To make vinaigrette mix together olive oil, apple cider vinegar, maple syrup and dry mustard. Pour vinaigrette over salad and stir to evenly coat.
Let sit in fridge for at least 4 hours or overnight.

name: Kale Chips
directions: Pre-heat air fryer at 370°F. Wash and drain chopped kale. Pat dry to remove excess water.
In a bowl, mix oil, salt, and pepper. Add kale then toss.
Place in the air fryer. Cook for 10 minutes or until crispy.

name: Kale & Feta Breakfast Casserole
ingredients: 1 tbsp organic extra virgin coconut oil
directions: Preheat oven to 375 °F (190 °C).
Wash the kale if needed and spin dry or dry with paper towels, then coarsely chop kale.

Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large frying pan. When oil is hot add the kale and cook while stirring until kale is wilted and starting to soften, about 3-5 minutes (red Russian kale will cook more quickly; darker green kale varieties will take longer to soften.)

Spray a 8"x10" casserole dish with olive oil or nonstick spray, then put barely-cooked kale in the bottom of the dish. Crumble feta cheese over the kale. Beat eggs with 1 teaspoon Spike Seasoning, salt, and fresh ground black pepper; then pour eggs over kale/feta  (take a fork and gently stir so the veggies and cheese are well distributed in the eggs).
Bake the casserole 40-45 minutes, or until eggs are set and the top is starting to lightly brown. Serve hot. Good with a dollop of low-fat sour cream.
Note: leftover egg casserole will keep in the fridge for about a week. Reheat in the microwave for 1-2 minutes.

name: Kale Leek Soup
directions: Bring 2 1/2 cups of water to a boil, add in a pinch of salt to taste.
Chop all vegetables into chunks, wash and place them into the pot.
Boil the vegetables till they become tender and can easily be poked with a fork.
Place half a cup of water onto a blender and add your cooked vegetables then blend on a medium speed until smooth. Add salt and pepper to taste.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Kale Salad
directions: Cook quinoa according to directions and set aside.
Chop kale and avocado into bite-sized pieces.
Toss all ingredients together in a large bowl until the kale is well coated with the oil.

Notes: this salad will keep for several days in an air-tight container. To keep longer, prepare the balsamic vinaigrette (vinegar, oil, salt and pepper,) and pour over the salad only once you are ready to eat it. Also try adding other fresh herbs for an extra boost of flavor and nutrients such as parsley, chervil and mint.

name: Keto Biscuits
directions: Preheat the oven to 400 °F (205 °C).
Melt cream cheese and Colby jack in the microwave for 1 minute, mix until combined (microwave longer of needed).
Add almond flour, baking powder and egg, mix with spoon until roughly combined then by hand until fully combined.
Slit into 4 and plop on a baking sheet.
Bake for 12-15 minutes or until deep golden brown. Let sit until almost cool (or they will be ultra mushy).

name: Keto Bread
ingredients: 1/2 tsp baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
directions: Beat the egg with melted butter. Put on a microwave-safe bowl or mug.
Add the remaining ingredients and mix well.
Cook in the microwave for 90 seconds to 2 minutes.
Let cool then remove from the mug. Slice into two pieces.

name: Keto Chia Pudding
directions: Add all ingredients for base to large bowl. Stir to combine.
Allow base to settle 5 minutes, then mix to get rid of any clumps.
Cover and place in refrigerator for at least 3 hours or overnight. You can put all ingredients into a blender after chia seeds have expanded for a more creamy pudding.
Stir in any variations and enjoy. A serving is 1/2 cup before any variations.

Variations: a) Strawberries and Cream: 1/4 cup mashed strawberries, 1/4 cup low carb Greek yogurt, 1/4 cup chopped strawberries. b) Chocolate Coconut: 1 scoop chocolate protein powder combined with 4 oz water to form a "pudding" and 1/2 cup unsweetened shredded coconut. c) PB&J: 1/4 cup blackberries and 1/4 cup low carb peanut butter.

name: Keto Chicken Nuggets
ingredients: 44 g fancy low-moisture part-skim mozzarella cheese shredded
directions: Mix everything together.
Scoop mixture and form nuggets. Transfer to parchment lined tray.
Bake in pre-heated oven at 400°F for 10 minutes, then flip back and cook for another 10 minutes.

name: Keto Chocolate Chip Mug Cookie
ingredients: 2 tbsps unsweetened dark chocolate baking chips
directions: Melt butter and combine wet ingredients.
Combine dry ingredients.
Mix wet and dry ingredients.
Microwave 1 minute.

name: Keto Egg Muffin
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).
Crack eggs and add salt and pepper.
Butter or spray the bottom of a muffin pan.
Add cheese to the bottom of pan.
Add sausage.
Pour over beaten eggs.
Top with cheese.
Bake for 20 minutes.

name: Keto Hot Dogs n Greens
directions: Sauté garlic in ghee, and then add chopped hot dogs, cook until brown.
Add greens and sauté until desired temperature.
Plate and top with grated cheese.

name: Keto Krack
directions: Melt butter and mix in stevia. Bring to a boil and pull off heat.
Stir in vanilla and salt.
Stir in almonds and peanuts.
Spread out on cookie sheet lined with parchment paper. Let sit and cool for 20 minutes.
Melt chocolate chips and coconut oil. Stir until smooth.
Add nuts back in and stir until well mixed.
Spread back on cookie sheet lined with parchment paper. Refrigerate 30 minutes.
Break apart into 12 pieces.

name: Keto Lazy Woman Waffles
directions: Whisk eggs and mayonnaise until thoroughly incorporated.
Add Swerve and mix thoroughly.
Add all dry ingredients.
Let sit at least one minute (or cover and store in refrigerator).
Heat up waffle iron.
Cook for 1 1/2 minutes (alternatively, you can make pancakes).

name: Keto No Bake Cookies
directions: Chop pecans, granola, and coconut in food processor.
Melt peanut butter, chocolate, and sweetener of choice in microwave, stir until fully blended.
Mix together.
Drop spoonful's onto parchment or wax paper.

name: Keto Pancakes
directions: In a medium bowl, whisk together almond flour, cream cheese, eggs, and lemon zest until smooth.

In a nonstick skillet over medium heat, melt 1 tbsp butter. Pour in 3 tbsps batter and cook until golden, 2 minutes. Flip and cook 2 minutes more. Transfer to a plate and continue with the rest of the batter.
Serve topped with butter.

name: Keto Pancakes
directions: Mix all ingredients (except syrup) in a bowl.
Heat a non-stick pan and pour mixture into circles.
Cook until both sides are firm and set.
Serve on a plate with syrup.

name: Keto Potato-less Latkes
directions: Combine cream cheese and mozzarella in a microwave safe bowl. Heat for 1-2 minutes until partially melted and stir. Microwave again for another minute and stir.
Add half the almond flour and stir. Microwave again for a minute and then add remaining almond flour. Stir until everything is smooth.
When mixture has cooled down a bit, add one beaten egg and stir in until it disappears. Don't add the egg to the mixture when it is really hot or it will cook the egg.
Spoon into a hot oiled pan. Flip when one side is crispy and brown. Plate. Serve with sour cream and hot sauce.
Makes 3 6-7" pancakes.

name: Keto Veggies & Eggs
directions: Chop veggies.
Sauté in ghee until cooked, about 5-8 minutes.
Add eggs and mayo and cook until desired.

name: Keto Waffles
directions: Whisk the egg whites until firm and form stiff peaks.
In a second bowl mix the egg yolks, almond flour, stevia and baking powder.
