Add the melted butter slowly, mixing to ensure it is a smooth consistency.
Add the heavy cream and vanilla, mix well.
Gently fold spoons of the whisked egg whites into the yolk mixture. Try to keep as much of the air and fluffiness as possible.
Place enough of the waffle mixture into the warm waffle maker to make one waffle. Cook until golden.
Repeat until all the mixture has been used.

name: Korean Beef
directions: Heat a large skillet over medium heat and brown ground beef with garlic in the sesame oil.
Drain off fat and add brown sugar, soy sauce, ginger and red pepper flakes. Simmer for a few minutes to blend flavors.
If desired serve over steamed rice and top with green onions.
Note: you can swap the ground beef for ground turkey.

name: Lasagna
ingredients: 1 cup shredded part skim mozzarella cheese
directions: Preheat oven to 375 °F (190 °C).
Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook 9 lasagna noodles according to package directions. Drain pasta and lay flat on a sheet tray to cool.
Meanwhile in a non stick skillet over medium heat cook the ground turkey until browned. Add spaghetti sauce and bring to simmer.

Spray a 9x13" pan with non stick spray. Pour enough of meat sauce onto the bottom just to cover the bottom. Top with 3 sheets of lasagna, top lasagna with 1 cup of meat sauce, 1/2 ricotta cheese, 2 tablespoons of 3 cheese Italian blend.

Layer another 3 sheets of lasagna, top with 1 cup of sauce and the remaining ricotta cheese and 2 tablespoons of 3 cheese Italian blend. Top with last 3 lasagna noodles. Top with remaining sauce and sprinkle remain 3 cheese Italian blend and mozzarella.
Cover with foil and bake for 25-30 minutes. Let rest 5 minutes before slicing and serving.

name: Lean Meatloaf
directions: Combine catsup, mustard, and honey for topping and set aside.
Combine remaining ingredients and put into a small loaf pan.
Spread topping on meatloaf.
Bake at 350 °F (175 °C) for 1 hour.

name: Lembas Bread
directions: Mix flour, baking powder, and salt into a large bowl. Add butter and mix. Gradually add sugar and cinnamon to incorporate.
Add cream, honey, and vanilla. Stir until a thick dough forms.
Roll out dough until about 1/2 inch thick. Cut into squares and make an 'X' across the top of each.
Bake at 425°F for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Let it cool and serve.

name: Lemon Butter Asparagus
directions: Cut hard part of stems off and discard. Cut asparagus into 3 sections. Place in a pot of boiling water. Boil 4 minutes until bright green, crisp and tender. Remove, drain and rinse with cold water. Set aside while preparing sauce.
Place butter in a deep skillet or heavy saucepan and melt over medium-high heat. Add flour and turn heat to medium. Whisk until smooth.

Add garlic, lemon juice and milk. Thin sauce with water until a thin batter consistency. Whisking constantly bring to slow boil then immediately add asparagus back to sauce turn off heat and toss to coat.
Add salt and pepper to taste if desired.

name: Lemon Cheesecake Fat Bombs
directions: Mix all room temperature ingredients together with a hand mixer until very smooth.
Include lemon zest from the fresh lemons that you use for the lemon juice.
Spoon into silicone molds.
Freeze until firm.  Then pop out of molds and keep frozen until needed.

name: Lemon Chicken
directions: Pat chicken dry with paper towels.
Combine oregano, seasoned salt, and pepper. Rub over chicken.
Brown chicken in a skillet over medium heat. Let chicken rest 8 minutes then cut into 1" pieces. Place chicken in slow cooker.
Combine water, lemon juice, garlic, and bouillon in skillet. Bring to boil, stirring to loosen browned bits. Pour over chicken.
Cover. Cook on low 3-4 hours. Stir chicken. Remove lid and cook 15-30 minutes longer, allowing juices to thicken slightly. Add parsley.
Serve chicken and juices over rice.

name: Lemon Pepper Chicken
directions: Place the chicken in a gallon size zip lock bag. Add the lemon juice and marinate for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 375 °F (190 °C).
Place chicken in a 9x13" baking dish. Pour the lemon juice from the bag on top of the chicken.
Cut the butter into 4 pieces. Add to baking dish. Sprinkle the lemon pepper seasoning evenly on top of chicken.
Cover with foil and bake 30-35 minutes, or until juices run clear.
Remove dish from oven and let cool for 10 minutes. Take the chicken and place in a medium size bowl and using two forks shred. Serve in taco shells.
Note: if you think the chicken seems a little dry you can pour some of the lemon butter juice from the pan into the chicken.

name: Lemon Poppy Seed Muffins
ingredients: 1 3/4 tsps baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
directions: Mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, lemon peel, and poppy seeds.
Melt the butter and let it cool. Mix with the remaining ingredients.
Combine the two mixture. Make sure there are no lumps.
Divide batter evenly between muffin cups.
Bake in preheated oven at 350°F for about 20 minutes or until the tops spring back when lightly touched.

name: Lemon Shrimp Stir-Fry
directions: For sauce, in a small bowl stir together chicken broth, lemon juice, cornstarch, chili flakes, and soy sauce; set aside.
In a large skillet heat half the oil over medium-high heat. Add broccoli and carrots; cook and stir for 4-6 minutes or until crisp-tender. Remove from skillet.
Add remaining oil and shrimp to the skillet. Cook and stir for 2-3 minutes or until shrimp are cooked. Remove from pan.
Stir sauce; add to skillet. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Return vegetables and shrimp to skillet; stir to coat with sauce. Cook and stir for 1-2 minutes or until heated through.
If desired serve over rice.

name: Lentil Soup with Spinac hi Dr hhu by rr gy by
ingredients: 1 cup lentils, brown or green, picked over & rinsed
directions: In a large pot, sauté celery, carrot and onion in olive oil until soft but not browned.
Add lentils and stock (or water).
Cook with pot cover tilted over medium heat for about 45 minutes or until lentils are tender.
Stir occasionally and add more liquid if needed.
Add spinach and sausage (optional) and cook for another 15 minutes.
A healthy squeeze of lemon juice really finishes the soup!
Season to taste with freshly ground salt and pepper.

name: Lentil Stew
directions: Cut onions lengthwise and dice mushrooms.
In a non-stick pan, sauté the vegetables. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add lentils and some water. Simmer for 15 minutes and season to taste.

name: Lime Chicken Crockpot
directions: Mix salsa, black beans and chopped cilantro.
Add lime juice, garlic powder, cayenne pepper and some salt.
Salt the chicken on both sides and add to the mix.
Cook on low for 6-8 hours.

name: Linguine in White Clam Sauce
directions: Prepare pasta according to package directions.
In a medium skillet, heat olive oil and saute onions and garlic for 3-5 minutes.
Stir in wine; bring to boil for about 3 minutes to reduce liquid.
Stir in clams, parsley and pepper; cook to heat through.
Serve over cooked linguine pasta.

name: Little Liter Deviled Eggs
directions: Boil eggs.
Slice eggs in half long ways.
Carefully remove egg yolks.
Mix egg yolks, sweet pickle relish, light mayonnaise, dijon and yellow mustard in a small mixing bowl.
Spoon mixture into egg halves. Garnish.
Let sit in fridge for 2 hours.
Note: garnish as you please, both paprika and parsley are nice.

name: Loaded Cauliflower
directions: Break cauliflower into pieces. Bring to boil in pan with water. Simmer 10 minutes. Drain.
Place all ingredients, except onion and bacon bits, in food processor. Mix until smooth.
Stir in bacon bits and onion. Place in ramekin and bake about 15 minutes.

name: Loaded Mashed Cauliflower
directions: Air fry bacon until crispy or desired texture is achieved.
Pan fry peppers until softened.
Slice green onions and measure out cheddar cheese.
Add all ingredients to mashed cauliflower.
Bake mashed cauliflower according to packaging directions or until cheese has melted.

name: Low Carb Bread
ingredients: 1/4 cup & 1 tbsp ground golden flaxseed meal
directions: Melt butter in a large bowl. Add all other ingredients and whisk together really well.
Take 6 oven safe bowls, ramekins or tins, basically anything that will give you the shape and size you want.
Divide batter up evenly among the 6 tins, you’ll end up with approximately 1/3 cup of batter in each tin.
Bake at 350 °F (175 °C) for 20 minutes.
Let them cool for a few minutes, then carefully slice each bun. Toast them to desired crispness and enjoy.

name: Low Carb Bread
directions: Separate the egg white and yolk.
Beat the egg white with cream of tartar and protein powder until stiff.
Fold in the egg yolks.
Transfer the mixture to a lightly greased bread pan.
Bake at 350°F for 55 minutes.
Turn off the oven and let the bread sit for 15 minutes.
Remove and cool completely before cutting.

name: Low Carb Ham & Egg Boats
ingredients: 2 tbsps shredded colby & monterey jack cheese
directions: Preheat oven to 400 °F (205 °C). Get muffin pan, spray oil of choice. Lay ham in there to make a cup
Break egg and pour into ham cup.  Sprinkle cheese over egg.
Add salt & pepper to taste, then bake in oven for 10-15 minutes.

name: Low Carb Pancakes
directions: Preheat non-stick frying pan/griddle to medium-high heat with a spritz of non-fat cooking spray.
Add water and egg white to Magic Bullet or blender first (otherwise, dry ingredients will not blend properly).
Add all dry ingredients with wet in blender. Blend for 30 seconds.
Carefully and slowly pour 3-4 small pancakes (or 2 larger) onto frying pan or griddle. Cook on one side until bubbles, then flip and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Serve with pancake syrup.

name: Low Carb Zucchini Muffins
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).
Grate the zucchini and melt the coconut oil in the microwave.
Combine all ingredients except the zucchini in a bowl or a food processor and mix well.
Stir in the zucchini.
Line a muffin pan with paper cups and half fill each cup with the dough.
Bake for 25 minutes or until lightly browned on top.

name: Mac N Cheese
directions: Boil pasta according to package directions.

Melt butter in a saucepan, add flour and stir until combined. Add milk and cook for 1-2 minutes until thickened. Add cheese and stir until melted. Add ground mustard and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Stir pasta into sauce and serve.

name: Madeleines
ingredients: 2 tsps baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
directions: Pre-heat oven to 375°F.
Mix wet ingredients. Slowly add flour and baking powder.
Place tablespoons of mixture into prepared madeleine moulds.
Bake for 15 minutes or until golden and cakes spring back when pressed in the center. Cool on a wire rack then serve.

name: Maple Pecan Granola
ingredients: 100 g organic 100% whole ground golden flaxseed meal
directions: Pre-heat oven at 300°F.
Mix dry ingredients together.
Warm butter and maple syrup in the microwave.
Mix wet and dry ingredients together.
Spread evenly on a parchment lined baking sheet.
Bake for 40 mins. Let cool before transferring to an airtight container.

name: Marinated Jalapenos
directions: Roast 12 fresh jalapeno peppers under the broiler or on a grill until the skin is blackened, about 5-7 minutes.
Put roasted peppers in a bowl and cover with plastic wrap and let them sweat for 10 minutes.
Peel the skin off the peppers. Lightly coat your hands with oil or wear gloves to peel the peppers.
Put peeled peppers in a jar and add the liquid ingredients.
Store in the refrigerator.

name: Matzo Pancakes
directions: In a bowl, crumble matzo.
Gradually add milk, egg, and sugar. Mix well.
In a non-stick pan, scoop mixture and cook until toasted.

name: Meatball & Hash Brown Casserole
ingredients: 10 1/2 oz low fat condensed cream of chicken soup
1 cup reduced fat shredded cheddar cheese
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).
Form ground beef into 20 meatballs (if desired season with salt and pepper). Spray baking sheet with cooking spray and place meatballs on baking sheet. Bake 20 minutes or until cooked through.
In a bowl, stir together soup, sour cream, cheese, seasoning blend, and pepper. With a paper towel, pat hash browns dry and then stir into soup mixture.
Spray a 9"x13" baking dish with cooking spray and spread hash brown mixture into prepared dish.
Slightly press cooked meatballs into hash brown mixture in even rows.
Cover and bake 35 minutes. Uncover and bake 10-15 minutes more or until hash browns are done.
Note: you can use frozen fully cooked meatballs if you are in a hurry, but it's better if you bake your own.

name: Mediterranean Pasta Salad
ingredients: 7 oz manzanilla olives stuffed with minced pimiento
12 oz garden delight trio italiano pasta
directions: Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta and rinse in cold water.
Meanwhile chop the salami into bite size pieces. Chop the olives in half. Chop the provolone cheese into bite size pieces.
In a large bowl combine the cucumbers, tomatoes, olives, peppers, and pasta. Stir in the provolone cheese, 1/2 of the Parmesan cheese and salami.
Add dressing, toss to coat.
Sprinkle with remaining Parmesan cheese.

name: Mediterranean Salad
directions: Toast whole wheat pita.
Rinse and drain chickpeas.
Toss chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, cucumber and black olives with lemon juice.
Serve with toasted whole wheat pita chips.

name: Mexican Bean Salad
directions: Drain beans.
Mix all ingredients together.
Serve.

name: Mexican Coleslaw
directions: Shred cabbage, grate carrot, chop jalapeno (deseeded), onions and cilantro.
Add juice of 3 limes and cayenne pepper.
Stir well and refrigerate. Best serve after chilled for at least a few hours.

name: Mexican Lentil Soup
directions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion, celery, and carrots and cook until tender, 8-10 minutes. Add garlic and cook 1 minute.
Add lentils, vegetable broth, tomatoes, jalapeno, cumin, coriander, salt, pepper, and cilantro.
Bring to a boil and turn down heat to a simmer. Cook for 20-25 minutes.
Serve. If desired, top with sliced avocado, cheese, and corn tortillas cut into strips.
Note: this recipe can be used in a slow cooker, just throw all ingredients into the pot for 4-6 hours

name: Mexican Summer Salad
directions: In a large bowl, combine beans (rinsed and drained), bell peppers and red onion.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, lime juice, lemon juice, cilantro, and black pepper.
Season to taste with garlic and chili powder.
Pour olive oil dressing over vegetables; mix well.
Chill thoroughly, and serve cold.
Note: based on a recipe from allrecipes.

name: Mexican Turkey Muffins
directions: Mix all ingredients together.
Bake in a  greased muffin pan for 20-25 minutes at 350 °F (175 °C).

name: Microwave Bread
directions: Melt the butter in a ramekin.
Add the almond flour, baking powder, salt and egg. Mix well.
Cook in the microwave for 90 seconds.
Remove bread from ramekin. Cut in half and toast in a skillet until desired crispness.

name: Microwave Omelette
ingredients: 1/2 oz fat free shredded cheddar cheese
directions: Mix all ingredients in a mug.
Microwave for 1 minute and 30 seconds.

name: Microwave Peanut Brittle
directions: Mix with a spatula the peanuts, sugar, and syrup together in a large glass bowl.
Microwave 4 minutes, mix, and microwave 4 minutes more.
Add butter and vanilla and mix.
Microwave 1 minute.
Mix in baking powder.
Quickly move mix on to a greased cookie sheet using the spatula and spread to one peanut thick.
Cool completely, break into pieces and store in an airtight container.

name: Mild Creamy Chicken Curry
directions: Heat half the oil in a large non stick frying pan. Cook onion for 5 minutes, until softened. Add garlic and spices and cook for 2 minutes.
Add remaining oil and chicken and cook for 5-7 minutes, turning to coat the chicken in the spices and to seal it on all sides.
Add the stock and lentils and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer for 20 minutes or until the chicken and lentils are cooked.

Stir in the yogurt and season with salt and pepper to taste, and heat through for 2 minutes until piping hot once more. Do not bring to boil after adding yogurt or the curry sauce may separate.  Serve.
Note: if desired sprinkle each serving with toasted almonds and cilantro and serve over rice or with warmed naan bread.

name: Mini Cheeseburger Pies
directions: Heat oven to 375 °F (190 °C). Spray 12 regular size muffin cups with cooking spray.
In a skillet, cook beef over medium-high heat for 5-7 minutes, stirring frequently, until no longer pink. Drain. Cool 5 minutes.
Stir in Worcestershire sauce, garlic salt, and cheese.
In a medium bowl stir milk, egg whites, and Bisquick with whisk until blended.
Spoon 1 tablespoon Bisquick mixture into each muffin cup. Top with 1/4 cup burger mixture. Spoon 1 tablespoon Bisquick mixture onto burger mixture in each muffin cup.
Bake for 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean, and muffins are golden brown. Cool 5 minutes
With a thin knife loosen muffins from pan. Remove from pan and place on cooling rack. Cool for 10 more minutes. Serve.
Note: you can swap out the ground beef for ground turkey if you wish.

name: Mini Chocolate Protein Muffins
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C). Spray muffin tin pan with non-stick spray and set aside.
Whisk together egg whites, almond butter and almond milk in a mixing bowl until smooth.
Add the remainder of the ingredients to the mixing bowl and stir until well combined.
Evenly spoon batter into muffin tins making 15 mini muffins total.
Bake in oven for 10 minutes and enjoy.

name: Mixed Berry Smoothie with Flax Seed
directions: Blend unsweetened almond milk, nonfat plain Greek yogurt, flax seed and mixed berries until smooth.
Note: add honey or banana to sweeten.

name: Mixed Green Salad with Cheese
ingredients: 30 g fancy shredded mexican 4 cheese blend
directions: Wash and chop vegetables. Transfer to a bowl.
Dice ham and add to the bowl.
Toss gently and top with cheese .

name: Mixed Vegetable Curry
directions: In a wok, gently heat the peanut and sesame oils with black mustard seeds. When the mustard seeds begin to sizzle and pop add onion and fry until golden.
Add garlic, ginger and chili and fry over medium-low heat until softened. Add curry powder and fry for a further 2-3 minutes.
Add potato, eggplant and cauliflower and fry for 5 minutes making sure that the vegetables are well coated in the spice mix.

Add tomatoes, stir well and place lid on the wok, turn down the heat to low and leave to cook for 20 minutes. Check after 10 minutes and give the vegetables a gentle stir to ensure that they aren't sticking (if so add a drop of water).
After 20 minutes check to see whether the vegetables are cooked, if not, give them another 10 minutes.
Once everything is cooked, sprinkle the chopped coriander over the top and serve as is or with rice, naan or chapati.
Note: like all curries, this improves with time will be tastier the following day. Other vegetables as well as chickpeas can be used. Also suitable as a stuffing for peppers.

name: Moo Shu Pork
directions: Heat oil in a large, nonstick frying pan or wok over medium-high heat. Add ginger powder and stir for 1 minute.
Add the broccoli slaw to the pan, and turn up the heat a little. Stir-fry the vegetables for 4 to 5 minutes. Cook them long enough to darken in color without losing their crunchiness.
Turn the heat down to medium, and stir in the pork, soy sauce, hoisin sauce, red pepper flakes and cashews. Continue cooking moo shu for another 2 minutes to heat through. Serve over rice.

name: Morning Fruit Juice
directions: Remove skin of fruits then slice.
Squeeze juice from fruits using juicer.
Divide juice into 12 oz jars.
Refrigerate.

name: Morning Glory Breakfast Cookie
ingredients: 2 tbsps golden roasted flaxseed with whole seeds
1/4 tsp baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
directions: Pre-heat oven to 375°F. Whisk flour, cinnamon, salt, baking powder, and baking soda in a medium bowl.
Mix carrot, egg, walnuts, oats, yogurt, coconut oil, pumpkin seeds, maple syrup, dried cranberries, flaxseeds, and 1/4 cup coconut flakes in a large bowl.
Add dry ingredients and mix well to incorporate.  Let sit for 10 minutes at room temperature to thicken slightly.

Transfer remaining coconut flakes to a medium bowl. Scoop 1/4 cup batter into the bowl of coconut flakes to coat.  Arrange coconut-coated batter in parchment-lined baking sheets, observing 2 inches gap in between.  Flatten each ball slightly.
Bake cookies for 15-17 minutes or until golden. Let it cool.
Store cookies in an airtight container for 4-6 days at room temperature or freeze for up to 3 months.

name: Morning Glory Muffins
directions: Pre-heat oven to 375°F. Mix dry ingredients together, making a well in the center.
Stir honey, oil, orange juice, eggs, and vanilla together.
Add honey mixture to dry ingredients. Mix well to combine.
Add carrots and raisins.
Spoon batter into muffin cups 2/3 full.
Bake for 20 minutes. Perform toothpick test. Let it cool then serve.

name: Muffins
directions: Mix wet ingredients in a bowl. Add zucchini and carrots.
Add remaining ingredients.
Scoop out mixture to muffin cups and bake at pre-heated oven at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.

name: Muffins
ingredients: 1 cup 100% lactose free low fat milk
3 tsps baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
directions: Pre-heat oven at 400°F.
Mix dry ingredients first, then slowly add wet ingredients.
Pour mix into muffin tray 3/4 full.
Bake for 15 minutes until golden. Let cool completely.

name: Mushroom Ravioli with Diced Chicken Breast
ingredients: 24 oz spicy tomato & basil pasta sauce
directions: Dice chicken and onions. Season as necessary. Sauté with olive oil in very large chicken-fryer pan or 6 qt pot until done.
Add pasta sauce and drained mushrooms to chicken and onions and heat through.
Cook pasta as directed. Drain.
Mix ravioli into pasta sauce mixture. Let sit 10 minutes.
Top with a little shaved parmesan if desired. Enjoy.

name: Mushroom Rigatoni
directions: Dice onions and garlic. Chop mushrooms.
Sauté onions and garlic in olive oil until caramelized, then add mushrooms.
Add a cup of water and seasonings.
Cook down mixture and deglaze with wine.

Add pasta and enough water to cover it. Simmer on medium high heat. Note: Add water in small amounts as needed to cook pasta, but not too much to avoid making the sauce runny. Sauce should be a little thick when pasta is done.
Once the pasta is tender and the liquid is reduced, turn off heat then serve.

name: Mushrooms and Eggs
ingredients: 1 small russet potatoes (flesh and skin, baked)
directions: Add oil to a pan and heat on low.
Dice onion add it and garlic to pan saute 5 min.
Dice and add mushroom cook for another 5 min then dice and add potato cook until just below fully cooked.
Beat 6 eggs and 3 tbsp of milk of choice till all one color.
Add eggs to vegetables mixture cook to done.
Top with green onions and serve.

name: Mushrooms and Onions
directions: Chop onions and saute with salt in olive oil.
Slice and add mushrooms. Cook until they release their liquids.
Cook down until liquid is almost gone and mushrooms start to brown.

name: Mushroom Spinach Omelet
directions: Whisk egg substitute, cheddar cheese, Parmesan cheese, salt, black pepper, garlic powder, and red pepper flakes together in a bowl.
Heat olive oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir mushrooms and onion until tender, 4-5 minutes.
Add spinach, cook until spinach wilts, 3-4 minutes.
Pour in egg mixture. Swirl pan around to evenly distribute egg mixture. Cook until egg is fully cooked and set in the middle, 5-10 minutes. Cut into wedges.

name: Mushroom Spinach Omelette
directions: Beat  the eggs and egg whites in a bowl. Season as desired.
Sauté mushrooms in a non-stick skillet over medium heat for a minute before adding spinach.
Pour the egg mixture and cook until firm.

name: Mushroom & Spinach Stir Fry
directions: Heat the vegetable oil in the pan, then add the onions and then the minced garlic. Let the onions and garlic caramelize a bit but be careful and do not burn the garlic.
Add the mushrooms and carrots, then season with seasoning blend and soy sauce. Stir fry.
Add the baby spinach last, then stir it.
Can be served with rice or eaten as is.
Note: you can add more soy sauce depending on your taste preference.

name: 'My'Hop Whole Wheat Pancakes
directions: Preheat lightly oiled/well-sprayed griddle or large skillet to medium-low heat, 275 °F (135 °C). Also preheat oven to 200 °F (95 °C) if you will be holding them for a while.
Whisk all dry ingredients in a very large bowl. Make a well in the center of the ingredients.

Whisk wet ingredients in a smaller bowl. Pour into the well of the larger bowl. Whisk until fairly smooth. (Add up to another 1/4 cup of milk or water to make batter medium thickness and pourable). Let it sit for a few minutes.
Pour scant 1/2 cup batter onto center of skillet.
Cook pancake until small bubbles (or holes) seem to sit on the center of the cake without much bursting. Also, the edges of the cake should look somewhat dry. Now, you're ready to flip.
The second side of the cake will cook in nearly half the time of the first so keep your eyes on the pan. You'll see steam from the skillet and you'll know the pancake is cooked through.
Hold cooked pancakes in a warm oven or serve immediately.

Note: Try adding to the batter chopped nuts or fresh fruit. They are great plain but also try with pure maple syrup, agave nectar, warm fruit compote or preserves and even fresh fruit with fresh whipped cream.

name: Nacho Cheese Crackers
directions: Line plate with parchment paper.
Make 3-4 rounded 2" circles of cheese spaced apart on plate. Sprinkle with garlic and salt.
Microwave for 1-1 1/2 minutes. Should turn a light to medium brown color on the edges.
Allow to cool for a minute and then remove and set on paper towel covered plate.
Repeat steps until all cheese is used.

name: Nepali Rice Pudding
ingredients: 4 tbsps organic unrefined virgin coconut oil
directions: Bring water and rice to boil in a large pot. Simmer while stirring occasionally until it begins to thicken. This should take about 20 minutes.
Add sugar, spices, and oil. Note: You may need to add an extra cup of water at this stage if the pudding is too thick.
Continue to cook slowly while stirring as needed. When consistency is gelatinous, add coconut milk. Cook for a few more minutes to thicken.
Transfer to a bowl then serve.

name: No Bake Cookies
directions: Combine sugar, cocoa powder, butter, and whole milk. Bring to a boil.
Transfer to a bowl then add remaining ingredients. Mix well to avoid lumps.
Scoop mixture and form into cookies.

name: No Bake Energy Balls
ingredients: 1/2 cup organic peanut butter no salt added
directions: Mix dry ingredients.
Add wet ingredients.
Form small bite size balls. Refrigerate before serving.

name: No Bake Protein Cookies
directions: Warm peanut butter and stir in other ingredients.
Dollop out and cool.

name: No Bean Turkey Chili
ingredients: 15 oz canned whole peeled plum tomatoes
directions: Dice onions and bell peppers. Sauté in avocado oil until softened with crushed garlic.
Add ground turkey and cook until turkey is browned.
Purée whole plum tomatoes with tomato paste in a blender.
Add tomato mix to turkey mix, adding a little water until consistency is right.
Season to taste with salt, pepper, cumin and chili powder.

name: Normandy Primavera
directions: Set 6-8 cups of water on to boil. No salt.
Saute chopped onion and minced garlic in olive oil until golden brown. It's fine to caramelize them as well (about 20-30 minutes, stir frequently).
While onion is caramelizing, add vegetable stock and milk into a small saucepan over low heat. Add pepper and/or chicken seasoning to taste.

Once water is boiling, add pasta. Then add flour to caramelized onions and cook about a minute, stirring constantly. Add milk/stock mixture to onions, deglazing the pan and stirring until mixture smooths out.
Halfway through pasta cook time add Normandy vegetable blend to hot water. Continue to cook until pasta is al dente and drain in a colander.
Once sauce has thickened up, add Parmesan cheese and blend in. Check for seasoning.
Add vegetables/pasta to a bowl and toss in sauce. Serve.

name: Oat Banana Cookies
directions: Preheat the oven to 390 °F (200 °C).
Mix all ingredients with blender.
Shape cookies with spoon.
Bake for 15 minutes.

name: Oat Cookies
directions: Mix the dry ingredients in a food processor. Reserve the seeds and 20g oats for later use.
Add the wet ingredients.
Scoop the mixture to form balls. Coat each ball with the reserved seeds and oats. Place in parchment-lined baking sheet.
Bake at 300°F for for 25-30 minutes.

name: Oat Fiber Pancake
directions: Mix together the oat fiber, water, heavy whipping cream, melted coconut oil, baking powder, sweetener, vanilla extract. Let sit at least 10 minutes, but not more than 30 minutes.
Add egg to the mix and whisk to blend well.

In a small non-stick pan, make the pancakes. Do NOT try to flip them over, the oat fiber is very crumbly, it will hold together fine but not for flipping. Instead, cover the frying pan with a fit lid for about a minute with the burner set to 5, then uncover and turn the burner down to 4 and cook for about another minute. Drop the pancake in a plate by turning the pan upside down above the plate with a brisk move.

Can be served with melted butter or coconut oil sprinkled over, or with low carb pancake syrup, sprinkle sweetener on top, or sugar-free preserve. Can also be used as a layer for a low-carb cake with butter frosting.

name: Oatmeal Almond Muffin
directions: Mix the oatmeal, honey, oil and dried cranberries, cover and let sit for at least 6 hours, up to a couple of days.
Add in the eggs, salt, and 2 teaspoons of flavoring (1 vanilla, 1 almond or lemon or coconut) and blend.
Drop into greased muffin tins (about 2/3 full) and bake for 15 minutes in a 325-350 °F (160-175 °C) oven.
Note: try adding almonds, chocolate chips or coconut.

name: Oatmeal Banana Cookies
directions: Pre-heat oven at 180°C. Mash bananas in a bowl.
Add oatmeal.
Sprinkle cinnamon and honey then mix.
Bake for 10-15 minutes until golden and crispy on top.

name: Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 1 tbsp semi-sweet mini chocolate chip morsels
1 1/2 cups protein-packed flapjack and waffle mix
directions: Mix wet ingredients in a bowl.
Gradually add dry ingredients and stir well.
Form balls and place on a baking sheet. Press to flatten slightly.
Bake in preheated oven at 350°F for 10 minutes.

name: Oatmeal Cookies
ingredients: 15 g organic raw walnut halves and pieces
2 cups uncooked rolled oats - gluten free
directions: Pre-heat oven at 350°F. In a bowl, mash bananas then add apple sauce and honey.
Gradually add remaining ingredients. Mix to incorporate.
Scoop mixture onto lined baking sheet and cook for 20 - 30 minutes. Let cool then serve or store in an airtight container.

name: Oatmeal Cookies
directions: Cream the butter with granulated sugar, brown sugar, salt, and eggs.
Gradually add the white flour until well mixed, followed by oats and baking soda.
Stir in the chocolate chips and dried cranberries.
Form balls of the same size. Place on a baking sheet and press to flatten slightly.
Bake in an oven preheated to 350°F for 13-15 minutes.

name: Oatmeal Crêpes
directions: Grind oatmeal using food processor or blender.
Mix oats, cream cheese, and egg whites together.
Heat a non-stick pan to low medium. Take a ladle of the batter and pour it onto the pan
Cook the crêpes for 1-2 minutes on both sides until the edges are done and the middle is no longer liquid.
Transfer top a plate and top with fruits.

name: Oatmeal Pancakes
directions: Process everything in a blender until smooth.
Ladle the mixture into thin circles in a non-stick skillet.
Cook until both sides are golden brown.

name: Oatmeal Pancakes
ingredients: 1/2 cup uncooked rolled oats - gluten free
directions: Mix all ingredients together in a blender.
Ladle 1/4 cup of mixture and cook in non-stick pan. Repeat until batter is used up.
Transfer to a plate then serve.

name: Oatmeal Protein Banana Pancakes
directions: Mix ingredients in blender.
Cook them as a regular pancake.
Serve with berries or sugar free marmalade.

name: Okra Curry
directions: Heat olive oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and channa dal. Sauté for 10 minutes then add chopped onions, chilies, salt, turmeric powder. Cook until the oil becomes light reddish brown.
Add chopped okra and cook without lid for 20 minutes on medium heat.
Add paprika and ground cumin. Simmer with lid for 15 minutes.
Transfer to a plate and serve with rice.

name: Omelet Cups
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C) and line muffin pan with paper liners.
Whisk eggs together in a large bowl.
Add all other ingredients to the eggs and stir.
Fill a muffin pan about 3/4 way full and bake for 25 minutes or until egg is set.

name: Omelette Bites
directions: Pre-heat oven at 375°F.
Chop vegetables.
Beat eggs and milk in a bowl. Add vegetables and cheese.
Pour about 2/3 full into lined or sprayed cupcake tins.
Cook in the oven for 15 minutes or until eggs are set.
Can be frozen for future meals if desired.

name: One Pan Enchilada Pasta
directions: In a large skillet, cook ground beef, onion, and garlic over medium-low until browned. Add the taco mix and follow directions on the package.
Add the dry pasta, chicken broth, water, and enchilada sauce to pan. Bring to boil, then reduce heat to low and cover. Cook on low, with pan covered for about 15 minutes.
Remove lid and let simmer for additional 5 minutes until pasta is tender and sauce has reduced. Remove from heat. Stir in cheese until melted. Serve.

name: Onion Salad with Kielbasa
ingredients: 3 g no stick canola oil cooking spray
directions: Spray pan with canola oil and sauté onion rings.
After onions are slightly brown, add diced kielbasa. Cook for 2 minutes.
Chop the lettuce and carrots.
Mix everything in a bowl.

name: Orange Scones
directions: Mix together sugar and zest of two naval oranges. Also add flour, baking soda and baking powder. Add butter and mix it in so that the mix is crumbled.
In a separate bowl mix egg and sour cream.
Incorporate together two mixes. Make a dough.
Put a dough on baking sheet with paper. Make it 7’’ round. Cut into 8 parts and put them in two lines on the baking sheet.
Cook for 16-17 minutes 400F.
For glaze mix together powdered sugar, orange juice, 1 tsp of orange extract and zest of one more naval orange.

name: Orecchiette with Broccoli and White Beans
ingredients: 16 oz cooked broccoli (fat not added in cooking)
directions: Cook pasta according to packaging. In a separate pan, blanch broccoli for 2-3 minutes.
Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add minced shallot and cook until softened. Stir in garlic, oregano, and pepper flakes until fragrant.
Add beans and cook until tender. Pour some pasta water and bring to boil.
Adjust heat to low then add broccoli, pasta and parmesan. Stir to incorporate. Turn off heat. Transfer to a plate then serve.

name: Oven Roasted Vegetables
directions: Heat oven to 450 °F (220 °C).
Cut vegetables into bite sized pieces.
Place vegetables in large roasting pan.  Toss with oil, salt, pepper to coat.  Spread in single layer.
Roast for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned and tender.

name: Overnight Chia Oatmeal
ingredients: 1/2 cup Greek style nonfat vanilla yogurt
directions: Mix all ingredients together in a bowl.
Refrigerate until morning.
Heat it up or eat it cold.
Note: you may choose to add the walnuts in the morning for an added crunch.

name: Overnight Nutty Oats
directions: Add dry ingredients to mason jar or other container.
Add fruit, honey, and almond butter.
Add milk and stir or shake to mix thoroughly.

name: Overnight Oatmeal
directions: In a small bowl, add old fashioned oatmeal, plain Greek yogurt, fat free milk, maple syrup and strawberries.
Stir until completely blended.
Cover and place in the refrigerator overnight.

Note: try using your favorite fruit. Honey can be used instead of maple syrup. You can place all the ingredients into a small mason jar, cover and shake; store in the refrigerator overnight. You can mix up a week's worth breakfast to enjoy.

name: Overnight Oats with Berries
directions: Stack the following items: oats, strawberries, blueberries and yogurt.
When done pour the milk on top.

name: Paella with Lentils
directions: In big pot, sauté onions and celery. Season to taste.
Add rice, cooked lentils and peas.
In pan, sauté shrimp and 1/2 a lemon with sazon spice.
Combine ingredients and other 1/2 of lemon.

name: Paleo Crockpot Chili
directions: Brown beef in skillet with oil.
Put beef in crock pot and stir in vegetables and spices.
Cook on high for 6 hours.
Top with desired garnishes such as sour cream, Greek yogurt, avocado, cilantro, red onion etc...

name: Pancakes
ingredients: 250 g gluten free buttermilk pancake mix
directions: Combine the pancake mix, egg, and milk.
Heat the oil in a pan and pour mixture in circles.
Cook until both sides are firm and set.

name: Pancakes with Blueberries
ingredients: 6 tbsps organic creamer coconut milk french vanilla
directions: Beat the egg whites until it forms a peak.
In another bowl, mash the bananas. Mix with egg yolks, flour and the organic coconut creamer.
Fold in the banana and flour mixture into the beaten egg whites.
Add blueberries and cook the pancakes on a non-stick skillet over low heat.

name: Papaya Shake
directions: Blend all ingredients.
Enjoy.

name: Parmesan Crusted Zucchini
directions: Slice zucchini lengthwise in to 1/2" slices.  Leave skin on the zucchini (you can also use summer squash).
Coat shallow cookie sheet with olive oil (or use cooking spay).
Lay the zucchini slices next to each other on the cookie sheet. Be sure not to overlap the slices.
Sprinkle the zucchini with salt and pepper to taste (or sprinkle a little basil for extra flavor).
Place in broiler about 4" from the element and watching closely allow the zucchini to turn a nice brown. Takes about 6 minutes (don't be afraid to brown zucchini pretty good, just not black!).
Pull out zucchini and sprinkle generously with parmesan cheese on top.
Place back in broiler for 1 to 2 mintes, just enough to brown the parmesan cheese and make it crusty, but do not burn.
Scoop out on to plate and serve.

name: Pasta Salad
directions: Cook pasta according to packaging directions.
Chop vegetables and cheese.
Toss everything in a bowl and drizzle with dressing.

name: Pasta Salad
ingredients: 1/2 cup italian dressing (made with vinegar and oil)
directions: Cook elbow macaroni according to packaging directions. Make sure to let it cool under cold water.
Prepare vegetables and transfer to a bowl.
Mix macaroni, vegetables, and dressing. Serve.

name: Pasta with Ricotta, Broccoli and Tomatoes
ingredients: 1 cup chopped or sliced grape tomatoes
directions: Prepare whole-wheat pasta noodles per package directions.
While cooking, steam the broccoli and slice the grape tomatoes into halves and set both aside.
After draining the pasta, immediately stir in the ricotta so it melts over the pasta. Stir in the broccoli and tomatoes.
Add salt and pepper to taste and red pepper flakes for zip!
Note: despite the simple ingredients list, these nutrient-packed foods provide whole grains, fiber and calcium.

name: PB Fat Bomb
directions: Mix the peanut butter, softened cream cheese and ghee in a bowl.
Add the cinnamon and Stevia.
Then fold in the pumpkin seeds.
Cover the bowl and put it in the freezer for 10 minutes so it can set.
Remove from freezer and form into spheres a little bigger than a quarter, alternatively you can use a small melon baller.
After they are finished, they need to go back into the freezer for about 20-30 minutes before serving.
Note: it's a good idea to store them in the freezer, too. They'll keep longer that way.

name: PB&J Overnight Oats
directions: Combine ingredients.
Put in fridge overnight.
Eat.

name: Pea-Cakes
directions: Set aside 1/3 cup of peas. In a blender, combine remaining peas with water, egg and 1 tablespoon sriracha sauce. Puree until smooth.
Pour into a medium bowl and add flour, salt, garlic powder and baking powder. Gradually whisk together.
Stir in reserved peas. Let batter stand for 10 minutes.
Warm oil over medium heat. Pour pea mixture into pan, about 3 to 4 tablespoons per cake. Flip cakes when bubbles start to form along the edges.
To make the dip combine plain Greek yogurt and 2 tablespoons of sriracha sauce. Chill for at least 30 minutes.
Serve warm with Sriracha-Yogurt Dip.

name: Peaches & Oats
directions: Chop peach into bite sized pieces.
Boil milk (or water if you prefer) and salt.
When milk is boiling, add oats, peaches, honey and cinnamon.
Let stand for 5 minutes or until oats are softened.

name: Peanut Butter Almond Muffins
directions: Ground almonds and granola.
Chop fat bombs.
Mix all ingredients together.
Spoon into muffin pan and put into preheated oven, 350 °F (175 °C) for 30 minutes or until brown. Depends on size of muffins.

name: Peanut Butter Balls
directions: Mix ingredients. Roll into tablespoon size balls.
Refrigerate for an hour, then store in airtight container.

name: Peanut Butter Chocolate Chia Pudding
directions: In a medium bowl, combine all the ingredients. Whisk until combined.
Refrigerate at least 2-3 hours or preferably overnight. Stir a few times during the first 30 minutes to avoid clumps.
Top with mini chocolate chips or shaved chocolate or fresh fruits, if desired. Serve.

name: Peanut Butter Cookies
directions: Pre-heat oven at 325°F.
Cream butter and peanut butter. Add sugar, egg, and vanilla.
Add baking and pancake mix by sifting. Stir to incorporate.
Scoop a tablespoon batter and place in lined baking sheet. Repeat until the batter is used up. Flatten with a fork.
Bake for 15 minutes or until edges are light brown. Cool completely before removing from pan with a spatula.

name: Peanut Butter Cookies
directions: Mix all 3 ingredients together and roll into 20 balls.
Preheat oven to 350° F (175° C).  Bake for 9 to 10 minutes - bake to the size of half dollars.
Divide the number of cookies by the carbs in the peanut butter to get a count per cookie.
Note: you can use creamy or chunky peanut butter.

name: Peanut Butter Cookies
directions: Cream together butter, peanut butter, sugars and egg. Sift together flour and baking soda, mix into creamed mixture.
Roll into small balls and press with fork. Bake 10 minutes at 350 °F (175 °C).
Makes approximately 40 3” diameter cookies.

name: Peanut Butter Cookies
ingredients: 5 tbsps semi-sweet mini chocolate chip morsels
directions: Mash the bananas and mix with other ingredients.
Scoop the batter and form cookies. Place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake in preheated oven at 350°F for 15 minutes.

name: Peanut Butter Dip
directions: Mix all ingredients and then stir in chocolate chips.
Put on top of celery, phyllo, or any low car snack.
Keep chilled.

name: Pecan Turtles
directions: Preheat the oven to 200°C.
Lay pretzels on parchment-lined cookie sheet. Top with one candy per pretzel. Bake for 5 minutes.
Remove from the oven and top with one pecan per pretzel.

name: Pepperoni Pizza
directions: Heat oven and pizza stone (optional) to 400 °F (205 °C). Allow pizza dough to come to room temperature. Dust with flour and roll out into 12" circle on a pizza peel.

Use spoon to spread 1/2 cup marinara sauce over dough, leaving 1" perimeter for crust. Spread mozzarella over sauce. Layer pepperoni over cheese. Slice roma tomatoes into circles and layer over pepperoni.

Place pizza into oven using the pizza peel onto the pizza stone or pizza pan. Bake for 10-12 minutes until cheese and crust is golden brown. Allow to cool for 2 minutes then slice into 8 equal pieces.

name: Pesto Chicken Balls
directions: Mix all ingredients.
Cook on a skillet till browned.
Enjoy.

name: Pinto Bean & Ground Beef Soup
ingredients: 16 oz reduced sodium pinto beans, rinsed, drained
directions: Heat large heavy frying pan to medium-high, add ground beef saute until beef is well-browned, breaking apart with back of the spoon as it cooks. When it's well browned, remove beef to a bowl.

Heat olive oil in frying pan, then add onion and saute about 5 minutes, or until onion is starting to brown. Add minced garlic and saute 2 minutes more, then add oregano, cumin and saute about 2 minutes more. Remove from pan.

Add chicken stock to frying pan and simmer a minute, scraping off any browned bits. Combine browned meat, onion mixture, chicken stock from the pan, water, beans, tomato paste, and canned tomatoes in heavy soup pot.
Simmer over low heat about 45 minutes, adding a bit more water if needed. When stew seems done, add chopped cilantro, and lime juice and cook a few more minutes. Serve hot.

name: Pizza Frittata
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C).
Remove sausage from casing and brown in an 8-inch cast iron skillet along with the onion and pepperoni.
While meat and onions are browning, beat the eggs with the heavy cream. Pour on top of the meat in the skillet and let cook for 2 minutes.
While frittata is on the stove top, slice tomato and place on top in a circle or whatever pattern you want.
After the 2 minutes is up, place entire skillet in oven for 12 to 15 minutes (caution, it'll be very hot)
Top with cilantro or Parmesan cheese.

name: Pizza
directions: Spread ketchup on tortilla.
Add sliced tomatoes, mozzarella, and oregano.
Cook in air fryer at 350°F for 5 minutes.

name: Pizza Pasta
directions: Dice the mushrooms, peppers, and onions and set aside.
Bring water in a medium pan to boil and once boiling add your rigatoni.
In a saucepan on medium low heat pour traditional sauce along with peppers, onions and mushrooms and cover.
In a frying pan cook and chop your ground turkey until fully cooked, once cooked drain and add it to your sauce.
Once rigatoni is done strain the pasta for serving.
Place 1 cup of rigatoni on plate and cover with 1 cup of your completed meat sauce. Add 3 slices of turkey pepperoni and top with your shredded mozzarella.
Enjoy.

name: Pork Broccoli and Bean Stew
directions: Cook pork in pot until tender.
Halfway through cooking the pork, add water, baked beans, pinto beans, and chick peas into a large pan.  Cook on low.
When pork is done, cut into small pieces and add to the pan.  Add the remaining ingredients and set to medium-high.
Cook for 30 minutes.
Serve.

name: Pork Carnitas
ingredients: 1 lb pork tenderloin, cut into 1/2" cubes
directions: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat.  Add pork and garlic, cook 6-8 minutes, turning pork occasionally, until no longer pink in center. Drain, if necessary.
Stir in all remaining ingredients. Cook until mixture thickens and coats pork.

name: Pork Souvlaki
directions: Soak 8 bamboo skewers in warm water for at least 30 minutes. While the skewers are soaking, cut pork tenderloin into 1" cubes.
In large bowl, whisk together lemon juice, oil, garlic, oregano and pepper. Add pork and stir to coat.

Marinate for 10 minutes (can be made ahead of time and marinate up to 24 hours in the refrigerator). While the pork is marinating, preheat the broiler. Coat a baking sheet with cooking spray or line with foil. Set aside.
Thread pork onto 8 skewers and lay on the baking sheet so they are not touching. Brush the skewers with remaining marinade, using all the marinade.
Place the skewers in the broiler 6 inches away from heat for 6 minutes. Turn the skewers and cook an additional 6 minutes.

name: Potatoes & Green Beans
ingredients: 1 cup diced tomatoes with basil, garlic & oregano
directions: Par boil potatoes and green beans. Drain well.
Saute in olive oil with garlic.
Add diced tomatoes, salt, pepper and red pepper flakes.
Simmer for 30-60 minutes.

name: Power Bites
directions: Mix all ingredients until incorporated.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to settle.
Scoop mixture and form balls.

name: Power Blueberry Muffins
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C) and grease or line a muffin pan.
In a large mixing bowl, add all dry ingredients and blend well with a hand whisk.
In a small bowl, add all wet ingredients and stir together.
Pour the wet ingredients into the bowl with the dry ingredients and gently whisk together until blended. Stir in blueberries.
Scoop the batter into the muffin cups, filling them 3/4 full. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan 5 minutes, then remove to wire rack to cool completely.
Note: may be stored in freezer.

name: Protein Bagels
directions: Pre-heat oven at 350°F.
In a large bowl, whisk together baked goods mix and egg whites.
Sprinkle bagel seasoning in greased pan, then pour batter on top.
Cook for 20 minutes or until golden brown.

name: Protein Balls
ingredients: 2 rounded scoops gold standard 100% whey - double rich chocolate
directions: Grind oats to powder using food processor.
Combine all ingredients until incorporated.
Scoop mixture to form balls. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.

name: Protein Brownie
ingredients: 100 g organic pure dark 70% dark chocolate
directions: Grind oats using a food processor.
Melt the chocolate with butter in the microwave.
Crush the walnuts.
Mix everything together. Stir well to avoid lumps. Transfer to a greased or parchment-lined dish.
Bake in pre-heated oven at 350°F for 50 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Let cool before slicing into squares.

name: Protein Cookies
directions: Mix all ingredients together.
Bake at 350 °F (175 °C) for 20 minutes.
Let cool, then enjoy.

name: Protein Muffins
ingredients: 2 scoops super advanced whey protein - vanilla
directions: Pre-heat oven at 400°F.
Mix wet ingredients.
Stir in dry ingredients.
Pour in prepared muffin pans.
Bake for 15 minutes or until inside is no longer wet. Let it cool before serving or refrigerating.

name: Protein-Pack Oatmeal Cups
ingredients: 1 cup almond breeze unsweetened vanilla milk
2 oz organic protein plant based protein powder sweet vanilla bean
1 tsp baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
directions: Preheat oven to 350° F (180° C).
Chop apple into small pieces.
Mix the wet ingredients together.
Mix the dry ingredients together, then combine both with apple.
Grease cupcake pan with coconut oil, then fill each with the batter.
Bake for 15-18 minutes.
Let cool 20 minutes before eating.

name: Protein Pancakes
ingredients: 1 tsp psyllium fiber powder unsweetened unflavored
1 tsp baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
directions: Mix dry ingredients in a small bowl.
Add egg whites and 1/4 cup warm water. Mix everything until smooth.
Put a lightly greased pan over low heat and pour the mixture into circles. Cover and cook until firm.
Serve on a plate with desired fruit topping.

name: Protein Shake
directions: Chop banana and freeze for at least an hour.
Place fruits, almond milk, and protein powder in blender to combine. Note: Set aside 2 tbsps mixed berries for later use.
Transfer to a glass and top with remaining berries.

name: Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Muffin
directions: Mix all ingredients in a bowl, folding in the chocolate chips last.
Scoop into greased muffin tin.
Bake in an oven preheated to 400°F for 15-20 minutes.
Let cool before removing from muffin tin.

name: Pumpkin Muffins
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C). Line muffin pan with liners.
Combine dry ingredients in large bowl.
Combine wet ingredients in small bowl.
Fold wet ingredients into dry ingredients, taking caution to not over mix.
Scoop by spoonful's into lined muffin tins, distributing evenly.
Bake for 20-25 minutes until toothpick comes out clean. Let cool and enjoy.

name: Pumpkin Pancakes
directions: Preheat griddle/pan on medium-high with 1 tablespoon of coconut oil.
Process oats in blender or food processor until it turns into oat flour.
Mix all ingredients in a bowl until smooth (except for coconut oil).
Use a 1/3 cup measuring cup and pour 4 pancakes onto griddle/pan. Let entire top of pancake bubble up, flip and let cook another 30 seconds.
Note: cook 4 pancakes in a pan at a time, adding a tablespoon of coconut oil for each new set of pancakes. Coconut oil does not go in the mixture.

name: Pumpkin Pie Chia Pudding
directions: Mix all ingredients together.
Refrigerate overnight, stirring a few times during the first 30 minutes to avoid clumps.
Serve.

name: Pumpkin Pie
directions: Preheat oven to 425° F (220° C).
Mix sweeteners, salt and spices in a small bowl. Beat eggs in a large bowl.
Add pumpkin and spice mixture to eggs, mix well.
Stir in heavy cream and sour cream.
Pour into 2 glass pie plates. Bake at 425 ° F for 15 minutes, reduce oven to 375 ° F (190° C) and bake another 40-50 minutes until knife inserted near center comes out clean.
Serve with whipped heavy cream.

name: Pumpkin Pie Oatmeal
directions: Microwave oatmeal in large cereal bowl with 1/2 cup of water for 30 seconds.
Mix in all other ingredients.
Enjoy.

name: Quiche with Quinoa/Rice Crust
directions: Crust: preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C). By hand mix quinoa and rice blend with 1 egg white in a medium sized bowl. Press into 9" pie pan sprayed with cooking spray. Bake 10 minutes or until firm.

Quiche: preheat oven to 400 °F (205 °C). Place broccoli in center of pre-baked pie crust. Place eggs, milk, cheese, parsley, basil, salt and onion powder into blender. Begin at low speed and increase to high and blend until smooth. Pour liquid mixture over broccoli. Add shrimp. Bake 40-45 minutes or until top is brown.
Note: instead of shrimp try turkey bacon, crab meat, fresh spinach, chopped tomatoes or peppers, etc.

name: Quick Quiche
directions: Cook and crumble bacon. In a 9” greased pie tin layer the bacon and cheese.
Whisk together milk and flour. Whisk in the eggs and then the remaining ingredients. Pour over bacon and cheese.
Bake at 350 °F (175 °C) for 35-40 minutes until set.

name: Quinoa & Black Beans
directions: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir onion and garlic until lightly browned, about 10 minutes.

Mix quinoa into onion mixture and cover with water. Season with cumin, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. Bring the mixture to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer until quinoa is tender and broth is absorbed, about 20 minutes.
Stir corn and black beans into the saucepan, and continue to simmer until heated through, about 5 minutes.

name: Quinoa Cauliflower Buffalo Bites
ingredients: 1/4 cup red hot buffalo wing sauce
directions: Spray pan with cooking spray and cook chicken. Add some black pepper and salt to taste.
Add cauliflower and cook until it softens.
Add already cooked quinoa, until mixture fits your preferences.
Transfer mixture to a large mixing bowl. Break egg in separate bowl or cup and mix with fork until yolk is broken up.
Add egg, cheese, buffalo sauce and some breadcrumbs and mix. Add more breadcrumbs as needed until consistency is not runny, and you are able to scoop.
Spray muffin tin with cooking spray and scoop mixture into cups. Cups should be about half filled.
Bake for 20 minutes until quinoa is crispy on bottom, but not burnt. Let cool a couple of minutes before serving.
Tastes great with non-fat Greek yogurt sauce mixed with dill and honey.

name: Quinoa Chili Verde
directions: Using the 1 cup of water and the 1/2 cup of quinoa, cook according to package directions. Set aside.

Preheat oven to broil. On a foil lined baking sheet, place poblano, tomatillos (halved and skin side up), 3 cloves of garlic (skin on). Broil for about 7-8 minutes, turning poblano as you go. Pepper should be blistered and tomatoes and garlic should be blackened. Remove skins from garlic and pepper. Remove stem and seeds from pepper as well. Place all ingredients in food processor. Add a pinch of salt and process until smooth.
Meanwhile, in a large saucepan or dutch oven, brown ground pork until no longer pink. Remove pork with slotted spoon, set aside. Mince the remaining garlic.
Add onion and garlic to pan, saute for about 5 minutes or until onions begin to soften. Add pork back to pan along with oregano.
Pour in the pepper, tomatillo mixture as well as the chicken broth and corn. Bring to boil. Simmer 30 minutes. Stir in cooked quinoa. Serve.

name: Quinoa Pilaf
directions: Sauté veggies in olive oil until cooked.
Stir in spices and quinoa.
Stir in boiling broth and water.
Cover and cook for 20 minutes.

name: Quinoa Pudding
directions: Soak quinoa in 1 1/2 cups water for 30 minutes. Drain and repeat.
Add 1 1/2 cups water and microwave on high 5 minutes.
Stir and add cranberries. Microwave another 5 minutes.
In saucepan heat fat free half and half, vanilla, cinnamon and sweetener (like Splenda).
Whisk eggs in another bowl. Add about half hot milk mix a little at a time to eggs.
Add rest of egg mix to milk mix and cook until thickened.
Add grain to milk mixture. Stir well.
Spoon into 8 serving cups and refrigerate for 2 hours or overnight.

name: Quinoa Salad
ingredients: 15 oz canned black beans (no salt added)
directions: Cook quinoa as directed on packaging. Let it cool.
Wash and dice all vegetables.
Open and rinse canned beans.
Mix quinoa, onions, beans, peppers, celery, and cilantro.
Slice and squeeze limes to get juice.
Make dressing by combining olive oil, red wine vinegar, lime juice, salt, sugar and spices. Pour over quinoa mixture then serve.

name: Quinoa Salad
directions: Cook quinoa. Soak and rinse off quinoa, transfer drained quinoa to the cooking pot, add 1 1/2 cups water and 1/4 tsp salt if desired. Bring to a boil, cover with a tight fitting lid, and turn the heat down to simmer. Cook quinoa for 12 minutes. Remove quinoa from heat and allow to sit 5 minutes with the lid on.
Chop veggies while quinoa is cooking. Add veggies to cooled down quinoa.
Drizzle olive oil and vinegar to taste over salad.
Serve chilled for best results.
Note: add feta if desired. Add veggies as much or as little as you prefer e.g. you may add red or green onions.

name: Quinoa Salad with Black Beans
ingredients: 1 1/4 cups bell peppers, chopped (red, orange &/or yellow)
directions: Combine bell peppers, scallions and cilantro in a mixing bowl.
Add the red wine vinegar, olive oil, garlic, salt and pepper and stir (add more salt and or pepper to taste).
Add the quinoa and stir until everything is well incorporated.
Fold in the black beans.
Serve immediately or let sit for a bit for the flavors to meld.
Note: can serve on a lettuce leaf chilled or at room temperature.

name: Quinoa Stuffed Bell Peppers
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C). Line a 9"x13" baking dish with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, combine quinoa, green chilies, corn, beans, tomatoes, cheeses, cilantro, cumin, garlic, onion, chili powder and salt and pepper to taste.

Remove the tops, stems and seeds from the peppers. Spoon the filling into each bell pepper cavity. Place in baking dish, cavity side up and bake until the peppers are tender and the filling is heated through, about 25-30 minutes.

Notes: monterey jack cheese can be used instead of pepper jack. You can use petite diced tomatoes instead of fresh if desired. You can use more or less chili powder to suit your taste. You can use the extra filling for tacos or burritos with a protein or by itself. You can use it as a "dip" with tortilla chips.

name: Quinoa Veggie Burgers
directions: Place chick peas, egg whites, seasonings, flour, and soy sauce in processor and pulse until blended.
Add veggies and pulse, stir, pulse, stir, etc until veggies are chopped pretty finely, but still visible.
Put mix into large bowl and add in quinoa and bread crumbs and use a spatula to blend well.
Spray non stick skillet with olive oil spray. Using 1/3 cup measuring cup form into patties directly in the pan.

Fry at a low temperature slowly (this will ensure more firm patties) turning after top of patties start to look dryer. Then carefully flip to keep patties together. Cook a few minutes on each side and continue to flip until browned on each side.

name: Raisin & Sunflower Seed Granola Bars
directions: Toast oats in oven for about 10 minutes until light brown.
Add oats to a bowl with toffee bits, sunflower seeds, raisins, cranberries, and chia seeds.
Melt butter in pot with sugar and honey, stir well until sugar is fully dissolved, add vanilla and almond extract and stir well.
Pour wet mixture into dry mixture and mix together very well.
Press mixture into parchment paper lined pan or silicone pan. Press down very well and put in refrigerator for 2 hours, remove and cut in desired shape.

name: Ratatouille
directions: Chop all the vegetables into bite size pieces.
Brown the chopped vegetables in the olive oil over high heat.
Layer the vegetables in your slow cooker.
In a bowl mix the rest of the ingredients, then pour over the vegetables.
Cook on low for 5-6 hours or on high for 3-4 hours.
Note: freeze in meal size containers.

name: Rice & Black Bean Salad with Mango
directions: Cook and cool brown rice per package directions. Drain and rinse black beans.
Dice onion, mango and jalapeño. Slice cherry tomatoes. Chop cilantro.
Mix together and dress with vinegar. Salt and pepper to taste.
Chill and serve as a delicious side dish, or a vegetarian main dish.

name: Ricotta Green Open Omelet
ingredients: 4 slices cooked reduced sodium bacon, crumbled
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (190 °C).
Slice potatoes into rounds about 1/4" thick and place in large bowl. Steam in microwave (covered) for 3-5 minutes. Check if slightly under fork-tender. Remove and let cool.

In blender or another bowl, Add eggs, green onion, 1/2 the parmesan cheese, romano cheese, evaporated milk and black pepper. Combine well. Add ricotta to mixture and break up with spoon leaving large chunks.

Spray large skillet (at least 12" diameter) with nonstick spray. Arrange softened potato rounds to cover bottom and sides of skillet. Sprinkle with dash salt and black pepper. Arrange cooked bacon crumbles and kale over potatoes (kale has been wilted the day before with sliced garlic and french cut onions). Pour egg mixture over skillet and move around ricotta for even distribution. Sprinkle with remaining parmesan.
Bake for about 30 minutes until golden brown and puffed.
Serve with fruit for breakfast or with a garden salad for lunch.

Note: this is a use-what-you've-got recipe. More bacon, cooked/diced ham or no meat at all. Got a handful of sliced, cooked mushrooms? Toss them in. Use whatever greens you have on hand, kale, chard, spinach, etc.

name: Roasted Broccoli
directions: Wash and dry broccoli, cut pepper and garlic.
Melt coconut oil.
Place all on roasting pan, pour oil over, salt and pepper to taste, mix and roast 425 °F (220 °C) oven for 25 minutes.

name: Roasted Brussels Sprouts & Sweet Potatoes
directions: Preheat oven to 450° F (230° C).
Trim woody stem off sprouts and split in half. Scrub sweet potatoes and cut into chunks about the size of your brussels sprouts.
Rinse and thoroughly drain vegetables. Add all ingredients to a very large bowl and toss or stir to coat.
Pour vegetable mixture onto 15"x20" baking sheet (foil lined or sprayed with nonstick aerosol). Arrange into a single layer.
Roast vegetables until tender and caramelized, about 30 minutes. Give the vegetables a stir on the baking pan halfway through cooking.
Serve hot or room temperature.
Note: you can sub 'pure' maple syrup for agave.

name: Roasted Butternut Squash
directions: Peel and chop squash into 2" cubes and put in a bowl.
Add all other ingredients and toss.
Spray a cookie sheet with non-stick cooking spray.
Put the tray near the bottom of the oven and roast at 350 °F (175 °C) until tender, about 30 - 60 minutes.

name: Roasted Root Vegetables
directions: Preheat oven to 400 °F (205 °C).
Cut vegetables into 1" cubes.
Spread vegetables out evenly on a cookie sheet in a single layer. Drizzle with olive oil and toss to make sure all veggies are covered.  Sprinkle with sea salt and black pepper.
Roast the vegetables in the hot oven for about 45 minutes, stirring once halfway through cooking, until vegetables are tender and starting to turn golden. Serve hot.

name: Roasted Spaghetti Squash
directions: Preheat oven to 425 °F (220 °C).
Cut squash in half, lengthwise.
Use a spoon to scrape out seeds and fibrous innards. Massage olive oil over the open halves and sprinkle evenly with the salt and pepper.
Roast, cut half up, on a foil-lined baking sheet for 40-50 minutes, just until the vegetable begins to take on a little light brown color.
Remove from oven and let cool until easily handled (about 30 minutes). Use a fork to gently scrape/pull the long strands away from the shell.
Use strands as the base to a cold salad or reheat in microwave, if necessary, and stir lightly with fresh parmesan cheese and basil chiffonade for a light side-dish.
Note: roast squash on the weekend and you've got a go-to for a quick turn-around lunch or dinner.

name: Roasted Turkey with Red Cabbage
ingredients: 1 1/2 lbs turkey breast meat and skin
directions: Cut half of cabbage in regular size and the other half finely. Slice ginger finely.
Cook regularly-cut cabbage with olive oil, ginger, salt, and pepper in a saucepan for 10 minutes.
Line the finely-cut cabbage in a greased roast pan. Put turkey breast on top, skin side up, and season as desired. Roast for 25 minutes in an oven preheated to 425°F.
Scatter the sautéed cabbage around the turkey breast and roast for another 5 minutes.
Sprinkle with sesame oil and green onions then serve.

name: Roasted Veggie Dinner
directions: Preheat oven to 425 °F (220 °C). Place baking rack in the middle of the oven.

Cut potatoes into wedges and put in mixing bowl. Add 3/4 of the olive oil and seasoning blend. Using a spatula mix the contents until the potatoes are coated in oil. Put potatoes onto a baking sheet and place in hot oven.

While the potatoes are roasting, cut broccoli and cauliflower into bite sized pieces and put them into your mixing bowl. Add remaining oil and seasoning and toss until the vegetables are thoroughly coated.
Add to the pan in the oven. Roast the vegetables with the potatoes 5 more minutes.
Leaving the vegetables in the oven, turn the oven on to "high" broil. Broil the vegetables until the potatoes turn golden brown and the veggies begin to caramelize.

name: Roasted Zucchini and Mushrooms
directions: Slice the zucchini and chop the mushrooms.
Mix the soy sauce with avocado oil, garlic powder, and red pepper flakes in a bowl.
Mix everything and place on a baking sheet.
Cook in an oven preheated to 425°F for 15-20 minutes.

name: Roast Pumpkin Salad
directions: Pre-heat oven to 480 °F (250 °C).
Line a biking tray with baking paper. Place pumpkin in a single layer on the tray. Spray with olive oil spray, turn pumpkin spray again.
Roast for 20 minutes or until golden and tender, turning once. Set aside.
Meanwhile heat a small non-stick pan over medium heat. Add pine nuts and cook, stirring for approximately 3 minutes until golden.
Combine balsamic vinegar and olive oil in a screw top jar and shake to combine.
Place spinach and pumpkin in a serving bowl, sprinkle with pine nuts and drizzle with dressing.

name: Rutabaga & Chicken Casserole
directions: Peel the rutabaga and cut it first in half then in slices of about 1/4". Clean and wash the chicken thighs. In a pot, boil together the chicken and rutabaga until the meat starts falling off the bone.

With a straining spoon, take out the chicken and rutabaga from the pot. Let drain some. Separate the meat off the bones, remove skin and cartilages. Break apart the meat in about 1" pieces by hand or use a knife. Separate rutabaga slices in a plate or bowl.

Whip the egg with the heavy cream and about 1/2 cup of the broth in which the chicken and rutabaga have boiled. Mix in half of the shredded cheese and salt to taste. If you like your casserole to be thicker, you can add 1/2 tsp xanthan gum.

In a casserole dish or an oven-proof oven, start layering the the chicken meat and distribute evenly. On top of the chicken meat layer the rutabaga slices. Pour the egg mixture and shake the pot a little to make sure the mixture went all in between meat and rutabagas.

Bake in the oven at 400 °F (205 °C) for about 15 minutes. Take out of the oven, sprinkle the remaining cheese on top distributing evenly, and bacon bits then bake for another 10-15 minutes until the cheese on top is melted and bubbly.

name: Salad in A Jar
ingredients: 1 cup shredded or chopped mixed salad greens
directions: Cook the pasta according to packaging. Chop the vegetables and salami.
Put the dressing in the jar, followed by the other ingredients.
Store in the refrigerator for later consumption.

name: Salad Mix
directions: Wash iceberg and romaine, dry with paper towels. Wash and chop red cabbage,  radishes and scallions.
Place in large covered container.
Store in refrigerator.

name: Salmon Cobb Salad
directions: Boil egg.
Lay lettuce.
Add toppings.

name: Salmon Nicoise Salad
ingredients: 15 g anchovies - flat fillets in olive oil
directions: Place potatoes in a medium saucepan and add cold water to cover by an inch. Bring to a boil, season with salt, and cook for 15−20 minutes or until tender. Transfer potatoes to a plate.
Return water to a boil and cook string beans for 2 minutes or until tender. Transfer to a bowl of ice water and chill for 3 minutes. Transfer to paper towels and pat dry.
Boil eggs for 8 minutes. Transfer eggs to a bowl of ice water and chill for 5 minutes. Peel and set aside.
Heat 2 tbsps. olive oil in a separate saucepan. Add capers and cook until crispy. Transfer capers to paper towels. Allow the remaining oil in the pan to cool and set aside.

Pre-heat oven to 425˚F. Rub salmon all over with reserved caper oil and place on a rimmed baking sheet. Season with salt and pepper. Roast for 10−12 minutes or until medium-rare (fish will be slightly translucent in the center). Let it cool and set aside.
To make the dressing, mash anchovies, mustard, and sugar in a large bowl to form a coarse paste.

Remove peel and white pith from lemon. Working over a bowl, cut between membranes of lemon to release segments. Squeeze remaining juice from membranes into bowl, then discard membranes. Add shallots, then slowly whisk in remaining olive oil.
Halve reserved potatoes and eggs crosswise. Arrange everything on a platter and drizzle with dressing.

name: Salmon Patties
ingredients: 418 g pink salmon wild caught alaskan
directions: Pre-heat oven at 350°F.
Mash salmon in a bowl. Add remaining ingredients and mix.
Form patties with approximately 2 inches diameter. Place in parchment lined tray.
Bake for 30-40 minutes or until golden brown. Let it cool then serve.

name: Salmon Patties
directions: Mix canned salmon with onions, bell peppers and dill.
Add almond flour, lemon juice, egg, and seasonings.
Form equal-sized patties.
Fry on a non-stick pan over medium heat for 4-5 minutes per side.

name: Salmon Patties
directions: Shred the salmon and add mayonnaise.
Add the remaining ingredients except butter and half of bread crumbs. Stir until combined.
Divide into 4 portions, form into balls, and roll in the remaining bread crumbs.
Press slightly and fry in buttered pan, flipping once until brown on both sides.

name: Salmon, Potato, Arugula Salad with Yogurt Dressing
ingredients: 2 tbsps cucumber dill Greek yogurt dressing
directions: Boil a saucepan of water (salt water if that per preference). Add baby potatoes. Boil for 15 minutes (or until a fork can go through each).

Season salmon fillet on both sides (even if there is skin) with salt and pepper to taste. Spray a very thin layer of PAM olive oil into a frying pan (one good spritz). Cook salmon fillet on both sides 4-6 minutes per side.
Remove skin from potatoes after they have had time to cool off. Cut each in half. Flake salmon fillet with a fork to shred.
Place potatoes, arugula, salmon in bowl. Add dill dressing and toss.

name: Salmon Spring Rolls
directions: Mix teriyaki sauce, soy sauce and ginger. Slice salmon into even strips or cubes then marinade in fridge for 30 minutes. Cook in a lightly greased skillet over high heat for 3 minutes per side.
Cook noodles according to package. Wash and slice vegetables.
Dip rice paper in warm water for 10 to 15 seconds, remove and lay each side on paper towels to blot dry.
Layer rice noodles, vegetables, and salmon on top of each rice paper. Fold and roll.
Put on a plate then serve with desired sauce.

name: Sausage and Shrimp Gumbo
ingredients: 15 medium raw peeled and deveined shrimp
2 cups chicken broth, bouillon or consomme
directions: Slice sausage into 1/2 inch slices.
Chop peppers, onion, garlic, and celery.
Combine flour and oil in large saucepan until smooth over medium high heat for 3 minutes. Reduce heat to medium and stir for 6-8 minutes or until roux is a dark reddish brown.
Add vegetables. Cook for 8-10 minutes or until tender. Add cajun seasoning.
Pour chicken broth and bring to a boil. Stir for 1 minute. Reduce heat to low.
Add sausage, salt, and pepper. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes.
Remove cover and bring to a boil. Add shrimp and cook for 3 minutes or until it turns pink.
Ladle gumbo into bowls over rice.

name: Sausage Egg Muffins with Green Chilies
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C). Lightly grease 18 muffin cup liners and place them in the muffin tins.
Place sausage in a skillet, and cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown. Crumble, drain and set aside.
In a large bowl, combine eggs, chilies, onion, garlic, and browned, crumbled sausage. Mix well.
Spoon 1/4 cup of the sausage mixture into each prepared muffin cup.
Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes, or until egg has set and a toothpick inserted into each muffin comes out clean.

name: Sausage Frittata
directions: Slice mushrooms, chop bell pepper and red onion.
In medium skillet combine turkey sausage, onion and bell peppers, cook over medium heat until all pink is gone.  Reduce heat to low.
In mixing bowl combine 6 large eggs and a dash of half and half, briskly whisk until combined. Pour mixture into skillet and add the sliced mushrooms.
Cook on low for 10 minutes or until edges appear firm, transfer to oven and cook for 5 minutes or until apppears done.  Remove from oven.
Grate the parmesan cheese, sprinkle on top and enjoy!
Great for South Beach diet.

name: Sausage Gravy
directions: Cook sausage.
When cooked, add in cream cheese and heavy cream.
Stir until cheese is melted and ingredients are combined.
Serve over biscuits.

name: Sausage Pasta Casserole
directions: Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °C). Spray a 9"x13" baking dish with cooking spray.
In a frying pan brown sausage and drain. Stir spaghetti sauce and water into sausage mixture. Simmer over low heat for 5 minutes.
In a bowl combine cooked pasta, butter, eggs, Parmesan cheese, and half of the mozzarella cheese.
Spread pasta mixture into prepared pan. Evenly spread cottage cheese over pasta.  Spread spaghetti sauce mixture evenly over top.  Sprinkle remaining mozzarella cheese over sauce.
Cover and bake 25 minutes. Uncover and bake 10-15 minutes more.

name: Sautéed Bitter Melon
directions: Slice bitter melon then massage with salt. Set aside for 5-10 minutes. Rinse with cold water then drain.
Chop garlic, shallots, and tomatoes. Slice the chicken in cubes.
Sauté garlic, shallots, and tomatoes in a non-stick pan.
Adjust the heat to high then add chicken. When the chicken is almost cooked, add a splash of water to prevent it from drying and clumping.
Season with fish sauce and black pepper.
Add the drained bitter melon and stir lightly. Cook for 2 minutes.
Beat the eggs in a bowl then add to the pan. Mix lightly until the egg is cooked. Turn off the heat and serve.

name: Savory Roasted Vegetables
directions: Preheat over to 400 °F (205 °C). Wash all vegetables and cut/cube to even 1" pieces, carrots cut diagonally and leave the green beans whole.
Pour all vegetables into a very large bowl. Add olive oil over the bowl and drop in the dry seasonings. Mix well using clean hands or a large wooden spoon.

Spread raw vegetables evenly on two, 15"x20" baking sheets. Add both pans to oven and roast for 20 minutes. Give vegetables a stir with wooden spoon and switch the rows for the pans. Roast another 20-25 minutes. Check potatoes with fork as indicator of cooked. When potatoes are ready, so is everything else.

Note: No green beans? Use broccoli. Only one yellow squash? Toss in a cubed eggplant instead. Looking for Moroccan flavor? Ditch the steak seasoning for Garam Masala. Extremely tasty and versatile recipe.

name: Scallion Bread
ingredients: 1 cup chopped scallions or spring onions
directions: Mix wet ingredients in a medium sized bowl. Add dry yeast.
Add flour and salt. Use a spatula to combine. Mix until the flour is mostly absorbed and soft dough forms.
Knead the softened butter into the dough until elastic.
Place into a greased bowl and let rise for 1 to 2 hours until the dough doubles in size.
Cut dough in half. Scatter some scallions onto the table. Roll the dough.
Cut into 6 pieces and place the bread into a 7" x 4" loaf pan. The pieces should be standing vertically and should look like a loaf with cuts in it. Repeat this for the other half of dough.
Let it rise for 45 minutes then egg wash. Bake at pre-heated oven at 350°F for 20-25 minutes until golden.

name: Scrambled Eggs
directions: Mix eggs, shredded cheese, and whipping cream. Season to taste.
Melt butter in a skillet and pour egg mixture.
Cook until firm and ready.

name: Seafood Salad
directions: Make sure all ingredients are thawed but still cool.
Drain any liquid from shrimp or crab meat (you can use real crab meat if you prefer).
Mince or chop shrimp and crab to personal preference (try a combination of minced, finely chopped and loosely chopped).
Mix all ingredients.
To serve put on crackers, put the mixture on a bun/roll for a sub. Serve on top of a tossed salad or you can cook pasta and mix it in.

name: Sesame Chicken
ingredients: 1 1/2 lbs boneless skinless Chicken Breast, cut into 1" pieces
directions: Whisk together broth, brown sugar, cornstarch, vinegar, soy sauce, sriracha, honey and oil in a slow cooker. Stir in chicken.
Cover and cook on high for 2 1/2 hours, or until juices run clear when chicken is pierced, stirring after 1 1/2 hours.
Steam sugar snap peas and carrots over boiling water until tender. Stir vegetable mixture and sesame seeds into slow cooker.
Serve over hot cooked rice (if desired).

name: Shirataki Noodles with Bean Sprouts & Red Curry
ingredients: 2/3 cup green & red peppers & onion strips
7 oz petite cut diced tomatoes with zesty jalapenos
directions: Rinse shirataki noodles in cold water and set aside.
Boil chayote and jicama until tender along with ginger. Drain and set aside.
In large frying pan saute bean sprouts, chayote, jicama along with peppers, onion and diced tomatoes with zesty jalapenos.
Stir in the red curry paste.
You can either combine the noodles or serve on top.
Note: for added taste you may add chicken, pork, diced sausage and so on.

name: Shirazi Salad
directions: Dice tomatoes, cucumber and onion. Add mint, salt and pepper.
Leave for 20 minutes in the fridge.
Add lime juice. Leave for 1 hour in the fridge.

name: Shrimp & Asparagus with Bacon & Parmesan
directions: Cook Canadian bacon in 1 tablespoon of olive oil until crispy. Set aside.
Cook shrimp in 2 tablespoons of olive oil with salt and pepper. Set aside.
